headline: Co-Founder @ PayDiverse | 🚀 Helping High-Risk Merchants Get Approved | 🔹 Merchant Processing | 🔹 Payment Solutions & ISO Partnerships | 🎙️ Host of The Payments Guy Podcast
about:
💳 Need Reliable Merchant Accounts or Payment Solutions?

Finding the right payment processor can be frustrating—especially if you’re in a high-risk industry. Banks see risk. I help them see potential.

As a merchant solutions expert, I specialize in placing both high- and low-risk businesses with banking partners who offer stable, long-term merchant accounts and payment solutions.

🚀 What I Do:
✔️ Match merchants with domestic & offshore banking partners for secure merchant accounts
✔️ Help businesses get approved—fast & with fewer headaches
✔️ Offer payment solutions beyond processing: chargeback protection, fraud prevention, and alternative payments

💼 Services We Provide:
🔹 Domestic & Offshore Merchant Accounts / MID Placement
🔹 Alternative Payment Solutions (Prepaid Virtual Cards, ACH Check Processing)
🔹 Chargeback Prevention & Fraud Protection
🔹 Multi-Currency Settlement & Secure Payment Gateway
🔹 Call Center Support & Compliance Assistance

🎙️ Host of The Payments Guy Podcast – Sharing insights on payment processing, underwriting, and banking partnerships.

📢 Let’s Connect!
🔹 Merchants: Need a merchant account? Get started here: https://paydiverse.com/signup/
🔹 Banking Partners & ISOs: Let’s discuss how we can work together!

📧 Email: frank@paydiverse.com | 📞 Call: 347-391-8921

Specialties: Merchant Accounts, Payment Solutions, Chargeback Reduction, High-Risk Processing, Banking Partnerships

experiences.title: Co-Founder & Principal
experiences.jobDescription:
At PayDiverse, we help high-risk merchants connect with banks who want their business long-term. We provide diversified solutions suitable for nearly every type of high-risk merchant account.

Looking for unique digital processing solutions? Reach out!

experiences.title: Co-Founder & Principal
experiences.jobDescription:
Merchant solutions expert specializing in placing high- and low-risk merchants with the right merchant bank for their needs.

A self-starter and entrepreneur, I'm passionate about helping merchants grow their businesses.

I help merchants apply for merchant accounts with both domestic and overseas banks. 

While we specialize in credit card processing, Elm Payments provides a wide range of services for merchants to help them run their business better, including:

• Domestic and Offshore Merchant Account / MID Placement
• Prepaid Virtual Cards
• Chargeback Prevention
• Call Center Support
• ACH Check Processing
• Secure Payment Gateway
• Fraud Prevention
• Multi-Currency Settlement

When you work with me I promise the following:

• Large network of banks increases your chances of getting a merchant account
• Personal service through our team of experienced account managers
• Fast response time to get you processing quickly

experiences.title: Marketing Manager II
experiences.jobDescription:
I'm responsible for conceptualizing customer acquisition marketing plans for new verticals and partnering with internal teams and external vendors to execute marketing tactics. I'm responsible for driving traffic from Amazon.com to Amazon Local through strategic placements and cross-org partnerships. I conceptualize curated merchandising pages and special events on local.amazon.com to help customers discover inventory across Amazon Local's various products (Deals, Restaurants, Travel, Beauty). I work with creative, editorial, sales, operations, development, and product partners to execute marketing tactics and improve internal platforms. On the Amazon Local site I have ownership of merchandising placements for Amazon Local Deals, Amazon Local Restaurants, Amazon Local Beauty, and Amazon Local Travel across desktop and mobile.

•	Led cross-channel consumer launch plan for Amazon Local Marketplace and Amazon Local Restaurants, leading to 150% increase in click volume month-over-month in Q4
•	Partnered proactively with Amazon.com business groups to increase awareness around the Amazon Local platform (and customer opportunity). Presented across various executive levels 
•	Managed cross-channel holiday merchandising events, including targeted banner advertising on Amazon.com driving relevant traffic to Amazon Local deals
•	Created customized merchandising deals and pages for highest priority enterprise customers, provide additional exposure to drive traffic, product engagement and revenue

experiences.title: Account Manager II, National Production Team
experiences.jobDescription:
As a National Account Manager I manage strategic partnerships with national brands, hotel merchants, and Amazon.com owned & operated businesses. I partner with Sales and merchants to understand their goals, and advise on the best way to utilize the Amazon Local platform to accomplish those goals. I'm the primary contact for Amazon.com businesses who want to utilize Amazon Local's deals platform to merchandise special offers to Amazon Local customers. I help partners structure an offer that protects their bottom line while ensuring a high bar is met for the quality of the offers, always advocating for a great customer experience and ensuring all parties meet or exceed their goals.

•	Managed +$6M portfolio, responsible for activating +500K new customers and delivering +275 individual offers across Amazon Local sites in 2013
•	Collaborated with internal Amazon business units to successfully launch over 100 Amazon-specific deals to the millions of Amazon Local subscribers
•	Partnered w/ sales team and enterprise clients to fully understand campaign goals & develop portfolio plan to drive product delivery, customer satisfaction, revenue, and resigns
•	Interviewed sales and operations candidates interested in joining Amazon Local team across US offices

experiences.title: Account Manager II, Direct Deals Production Team
experiences.jobDescription:
I manage deal inventory and selection for the most profitable Amazon Local geographic regions.  I ensure a wide selection of relevant inventory is sent to customers in regions in New Jersey and NYC, and optimize for revenue by guiding and directing sellers to close specific inventory categories and deal concepts.  Once my sellers onboard a new merchant, I own and manage the relationship ensuring my merchants stay happy and accomplish their goals, while advocating for a great customer experience.

•	Analyzed and presented regional performance data (weekly) to maximize customer revenue. Data informed inventory and offer scheduling for east region (most profitable) 
•	Improved self-service production tools and analytics reporting by proactively participating in beta testing opportunities across engineering teams

experiences.title: Account Manager, Client Services

I manage every post-sale aspect of a campaign including obtaining creative assets, tracking tags, reporting, and optimizing campaigns.  I work directly with clients, agencies, internal and external creative teams, sales managers, Ad Operations, and Network Development.  My role is pivotal to the success of campaigns, and one of the primary responsibilities of my job is to provide a great customer experience.

•	Named lead Account Manager, responsible for training new hires on client service best practices, portfolio management and driving revenue through data analytics

headline: Helping CIOs, CISOs & MSPs Cost-Effectively Implement Enterprise-Grade XDR & MDR | 24/7 Streamlined Security Operations | SOC | Next-Gen SIEM | EDR | NDR | mXDR | Cloud Security | Identity Protection
about:
Protecting Businesses from Cyber Threats – 24/7 Security Operations & Enterprise-Grade MDR/XDR Solutions

Cyberattacks, ransomware, and data breaches cost organizations millions in losses and operational disruptions. Whether employees are in the office, remote, or accessing cloud systems, threats are constant.

That’s where my team and I come in.

With over two decades in cybersecurity, I’ve worked with top organizations like Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), Philip Morris, Altria, Kraft Foods, EDS, Rogers Communications, and a global law firm, where I served as CISO, digital forensics expert, and incident responder.

These experiences gave me deep insight into the security challenges organizations face—and how to solve them.

I built a 24/7 Security Operations Center (SOC) in Florida and a cloud-based security infrastructure in AWS that monitors and analyzes activity across every layer of an organization, including:
✔ Networks
✔ Endpoints
✔ Users
✔ Applications
✔ Data
✔ Cloud Services

Using advanced security technologies—SIEM, EDR, BDR, XDR, MDR, and mXDR—we detect and mitigate threats in real time.

Through partnerships with industry leaders like CrowdStrike, Corelight, Cribl, Proofpoint, Microsoft, Cisco, and AWS, we deliver enterprise-grade Managed Detection & Response (MDR) for highly regulated industries such as finance, healthcare, manufacturing, education, and legal.

As the Founder of Vijilan Security, I’ve dedicated my career to helping businesses—especially MSPs, CIOs, and CISOs—achieve scalable, reliable, and round-the-clock cybersecurity.

✔ 24/7 monitoring & rapid threat response
✔ Enterprise-grade security for SMBs & large organizations
✔ A dedicated security team that integrates seamlessly with yours

Let’s talk about how we can protect your business from cyber threats.

Email me: Kevin.Nejad@vijilan.com
Website: www.vijilan.com
More about me: https://cyberkayvon.com/

P.S. I’ve helped many entrepreneurs launch their own cybersecurity division—let’s connect if you’re looking to do the same!

experiences.title: Founder and CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
Architected and implemented state-of-the-art Security Operations Centers (SOCs), integrating advanced SIEM, XDR, MDR, and MXDR solutions to provide seamless 24/7 monitoring and protection for diverse IT environments.
	•	Drove strategic partnerships with leading technology providers, including CrowdStrike, Cribl, and Corelight, to deliver cutting-edge cybersecurity solutions tailored to MSPs and small to medium-sized businesses.
	•	Delivered transformative security improvements for global clients across industries—healthcare, finance, education, and government—through consultative expertise in building and optimizing SOCs and managed security services.
	•	Oversaw the recruitment and development of high-performing SOC teams, fostering excellence in hybrid cloud monitoring and incident response across complex IT infrastructures.

updates.postText:
What’s happening in Iran isn’t a revolution. It’s incident response.

In cybersecurity, the most dangerous intrusions aren’t the loud ones.
They’re the ones that move in quietly, rewrite policies, replace administrators, and convince everyone they belong.

Sometimes attackers stay in a system for years.

Iran has lived with an intrusion for decades.

And every incident responder knows this truth:
time inside the environment does not equal legitimacy.
It only means detection took too long.

No intrusion, no matter how long it lasts, survives once visibility and control are restored.

#RezaPahlavi #WomanLifeFreedom #FreeIran
#GlobalSecurity #Iran #DigitalBlackoutIran

The day fighter jets ripped through Tehran's sky, my mother taught me that survival isn't just about holding on—

it's about who you're holding onto.

In 1979, during the revolution in Iran, our world flipped upside down. 

It was like stepping into an alternate reality, where every freedom we’d taken for granted was suddenly gone.

One day, the sirens blared on the radio, alarming us that fighter jets had entered the capital, bombing the airports. 

I vividly remember being at my aunt’s house when my mom grabbed my hand, rushed us into the basement parking lot, and hid behind a car for shelter.

The sound of bombings filled the air, the sound of windows shattering. I could hear children scream and cry.

In the middle of the chaos, I asked my mom, "Are we going to die?" She looked into my eyes, tears streaming down her face, held me close, and said, "Not as long as you hold on to me as tightly as you can."

I don’t remember ever holding on to anyone as tightly as I held on to my mom that day. Those words were very reassuring, comforting, simple yet so powerful. it felt like a shield surrounding me.

I felt comforted and reassured.

That moment taught me a lesson I carry to this day. In the worst situations, providing reassurance and taking action can be the difference between panic and peace.

Fast forward to today, I find myself in a different kind of battle, protecting the digital world through cybersecurity. 

My priorities remain the same, protecting the most important people in my life, my family, friends, team members at Vijilan, our partners, and their clients.

When I was searching for ally in my venture who truly cared about protecting people and their digital lives, 

I came across Falcon.  It wasn’t just the most advanced technology I’d seen, it was the heart behind it that won me over. 

The people behind Falcon genuinely care about their clients. They go above and beyond, treating every client like a partner and every person they protect like a human being.

Their mission, to stop breaches, spoke volumes to me. I couldn’t have chosen a better ally than CrowdStrike! 

Falcon helps me and my clients sleep better at night

It reminds me that whether in life or cybersecurity, the right people can make all the difference.

https://lnkd.in/g5WA67bU

#KayVon #iran #persian #zoroastrian #crowdstrike

It was such a pleasure to share the stage with such a legend, Sunny Kaila at IT BY DESIGN 

#mdr #mxdr #siem #soc #SeeWhatHappens

Make Money, Make Sense.

Key Accomplishments:

●	Increased Revenue from $31.6 to $127 million through acquiring assets of clients, delivering the presidential program, and organic growth.

volunteerAndAwards.role: Treasurer, Member of the Founding Board of Trustees
volunteerAndAwards.description:
Member of the Founding Board of Trustees for Legacy Collegiate Academy, a proposed PK-8 charter school for students of Washington, DC.  

The mission of Legacy Collegiate: Legacy Collegiate Academy educates PK-8 students to thrive in and graduate from college through rigorous instruction and character development provided within a structured joyful school culture.

Proposed Lead Founder, Nicole John, is completing the prestigious Building Excellent Schools Fellowship. Ms. John is conducting an in-depth study of the nation’s highest performing charter schools to identify best practices in order to inform the design of Legacy Collegiate.  The BES Fellowship - a rigorous, yearlong, comprehensive training program in charter school creation and leadership - has resulted in the establishment of over 60 schools in 20 cities in 12 states and the District of Columbia that serve as national models of superior performance. BES holds the core belief that academic performance drives every element of a school, including design, leadership, culture, decisions, and governance, and that accountability drives academic achievement.

recommendationsReceived.subtitle: #AI Advisor helping ops leads become system architects before AI does it for them | Mental Hygienist
recommendationsReceived.context: Kirk was Michael's client
recommendationsReceived.description:
I have had the pleasure of engaging with Kirk W. McLaren, a distinguished Growth CFO and a wealth of knowledge in the field of financial management and strategic business growth. Kirk’s profound expertise, drawn from extensive experiences with organizations like Foresight CFO and his academic role at Georgetown University, uniquely positions him to drive significant value for any business aiming to scale efficiently and sustainably.

Kirk’s approach combines deep analytical acumen with a strategic vision that transcends traditional financial management. He has a proven track record of not only enhancing financial performance but also building robust infrastructures that empower businesses to achieve and exceed their goals. Whether it’s creating a path for growth, navigating complex financial environments, or preparing companies for future success, Kirk’s guidance is indispensable.

His accolades, including being a Forbes #1 Best Selling author and his contributions to increasing organizational revenues and profitability, speak volumes of his capability to transform challenges into opportunities for growth. I highly recommend Kirk to any CEO or business owner looking to secure a sharp and experienced CFO who can contribute effectively from day one.

For those interested in leveraging top-tier financial strategies to elevate their company's performance, Kirk McLaren is the quintessential partner you would want on your team.

recommendationsReceived.name: Rob Daly
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Founder, CEO, etc. at Catalyst Technology and Any Stupid Idea
recommendationsReceived.context: Rob was Kirk's client
recommendationsReceived.description: I met Kirk and Foresight CFO through Henri Schauffler and CEO Focus. Kirk is excellent, as are his people. He has not only driven our needed CFO functions, he is also a big fan of john Warrillow (as you can tell from this mailing) and works in conjunction with him via the ValueBuilder system. We have been working through the system for a few months now -- I love the conscious act and introspection, and it is certainly helping us focus on the important, value building essentials that will ultimately lead to a greater and more highly-prized Stelligent.

recommendations.name: Gordon Stein MBA, CSC, CFEI
recommendations.subtitle: Keynote Speaker & Author of Cashflow Cookbook💰Podcast guest 💰Credit union leagues, wealth advisors, meeting planners & corporations, I'll show your audience how to grow their wealth & ease their #1 stress: their money!
recommendations.description:
Gordon has a unique and powerful approach to financial wellness. He developed receipies to live, spend less, and invest to get a second payday.  Plus he is fun to collaborate with. 

I loved his book, Cashflow Cookbook, and had him on my podcast to inspire my listeners with his ideas on building wealth and on how to find meaning once they have it. I recommend Cashflow Cookbook and Gordon’s unique skill as a speaker to inspire through storytelling.

recommendations.name: Howard Goldberg
recommendations.subtitle: Freelance Project Editor – Providing Online Content and Audience Engagement Solutions
recommendations.context: Kirk worked with Howard but they were at different companies
recommendations.description:
Howard worked side by side with me to write our book - The Growth CFO Void.  

What I love about working with Howard is that he "gets it."  He was always prepared, did research, and each time we spoke the next version of our writing correctly captured what we spoke about. 

The process of translating our approach to business building and financial management for CEOs of private companies was beneficial in and of itself.  We gained clarity, changed what we focus on the front stage, and have stories to tell that accelerate understanding and trust. 

I highly recommend that you at least discuss your objectives and project/work with Howard to see if it is in his sweet spot.

jobTitle: Senior Sales Director of Compliance - MSP Sales
about:
At ControlCase, I am passionate about forging vital compliance partnerships within the MSP ecosystem. Leveraging my extensive expertise, I focus on driving market expansion and revenue growth. My team and I are dedicated to developing innovative strategies that streamline compliance processes for our clients, enhancing their overall cybersecurity posture.

Our commitment to excellence results in tangible increases in efficiency and client satisfaction. By integrating cutting-edge solutions and fostering strong relationships, we empower MSPs to navigate the complexities of compliance with confidence and ease. 

With a proactive approach and a deep understanding of the industry, I strive to deliver exceptional value and support to our partners, ensuring they stay ahead in the ever-evolving landscape of cybersecurity and compliance.

I am delighted to write a LinkedIn recommendation for Maria, who has been an exceptional asset to our team and has consistently demonstrated outstanding skills in relationship building, product knowledge, account management, client satisfaction, and renewals and retention.
Maria has a remarkable talent for forging strong relationships with Managed Service Providers (MSPs). Her ability to connect with MSPs on a personal level, understand their unique needs, and build trust has been instrumental in expanding our network of partners. Through her efforts, we have seen a significant increase in collaboration and mutually beneficial partnerships with MSPs, resulting in substantial business growth.
One of Maria's greatest strengths is her deep product knowledge. She consistently goes above and beyond to stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends, technologies, and solutions. This expertise allows her to provide valuable insights and guidance to both our team and our clients. Her dedication to continuous learning and self-improvement is truly commendable.
In terms of account management, Maria is unparalleled. She keenly understands each client's unique requirements and ensures that their needs are met with utmost professionalism and efficiency. Her proactive problem-solving approach and ability to anticipate potential issues have resulted in consistently high client satisfaction levels. Clients appreciate her responsiveness, attention to detail, and commitment to delivering exceptional service.
Furthermore, she has played a pivotal role in driving renewals and retention. She understands the importance of nurturing client relationships beyond the initial sale. By actively engaging with clients, addressing their concerns, and providing ongoing support, she has successfully secured numerous renewals and fostered long-term loyalty. Her dedication to client success is evident in the high renewal rates and positive feedback we receive from our valued customers.
Overall, Maria is an invaluable team member who consistently exceeds expectations. Her exceptional relationship-building skills, extensive product knowledge, account management expertise, client-centric approach, and ability to drive renewals and retention make her an indispensable asset to any organization.
I wholeheartedly recommend her for any opportunity where her skills and dedication can be utilized to drive success. She is a true professional who consistently goes above and beyond to deliver outstanding results.
Sincerely,
Pat Jamison

headline: Vice President Of Sales at OffenderWatch with expertise in team building and sales strategy.
about:
As the Vice President of Sales at OffenderWatch, my drive is fueled by the relentless pursuit of sales excellence and robust relationship building. My journey began at the University of Kentucky, where the foundations of my sales acumen were laid. Now, I leverage my expertise to spearhead OffenderWatch market expansion while delivering unparalleled service and dependability to our clients.

My role is characterized by the creation and implementation of innovative sales strategies and training programs that have been instrumental in driving our regional growth. The competencies honed during my tenure at AT&T and Vexus Fiber such as leading market initiatives and engaging with state policy, continue to enrich our team's performance and reinforce my commitment to achieving the optimal result for our clients and their communities.

recommendationsReceived.name: John Raines
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: USDA
recommendationsReceived.context: John managed Kitt directly
recommendationsReceived.description: I immediately knew Kitt was the perfect fit for our organization as soon as I hired him.  His positive energy and  tireless efforts gave our team an advantage and made him stand out as a leader.  Kitt never failed in exceeding goals.  He met challenges head on and was never scared of trying a new approach.  It was great to see Kitt coach and be a mentor to his sellers. Showing and owning the how and why was why he was successful.  Not many people have this genuine ability.  Kitt does and it's why anyone would be lucky to have him as a part of their team.

He has a very effective leadership style and a positive, easy to work with personality.

He consistently held himself to higher standards than his peers and always delivered great results. Hayden has consistently proven himself to be a reliable worker and a great asset to any organization he is a part of.

recommendations.description: Jennifer was one of the most involved and strategic sales managers I have ever had the opportunity to work under. Her fair and consistent coaching was instrumental in my development as a Retail Sales Manager with AT&T. Jennifer was always encouraging and innovative, which made her a joy to work for and helped drive huge sales performance know my locations.

recommendations.name: Neel Kallianpur
recommendations.subtitle: Professional Sales Consultant
recommendations.context: Kitt managed Neel directly
recommendations.description:
I had the privilege to manage Neel as his Retail Store Manager with AT&T. During my time managing Neel, he regularly outperformed all sales expectations. This included multiple months where Neel not only lead our store in sales, but also the whole louisiana market. 

When staffing became an issue during Covids emergence: Neel would always show up early to help management with inventory audits. Neel would also often stay well beyond his scheduled hours to ensure that we always had enough sales people to run the business. 

Overall, Neel is one of the hardest and smartest workers I have yet to manage. I would (without hesitation) hire him to any positions I have available and I look forward to seeing his future success!

headline: Board-Level Advisor to MSP CEOs | Designing MSPs for $25M+ Enterprise Value
about:
Most MSPs never reach $10M in revenue.
Even fewer build a company that operates like a real asset.

Over the last 20+ years, I have worked in the MSP industry as an owner, executive, and advisor, with a consistent focus on enterprise value creation.

My background includes:
	•	Building multiple MSPs
	•	Selling an MSP to private equity
	•	Participating in numerous MSP M&A transactions
	•	Serving on the leadership team of a fast-growing MSP with $40M+ in revenue
	•	Advising MSP owners as they design value creation models aligned to their personal wealth goals

Today, I work as a board-level advisor to MSP CEOs. I help leaders design and scale their businesses with the fundamentals that drive long-term value:
	•	Leadership structure and accountability
	•	Financial discipline and margin architecture
	•	Operational maturity and service delivery performance
	•	Growth strategy and the tradeoffs that protect valuation
	•	Optionality, whether the goal is exit, recapitalization, or long-term ownership

This work is for owners who are already successful, but want to build something more durable. A company that can grow without the founder becoming the constraint.

If you are building an MSP as an asset and want a senior perspective to help you make better decisions at the moments that matter most, send me a message here on LinkedIn.

experiences.title: Board-Level Advisor to MSP CEOs
experiences.jobDescription:
I advise MSP CEOs as they design and scale their businesses with enterprise value in mind.

This work focuses on helping owners move from operator-driven growth to durable, leadership-led organizations that are profitable, scalable, and attractive to long-term capital.

My role is not to run the business or provide tactics. It is to help leaders make better decisions at the moments that matter most, including:
	•	Strategic direction and growth tradeoffs
	•	Leadership structure and accountability
	•	Financial discipline and margin architecture
	•	Enterprise value drivers and valuation readiness
	•	Owner transition from operator to asset builder

My perspective is shaped by over two decades inside the MSP industry, including:
	•	Building multiple MSPs
	•	Selling an MSP to private equity
	•	Participating in numerous MSP M&A transactions
	•	Serving on the leadership team of a $40M+ MSP
	•	Advising MSP owners as they design value creation models aligned to their personal wealth goals

The CEOs I work with are typically successful, but at an inflection point. They are scaling complexity faster than leadership depth, or growing revenue without clarity on what actually drives long-term value.

The outcome of this work is not just growth.
It is a company designed to compound value over time.

experiences.companyName: Service Leadership Inc., a ConnectWise company
experiences.title: Peer Group Facilitator, Certified OML Coach and Consultant, Service Leadership OML Peer Groups
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Service Leadership Certified Coach and Facilitator for OML peer groups, I guide elite Managed Service Providers (MSPs) on their journey to operational excellence and increased profitability. My role involves:

- Facilitating high-impact peer group sessions for large 8-figure MSPs, fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing
- Leveraging Service Leadership's proprietary Operational Maturity Level (OML) framework to assess and elevate MSP performance
- Providing expert coaching on best practices to drive profitability, operational efficiency, and strategic growth
- Analyzing key performance indicators and benchmarking data to identify improvement opportunities
- Guiding MSP leaders in developing and implementing action plans to increase their Operational Maturity Level

With a deep understanding of the MSP business model and industry trends, I help member companies optimize their operations, enhance service delivery, and achieve sustainable financial success. My facilitation creates a confidential environment where industry leaders can openly discuss challenges, share insights, and collectively elevate the standard of excellence in the MSP community.

experiences.title: Strategic Coach
experiences.jobDescription:
As a Strategic Coach, I specialize in helping MSPs and other TSPs (Technology Services Providers) to maximize their vision and implement tools to ignite and sustain growth.

Every company has some sort of goal. Just like in a sport, every team has the same goal - to win the game. What sets the winners apart from the losers? The system they have to achieve that goal. I help MSPs implement the right system to achieve their goals.

Ready to level up your MSP? Let's talk.



At the heart of MSP+OS are six key components that guide every facet of our operations and set us apart as industry leaders:

🔹 Visionary Leadership: In this role, I'm not just setting goals; I'm crafting the future. I outline the strategic blueprint and long-term vision that direct every initiative and decision at MSP+OS.

🔸 People Management: People are more than resources; they are the catalyst for our innovation. I foster an environment that empowers each team member to become an industry leader.

🔹 Strategic Growth: Growth isn't just a metric; it's a multifaceted strategy. I take a hands-on approach in steering the company through acquisitions, partnerships, and sustainable expansion.

🔸 Operational Excellence: Operations aren't just about tasks; they're the backbone of our business. I implement systems and practices that ensure our operations are efficient, scalable, and harmonious.

🔹 Profit Optimization: Profit isn't just revenue; it's a tool for impact. I meticulously manage our financial portfolio to maximize reinvestment and societal contributions.

🔸 Security and Trust: Security is more than firewalls; it's the bedrock of client relationships. I prioritize cutting-edge security measures to establish a foundation of trust and integrity.

experiences.title: Chief Technology Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
CTO at DSOT - Data Systems of Texas is the Southwest Partner of the Sharetec Credit Union System.  Serving credit unions since 1982, Data Systems provides credit unions with both in-house and service bureau solutions.  Our software offers the latest technology, excellent service and support, and quality business continuity plans. Visit us at http://datasystx.com or email us at sales@datasystemstx.com.

Sharetec Systems, Inc. was formed in 1993 when four companies formed a partnership committed to developing a very simple, yet robust data processing solution for its customers. The partners had a vision whereby sharing technology, hence the name Sharetec, and resources, they could offer a unique service solution to their regional territories. The partners, each owning 25% of Sharetec System, Inc., divided the country into regions, where each partner would provide sales, service and support for the Sharetec product.
 
The Sharetec partners, by combining its resources, employ over 250 employees, have over $100 million in revenues and support more than 300 credit unions nationwide using its core system.

experiences.title: Chief Financial Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Full P&L and financial management for a Best-In-Class Managed Services Provider. 

My main areas of focus:

- Corporate Strategy
- Mergers and Acquisitions
- Financial Management
- Business Management
- HR Management

Responsible for our Mergers and Acquisitions activities, including:
- Developing a marketing engine to attract companies for acquisition
- Working with 3rd-party providers to attract and vet acquisition candidates
- Analysis and due diligence for acquisition candidates
- Acquisition and integration planning and execution

My primary day-to-day responsibility and focus is to build a department that effectively supports the company in four major dimensions: 
1. Activities of daily living - A/R, A/P, Payroll and the administrative aspects of the company, including HR, office management, facilities and other internal administrative functions. 
2. FP&A - not just numbers and not just retrospective but the key forward-looking metrics (including Engineering performance, sales performance, etc.) which are needed to manage the business, prospectively on a daily basis.
3. Management of the operating economics of the company. Any company needs a Finance organization that can work with the rest of the company to optimize the operating economics over time. 
4. Business judgment and decision-making - Finance is at the heart of sound judgment and decision-making and every CEO needs a partner in making sure that the company is doing the best job possible in decision making. This includes contract negotiations.

experiences.title: CEO
experiences.jobDescription:
We are here because a new education economy is emerging. The 1900’s method of education is over, and those who are slow to adapt are only beginning to realize the pain. Families are spending a small fortune to educate their children and companies are spending a fortune to recruit them, yet education-related debt and employee disengagement both continue to rise.

Our mission is to make the education economy fruitful for our users by helping them return to the old paths of vocational discipleship where families can secure free challenges, job shadows and internships for their children and contract with companies for apprenticeships. Our core business is helping young people connect with their life's calling earlier so they can enjoy their work and reach their potential. 
We enable professionals and organizations to support young people in their pursuit of their life’s calling with a full software suite and niche recruiting services.  

internrocket users are young people working to connect with their life’s calling and professionals who already have, helping them along their way. Organizations on our platform are primarily giving in to this cause. As they serve their communities, they emerge as leaders and benefit from connecting with passionate people who are working to connect with their path to maximum potential. .

I love the integrity with which he operates his business.  On a few occasions I hired Michael to create marketing material for a my business.  Without exception, his work always exceeded my expectations.  Additionally, my clients were pleased with what I was able to present!  What I respect most about Michael is the timeliness of his services.  Each project was always delivered on time, if not early.  Such punctuality and dependability made it much easier for me to focus and produce better results.  That's a winning combination!

recommendationsReceived.description: Mr. Somers is a professional individual that I had the pleasure of attending class with at Illinois State University's College of Business. During my time working with Mr. Somers I learned of his strong work ethic, steadfastness, and focus on completing the task at hand. One example of Mr. Somers' ability to manage includes that of the leadership that was shown in the process of organizing an optional study group. There was an amazing turnout with around 90% of the class attending regularly and greatly benefiting from the group. Mr. Somers would be an asset to any organization.

recommendationsReceived.description: I want to thank you for putting together such a great website! The entire process was easy and very interactive. All of my concerns were addressed with care and you always made sure I understood the entire process. Within 2 days of launch, the website generated new clients and prospects. I am confident the website is going to help us meet our production goals. Thanks again!

recommendationsReceived.name: Corbin Pitts
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Microsoft Security | Zero Trust | Cloud Security | Compliance | Identity | XDR
recommendationsReceived.description: Mr. Michael Somers is a highly ambitious and knowledgeable business professional.  As his roommate and fellow student, I was always impressed with how well he managed his time, focusing on both his entrepreneurial ventures and his demanding coursework.  Michael emerged as a clear leader at Illinois State University’s College of Business in each of his three areas of focus which included: Entrepreneurship, Small Business Management and Economics.  I worked alongside Michael on various projects and he was always a pleasure to work with.  His experience as a young professional with Illinois Roofing Company, a commercial roofing company, brought great insight and credibility to his contributions, making him a go-to member on any team.  Michael’s leadership was always well received by our student teams and faculty at the University.  Michael’s numerous honors and awards are a testament to his hard work and his enthusiastic drive to improve his skills and prepare himself for the future.  It has come as no surprise to me that this talented, charismatic individual whom I have had the pleasure of knowing for 7+ years has already managed to develop a successful business.  I am happy to call Michael one of my best friends and hope to create a successful venture with him in the coming years.  Today, as a business professional with Cisco Systems, I continue to turn to Mr. Somers for career coaching.  Having him in my corner as a advisor has proven to be invaluable.

recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Business Professor | Independent Management Consultant | Career and Management Coach | Employee Retention Specialist | Author and Editor

In addition, he demonstrated resourcefulness through many assignments, and was rated highly by peers as a valuable team member.  Michael is an outstanding student in all respects, and is set to go far in whatever career field he chooses. Work ethic is outstanding. I will be following his career with great interest!

Terry Lowe

headline: Experienced Executive Leader | Helping businesses become more profitable by optimizing operational expenses
about:
When I take on a challenge, I recall the quote: “just another cold, dark night on the side of Everest.” It reminds me that when you take on something difficult, it should be no surprise that it IS difficult, and that experiencing difficulty is often the price of doing something worthwhile. I co-founded Davis Square Group to acquire, grow, and sell a business, and in 2015 we purchased Adtech Systems. The Adtech journey was difficult, but those difficulties were expected and, ultimately, worthwhile when we successfully exited Adtech with a strategic sale of the business at the end of 2022. 

When we acquired Adtech, the company lacked structure, workable processes and procedures. We implemented a proper corporate infrastructure, trained personnel, and built systems to operate and manage the business. To grow the company, we targeted enterprise customers who would buy a suite of services, proving us with a reliable recurring revenue stream. We assembled a team of like-minded individuals who shared our vision and embodied the Adtech core values. Some of my successful initiatives include:  


Contact: philmuscatello@gmail.com

We deliver objective advice and analysis to ensure you are receiving exactly what your business needs, at the best price, and not paying for services you don't need or use.

We built a great team, put in strong sales leaders, and formalized selling process.

headline: Golf Industry Founder | AI-Driven Golf Operations & Procurement Intelligence | Former President, Wittek Golf | Wittek Legacy Since 1946 | The RangeGoat
addressWithCountry: North Palm Beach, Florida, United States
about:
I grew up in a golf industry family. My grandfather started Wittek Golf Supply in 1946. My father took ownership of the company, and, at a very young age, I became the lead person and ran Wittek Golf for 25+ years. Achievements: I was responsible for over $150M in sales and over $1M in philanthropy to the golf community.

Above all else, I have learned that relationship building is absolutely key to all businesses, and in particular, the golf industry. Working with over 50 PGA and USGA Tour events, relationships matter! Integrity and authenticity are at the top of my traits and I thrive on developing long-term relationships.






“It’s no surprise that Bobby Wittek has 30,000 connections and followers. After all, at least 29,000 PGA Professionals know Bobby because of his company’s products and how important they have been to the success of our golf operations. I would bet that one could find many Wittek products at every golf facility in the world. Who else in America has reached that pinnacle of success? Congratulations, Bobby, for your great achievements and your contributions to the game of golf. You’re an American icon in my book. Wishing you continued success, Bobby.” Billy Burke, PGA Life Member

“Bobby, thank you for breakfast and nice to meet one of the Wittek family members from the iconic golf company, Wittek Golf!” Bob Ford, Seminole Golf Club

To learn more, contact me at   bobjrwittek@yahoo.com  



FOCUS: Golf Operations | Procurement & Cost Control | Reliability & Uptime | AI as a support system | Owners. PGA. GCSAA. CMAA realities

updates.postText:
The golf industry isn’t what it used to be.
Relationships don’t seem to matter like they once did. Respect is fading. Trust is rare.

It used to be about handshakes, integrity, and long-term partnerships. Golf professionals, superintendents, and vendors built decades-long relationships that fueled growth and stability.

Now it feels transactional. Fast. Disposable. And in many cases, disrespectful.

That’s not just disappointing, it’s a warning sign.

When a business stops valuing people, it’s already heading toward decline.

It’s time we bring back the values that made this industry great. Respect. Relationships. Reputation.

 Because in golf, those aren’t just traditions they’re business strategy.
 
#PGAShow2026 #PGA #GolfIndustry #GolfBusiness #GolfFacilities #GolfOperations #GolfCourseManagement #GolfTechnology #GCSAA #NGCOA #CMAA #Leadership #GrowTheGame #Florida #BobbyWittek #Golf #Turf #PalmBeachIsland #HobeSound #JupiterIsland #DemoDays #GRAA #WittekOriginal

The Design Flaw Hiding in Plain Sight for Four Decades 

Failure by Design: The 40-Year Truth
 Behind the 3 & 5 Gang V Shape Picker 

.Bobby Wittek Perspective 

For more than four decades, the 3 & 5 gang V shape ball picker has dominated ranges worldwide. Not because it was exceptional, but because it was inexpensive to build, easy to sell, and profitable to maintain.Here’s the truth the industry rarely said aloud:These pickers were engineered with failure baked into the design. Every nylon or plastic disc expands in the heat and contracts at night, a daily cycle that loosens, warps, and destabilizes the entire system. On multi gang units, that means dozens of inevitable weak points. That’s why  operators spend every season replacing discs just to keep the picker moving.Then come the elbows, steel on steel, grinding under constant stress. A slow sag. A subtle twist.And suddenly you’re replacing elbows once a season, only to discover the A frame has already begun to fatigue.This   isn’t   bad   luck.   This   isn’t   misuse.   This   is   predictable,   repeatable,   costly   design.   The maintenance never stops. The expenses never stop. The failures never stop. “Failure feels normal when nothing is built to last.”For years, operators adapted. Manufacturers profited. And the cycle continued, not because it was right, but because it was the only option the industry was given. After three generations in golf operations, from the tractor seat to the repair bench, the conclusion is unmistakable:Operators deserve better. Golf deserves better. The industry deserves a higher standard.This isn’t about blame. It’s about clarity. It’s about ending the era where predictable failure was accepted  as “normal.”  Because once you  understand why  something breaks,  you understand exactly how to build something that doesn’t #PGAShow #PGA #GolfIndustry #GolfBusiness #GolfFacilities #GolfOperations #USGA #GolfCourseManagement #GolfTechnology #GCSAA #NGCOA #CMAA #Leadership #GrowTheGame #Florida #BobbyWittek #Golf #Turf #PalmBeachIsland #HobeSound #JupiterIsland #Investment #DemoDays #GRAA #WittekOriginal

Forwarded from Billy Burke (https://lnkd.in/etMUpdnn):
It’s no surprise that Bobby Wittek has 30,000 connections and followers. After all, at least 29,000 PGA Professionals know Bobby because of his company’s products and how important they have been to the success of our golf operations. I would bet that one could find many Wittek products at every golf facility in the world. Who else in America has reached that pinnacle of success? Congratulations, Bobby, for your great achievements and your contributions to the game of golf. You’re American icon in my book. 
Wishing you continued success, Bobby,

Billy Burke 
PGA Life Member

patents.title: Golf ball collection apparatus
patents.subtitle: 7462010 · Issued Feb 28, 2006
patents.description: A golfball collecting apparatus is provided including a frame and at least first and second discs mounted to the frame for rotation about an axis, the first and second discs having facing surfaces defining a space therebetween in which golf balls become lodged at a first angular position relative to the axis and are carried with the first and second discs about the axis from the first angular position. A first finger is attached to the frame and has a first end disposed in the space to dislodge golf balls carried with the first and second discs about the axis in a first direction about the axis. A second finger is attached to the frame and has a surface disposed in the space between the first angular location and the end of the first finger to dislodge golf balls carried with the first and second discs about the axis in a second direction about the axis.

Nirvanix churned through six CEOs while burning a total of $70M in funding, the last $25M round from Khosla Ventures in 2012, before abruptly shuttering the following year after IBM allegedly backed away from an acquisition.

In April 2021, Nirvanix was the $1,000 tech category question on the hit show, "JEOPARDY!".

experiences.title: Vice President Marketing
experiences.jobDescription:
Acquired by Brocade in 2006, then Broadcom in 2007.

This was a critical time for the software business as all OEM channels objected to the company selling software, and sales were flailing. Introduced an “outside-in” approach to revamping the product strategy by holding customer summits with executives from EMC, IBM, Hitachi, HP, and others to study friction points with McData software products.

Revamped product strategy to call for new delivery mechanisms, brand new outbound marketing/sales/BD efforts, and development of a new security suite. I worked with my team to build the business cases to secure the funding needed, which did get hard-won approval. While turning the software business, we acquired CNT and Nishan Systems. I assumed management responsibility for the major components of those two businesses. 
- Ten direct reports, ~$400M in topline responsibility across five business lines.
- Product revamp got the Company “Editor’s Choice Award” from Network Computing Magazine in 2004.
- “Well Connected Award” (best in class) from Network Computing Magazine in 2005.

- Grew software revenue from $60M to $220M in eight quarters.

- Closed first software-only OEM deal (NetApp), followed by a second.
- Implemented the company’s very first direct marketing and selling campaigns successfully.
- Named a primary company spokesperson for PR/AR/IR across the Americas, Europe, and Asia.
- Nominated by McDATA for Business 2.0 Magazine’s “Top Tech Execs Under 40 to Watch.”

➡️ Software was the only McDATA product line retained by Brocade following the acquisition in 2006.

updates.postText:
Build It. Test It. Prove It.
Develop a Sales & Marketing MVP Alongside Your Product MVP

There’s a moment in every startup’s journey when the founder turns to the team and says: “We need a real marketing leader.” It’s an understandable impulse. Growth is flattening. Sales cycles are inconsistent. There’s pressure from the board to “build the brand.” Everyone wants a silver bullet — and it seems like the right CMO could be it. But here’s the reality: hiring a full-time CMO or VP of Marketing too early is one of the most expensive missteps a tech startup can make. And worse — it can slow your momentum more than it helps. At The Artesian Network, we’ve helped dozens of venture-backed startups scale from early traction to repeatable revenue. Our strong stance is this: Don’t hire a full-time marketing executive until after you’ve raised your Series B. Why? Because until that point, your company likely hasn’t yet achieved a repeatable, predictable revenue model — the single most important signal that it’s time to scale. That means the core go-to-market playbook still needs to be tested, built, and proven. In other words, you haven’t validated your Marketing and Sales MVP — a concept I explain in detail in this post: 🔗 Build It. Test It. Prove It. Why Full-Time Marketing Hires Often Fail Pre-Scale The most common mistake we see? Startups up-title a smart, hardworking marketer from a larger tech company into a VP or CMO role. They’ve got pedigree. A strong resume. They know the jargon and have seen big growth in action. But two structural problems usually arise: 1. They Lack Startup Pattern Recognition Big company success doesn’t always translate to early-stage scrappiness. In fact, it often gets in the way. Pattern recognition doesn’t come from theory. It comes from repetition — having lived through multiple GTM experiments across multiple startups. From knowing which early signals matter and which are just noise. A great early-stage marketing leader has failed — and learned — enough to know when to push, when to pause, and how to prioritize when every dollar matters. 2. They Think Like Operators, Not Scientists Startups don’t need marketers who optimize what already works. They need marketers who discover what works in the first place. That requires a scientific mindset — grounded in testing, learning, and iterating. Unfortunately, most marketers from big orgs are trained for efficiency, not efficacy. Their world is about incremental lift — not building from zero. What early-stage companies need are experimentalists. Systems thinkers. Growth hackers. Not just brand architects or content producers. 3. Speed Is Your Only Advantage Your only sustainable competitive advantage as a startup is speed — speed to market, speed to learn, speed to pivot. But building a full in-house team? It takes months — time most startups don’t have. And capital you probably can’t afford to burn. It can take 2–4 months to recruit a CMO. Then that CMO has to onboard and spend another 3–6 months building a team: demand gen, content, product marketing, brand, and ops. A seasoned fractional marketing team plugs in by week one. They bring: An integrated team of specialists Proven GTM systems Best practices from dozens of startups A cost profile that’s far more startup-friendly This isn’t just about saving money — it’s about accelerating outcomes. So When Should You Hire a CMO or VP of Marketing? Once you’ve hit product-market fit and early signals of revenue repeatability, that’s when scale-ready marketing becomes a priority. That’s when you shift from figuring it out to building the engine. But who you hire — and how you evaluate them — matters deeply. What to Look for in Your First Full-Time Marketing Leader ✅ Breadth Over Depth Look for generalists who have worked across multiple marketing disciplines — demand gen, product marketing, brand, content, analytics. At this stage, you need someone who can both strategize and execute. Interview Tip: Ask how they’ve led across multiple functions. You’re looking for systems thinkers who’ve rolled up their sleeves. ✅ Systems Builder They must know how to build and run demand funnels, attribution models, testing protocols, and messaging frameworks — from scratch. Interview Tip: Ask them to describe a demand engine they built. What worked? What didn’t? ✅ GTM Pattern Recognition They should have lived through several startup GTM motions — not just one. Bonus points for failure stories with clear lessons learned. Interview Tip: What’s the biggest GTM mistake they’ve made? What did it teach them? ✅ Comfort with Ambiguity The ground is always shifting in early-stage companies. You need someone who thrives in chaos and doesn’t wait for perfect data. Interview Tip: How have they handled shifting ICPs, pricing models, or sales feedback loops? ✅ Obsession with Learning Great startup marketers are curious and adaptable. They experiment constantly and seek new insight like oxygen. Interview Tip: What’s the last thing they taught themselves — and why? ✅ Cultural Fit > Resume Finally, make sure they match the mission. You don’t need a resume — you need a teammate. Someone who can align with product, sales, and leadership and earn trust quickly. Interview Tip: Invite them to join a sales huddle or standup. Observe how they engage. Final Thought Startup success hinges on timing and fit — nowhere more than in marketing leadership. Hire too early, and you risk: Burning capital Scaling the wrong message Misfiring on product-market fit But hire the right person at the right time? You unlock scale. Create alignment. Build momentum. Until then? Work with experienced fractional talent who know the early-stage grind — and can help you find that repeatable, predictable path to growth. At The Artesian Network, we’ve been the interim marketing engine for dozens of early-stage companies. Over 50% of our clients have gone on to successful exits, including IPOs and acquisitions. Let’s get you there — FASTER. #StartupMarketing #FractionalCMO #EarlyStageGrowth #SeriesA #SeriesB #TechStartups #CMOHiring #GoToMarketStrategy #StartupAdvice #VCHiring #TheArtesianNetwork #B2BMarketing #MarketingLeadership #FounderTips
updates.subTitle: Don’t Hire That CMO (Yet): What to Look for in a Marketing Leader When the Time Is Right

updates.postText:
Most “benchmarks” don’t change anything.

Because they’re averages.
And averages don’t force decisions.

So we built a percentile-based GTM scorecard for Series A/B B2B SaaS + AI teams selling mid-market/enterprise:

If you’re in the bottom quartile in just ONE place, it usually creates a chain reaction:

message → offer → channel → conversion → pipeline

We published the full scorecard (Website, Email, Social, Webinars, Paid) as a LinkedIn article. We derived the data from credible published sources (referenced in the article) and measured against The Artesian Network's own experiential data for 2025 to project for the coming year.

Question (so you can self-diagnose):
Which part of your GTM feels most “stuck” right now — website conversion, nurture, social, webinars, or paid?


#B2BMarketing #GoToMarket #DemandGeneration #RevenueMarketing #MarketingAnalytics

publications.title: New Life for Dead Storage Technologies
Your Building Management System May Be Compromising Your Company's Security
publications.summary:
Previously seen as scare mongering, the vulnerabilities of using building control systems remotely have recently come to the attention of federal authorities and now demand our objective attention as a security problem of major proportions. (See sidebar article on recent government warnings.)

This article explores the nature of the vulnerabilities of building management systems and concludes with the cardinal rules for ensuring that the optimal security precautions are employed.

publications.title: Overcoming BMS Shortfalls by Managing Facilities As A Unified Network
publications.summary: With the new demands of the distributed mission critical facility marketplace, companies must look into solutions that can unify these disparate data islands while being mindful of bandwidth overhead, network security, scalability and system stability. A starting point is in recognizing the need to interconnect this critical facilities foundational layer that we refer to as the Zero Layer. This foundational layer includes power, environmental, fire safety, space, and physical security machinery, such as uninterruptible power supplies (UPS), air conditioning units, fire panel, and other environmental equipment. Study after study shows than somewhere between 30% and 50% of the failure in the IT network and systems has a root cause in the Zero Layer facilities foundational inputs.

There was hardly a customer visit or customer survey that did not have a specific mention of Minesh's contribution to Qubole's success attached to it. Talk about having an fingerprint on a company! These were large and small customers across time zones and up and through a customer count of approximately 50 or so. This fact speaks volumes. 

It was a great pleasure to work with Minesh. His attitude was amazing and only surpassed by the greatness of his industry and product knowledge. Analysts, investors and prospects appreciated Minesh's style and substance when we had the occasion to present together.

recommendations.name: Doug de Urioste
recommendations.subtitle: Director of Sales
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Doug but on different teams
recommendations.description: It was really helpful for the small and understaffed marketing team that we had a key sales exec in Doug with both a background in marketing and in large enterprise sales. His creative thinking cap was always on. Doug was always the "big elephant hunter" of the group and proved this strength repeatedly during my tenure as SVP Marketing. I always appreciated Doug's Team spirit under pressure as it only helped bring the Team back to the table to address whatever stubborn problem we were trying to solve with a new, positive vigor.

recommendations.name: Tom Mack
recommendations.subtitle: VP, EMEA
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Tom but on different teams
recommendations.description: Tom proved to be a smart, focused and resourceful sales executive who everybody naturally sought for account help when he wasn't busy closing his own crowed funnel of business. Customers trusted him and with good reason. Graceful under pressure, Tom was a genuine pleasure to work with and I would welcome the opportunity to one day work together again on another Team.

recommendations.name: Holden Ackerman
recommendations.subtitle: Apache Airflow Advocate | Strategic Account Executive
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Holden but on different teams
recommendations.description: Holden always charged through the day with really fresh ideas and exuberance to try new strategies and tactics - something we were after when trying to find the business model fit. His previous background in online marketing really helped the marketing/sales dialog as he was growing into his career in sales and bd, a position he clearly showed strength in early on. It was a pleasure to work with Holden and it would be a welcomed opportunity to do so again in the future!

recommendations.name: Londonne Corder
recommendations.subtitle: Chief Marketing Officer at Outrider
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. managed Londonne directly
recommendations.description: Londonne organizes and manages both marketing campaigns and their teams with a great sense of urgency, care and thought.  She is both tenacious and objective in measuring project results in a tight feedback loop so the team can be in a constant state of improvement.  I have hired Londonne twice so far in my career and hope to again a third time in the future.

recommendations.name: Hope Nicora
recommendations.subtitle: Vice President, Corporate Marketing at WEKA
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. was senior to Hope but didn't manage Hope directly
recommendations.description:
Hope has an incredible intensity focused on achieving results for her clients.  With limitless creativity and an industry contact roster like few others, I enjoyed watching the teams she led drive the names of her clients to the top of the technology startup world.  Cloudera and Pure Storage were but a few of the places where her impact has been obvious.

When The Artesian Network has a client need for Public Relations leadership, it will be a pleasure to work with Hope again at some point again in the future!

recommendations.name: Kathleen Douglas
recommendations.subtitle: Retired Technology Professional and Customer Experience Advocate
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Kathleen but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: Kathleen is a delight to work with.  She incredibly knowledgable, tenacious and fully engaged in building the strategy and execution of our marketing project.  Without her help and guidance in the process the positive results we achieved simply would not have been possible.

recommendations.name: Bill Dedrick
recommendations.subtitle: Go-to-Market Advisor helping Founders & CEOs establish their repeatable, scalable & profitable growth model. Interim CRO.

recommendations.description: Bill is a supreme transactional tactician with repeated successes recruiting and cultivating dedicated, metrics-driven sales teams spanning the globe.  In customer situations where some complication or ambiguity may exist, Bill is excellent at cutting to the chase to push win-wins for the seller and customer alike.

recommendations.name: Dave Nielsen
recommendations.subtitle: Developer Relations Professional with a Passion for Community

I have hired him again for Ping Identity and will again for my next project.  Dave is as personable as he is smart and experienced.

recommendations.description: It was a great pleasure to work with Terri-Lee and it would be a pleasure to work with her again.  Always diligent and very hard working, without Terri-Lee there would have been no way to keep all the mechanics of the business running on time.

recommendations.description: Adrian was key in helping to lead the transformation of Nirvanix into the enterprise cloud storage company that it is today. Brett had an excellent command of the sales process and his customers' needs.

recommendations.subtitle: Value-added Executive Recruiter, Human Capital Investor, and Business Development Impresario
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Ben but they were at different companies
recommendations.description: Ben is a hard driver with a powerful combination of smarts, excellent communications skills and the ability to get things done. Ben was instrumental in making the joint venture partnership between NetBrowser Communications and Parsons happen and then helped drive it to become a profitable relationship for both parties.

recommendations.name: Michael Hughes
recommendations.subtitle: Making security seamless for consumers and businesses.
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Michael but on different teams
recommendations.description: Michael has the combination of smarts, tenacity and natural leadership skills that all too rarely find a confluence in Sales. Interview either his Team or his customers and you will find a loyal lot that knows that they are in the best of hands. Having a VP of Sales, especially in an early stage company when time is at a premium, with Michael's abilities, is a blessing.

recommendations.name: Marc Davilla
recommendations.subtitle: Regional Service Sales Manager (RSSM): Secure Power Division: Pacific Northwest Region
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Marc but on different teams
recommendations.description: Marc and I started together, rounding out a team of three that essentially represented the genesis of NetBrowser and would grow into a multi-million dollar enterprise in less than two years.  Customers loved him.  Engineers loved him.  He always had a command of the facts that led us down the path to making the customers happy - a key component to hyper growth.  We spent a lot of time in the trenches and I would do it again knowing that a team member like Marc was there to help pushing the company ahead.

recommendations.name: Rachel Brown, CDME
recommendations.subtitle: Destination Stewardship Director, Destination Wayfinder (Powered by Miles Partnership)
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. managed Rachel directly
recommendations.description: Rachel has proven herself eager to learn new skills, highly adaptable and very bright.  Quickly after starting on the team, Rachel was tasked with some big responsibilities in a web-based company: SEO/SEM and website management including results reporting among many other projects.  She rose to the occasion handily and brought great spirit and creativity along the way with demonstrable positive results.  Rachel's contribution to the team was unquestionable and I would hire her again in the future.

recommendations.name: Dan Havens
recommendations.subtitle: Chief Growth Officer
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. worked with Dan but on different teams
recommendations.description: Dan is an extremely bright, passionate and charismatic leader.  He has shown the ability to recruit a team, while doing most of the selling himself (the curse of the startup), and to win customers in the worst economic times since the 1930s - and all with a product, product category, and company that is barely officially over a year old.  I found Dan to be a pleasure to work and would welcome the opportunity again.

recommendations.name: Nell Treseder
recommendations.subtitle: Retired

recommendations.description: It was a pleasure to work with Nell.  She manages by fact, acts decisively and is an excellent networker.  At a time when it was very difficult in technology sales,  she was able keep the team focused on closing deals and at the same time directly facilitated some of the relationships that got the company funded.  Great on the strategy AND the tactics - rare in sales management...I would definitely work with Nell again.

recommendations.name: Drew O'Brien
recommendations.subtitle: Enterprise Sales | Strategy | Enablement

recommendations.description: Drew has a fantastic attitude, a great head on his shoulders, and a willingness to learn and adapt that is second to none.  His creative approach to problem solving, be the problem an empirical issue or a visual design challenge, has always kept Drew's contribution to the Team well above expectations.  I would hire Drew again if given the opportunity.

recommendations.name: Jil Backstrom
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Director of Marketing Communications

recommendations.name: Judy Smith
recommendations.subtitle: President at JPR Communications
recommendations.context: Jonathan W. was Judy's client
recommendations.description: For any company, the choice of a public relations firm is an important one. For an early stage technology company, the importance of this decision cannot be overstated as your company’s industry relevance must be established, and fast. JPR is a pleasure to work with and simply gets the job done and done with excellence. With a healthy mix of strategy, great tactical wherewithal and all tempered with extensive experience in the enterprise storage industry, I cannot think of a better firm to help launch a storage company than Team JPR.

recommendations.name: Melissa Warner

It would be a pleasure to work with Melissa again sometime in the future.

recommendations.name: Gary Gysin

I would work for Gary again, no question.

recommendations.name: Ujwal Setlur

headline: President at Talix - Strategy & Operations I Transformation I Strategic Planning I MBA
addressWithCountry: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
about:
As President of Talix, Max leads with a commitment to aligning technology strategy with business goals - helping clients navigate complexity with clarity, security, and confidence. Talix was formed from the merger of Network Synergy and BPI Information Systems, uniting decades of trusted service under one future-focused brand.

Rooted in the legacy of Network Synergy, a respected IT consulting and managed services firm founded in 1988, Max brings forward a people-first, outcomes-driven leadership approach. His work centers on delivering modern, secure, and scalable IT solutions that empower small and mid-sized organizations to thrive.

Max is focused on driving Talix’s strategic growth, elevating service delivery, and building a culture of excellence across every engagement.

experiences.title: President
experiences.jobDescription: Following the merger of BPI Information Systems and Network Synergy, I now serve clients as part of Talix - bringing together decades of experience, shared expertise, and a renewed commitment to excellence in secure and aligned IT solutions.

experiences.title: Global Workforce Strategy and Planning
experiences.jobDescription: While part of the Global Client Care Workforce Strategy Team, Max identified utilization, efficiency and productivity improvement opportunities.  He conducted division labor needs assessments and impact analyses in support of new business, capacity planning, and forecasting.  Max performed periodic audits of regional divisions and product performance to identify training or product quality gaps and worked with the appropriate teams to drive resolution and maximum impact.  He also provided headcount and resource allocation recommendations regarding additions or replacements in order to optimize productivity.

experiences.title: Manager, Operations
experiences.jobDescription:
At Affinion Group, Max served as the company SME for Fulfillment Operations, and led strategic company-wide projects for process improvement and implementation within Operations. 
He implemented new standards mandated by regulatory and compliance teams with minimal disruption of day-to-day processes, and managed client-related data and reporting for high profile FI’s.	Max oversaw a data management team to ensure accuracy and maximum time and process efficiency, and managed a small team of direct reports. Max created, developed, and facilitated end-to-end fulfillment for key clients and new product creation.

educations.title: University of Michigan - Stephen M. Ross School of Business
educations.subtitle: Master of Business Administration - MBA, with distinction

recommendations.name: Tanya Manning-Grant (she, her, hers)
recommendations.subtitle: Executive Supply Chain Consultant/ Director of Procurement |Client Manager | Trusted Advisor |Entrepreneur
recommendations.context: Max worked with Tanya on the same team
recommendations.description:
I had the distinct pleasure of working with Tanya at LogicSource for nearly three years, where we were both part of the Client Operations team. During that time, I was continually impressed by her mastery in Management Consulting and Indirect Sourcing and Procurement, as well as her unyielding commitment to driving results.

Tanya is the type of person who not only knows how to execute a project efficiently but also understands the importance of team dynamics and open communication. She brings a level of enthusiasm to the workplace that is contagious, inspiring others to elevate their performance and strive for excellence.

But what sets Tanya apart from others is not just her impressive skill set; it's also her ability to foster a positive and collaborative work environment. She truly listens to team members' ideas and integrates them into a cohesive plan, making everyone feel valued and included.

Tanya is a genuine and compassionate individual. She is always the first to offer assistance or provide guidance, making her not only an exceptional colleague but also a remarkable friend.

For these reasons and many more, I wholeheartedly recommend Tanya for any role. Any organization would be lucky to have such a talented, committed, and collaborative professional on their team.

about: I bring energy, urgency, and real connection to everything I do.I’m naturally people-driven and relationship-focused, and I have a knack for drawing people in quickly and making them feel taken care of. I’m highly responsive, proactive, and known for getting people what they need—often before they even ask.I don’t believe in pushy sales or canned scripts. When people work with me, they know they’ll get honesty, follow-through, and someone who actually moves the needle.I thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy solving problems on the fly, and take pride in being the person others can rely on when things need to get done—well and quickly.

headline: CEO @ Sterling Technology Solutions | What would you do if you knew you would not fail?
about:
As CEO of Sterling Technology Solutions, I lead a mission-driven team dedicated to simplifying technology for small, medium, and growing businesses. We specialize in delivering solutions that empower our clients to focus on what they do best—running and growing their businesses. My focus is on building a thriving, sustainable organization by driving strategic growth while implementing disciplined cash flow strategies to fuel scale and long-term resilience.

With over 25 years of experience spanning technology and healthcare, I’ve had the privilege of leading high-performing teams, crafting go-to-market strategies, and unlocking operational efficiency to drive measurable business results. From scaling revenue and launching marketplace partnerships to winning enterprise contracts and building national sales programs, I’ve consistently delivered results through data-driven decision-making, cross-functional collaboration, and a deep focus on client success.

At the heart of my leadership philosophy is a go-giver mindset: serve first, create value, and elevate others. Whether I’m leading a company, developing a team, or facilitating peer groups through IT Nation Evolve, I believe in showing up with generosity, authenticity, and a deep commitment to the success of those around me. I also believe the real legacy of leadership is impact—leaving teams, organizations, and individuals stronger, more aligned, and more equipped to grow than they were before.

experiences.title: Chief Executive Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
At Sterling Technology Solutions, I have the honor to lead with a strategist’s foresight and a founder’s grit—driving growth that’s as intentional as it is relentless. My mandate is simple but uncompromising: accelerate market share, elevate profitability, and deepen client loyalty in an industry where trust is the ultimate currency. I fuse long-range vision with disciplined execution, building strategies that aren’t just reactive to change—they anticipate and shape it.

Every decision is filtered through our customer-first ethos because sustainable growth is impossible without unwavering client advocacy. At Sterling, that means delivering technology solutions that work flawlessly today while positioning our clients to thrive tomorrow. Growth isn’t just a number on a spreadsheet—it’s a ripple effect that strengthens our people, our clients, and our community.

Anyone who has the chance to work with her will quickly see the impact she brings both personally and professionally. I’m proud to call her a friend and even prouder to recommend her.

recommendationsReceived.description:
tl:dr In case you choose not to read what I eloquently and abundantly state below, I strongly recommend Solei and what she would bring to any organization.

I had the pleasure of working with Solei for five years. She quickly became the public face of the company at conferences and did a great job building our brand and our reputation.

Beyond being a very good person, which she is, she also led our sales and jumped in to help our marketing efforts. Even though she came from outside our industry she made every effort to understand our business and be an active part of it.

When she decided to take another opportunity, I became instantly proud that others saw the value that I enjoyed for years.

What sets Solei apart is her genuine willingness to go above and beyond for her colleagues, peers, family & friends. Always ready to offer guidance and support, her approachability and eagerness to share expertise make her an invaluable team player. Her talent for building strong relationships internally and externally speaks volumes about her outstanding interpersonal skills.

In the realm of business development, Solei has become a standout figure, contributing significantly to MSPCFO's success. Her strategic vision and adept navigation of industry complexities position her as a key player in the channel, highlighting her focus on relationship-building.

Collaborating with Solei is a genuine pleasure. Her enthusiasm, energy, and collaborative spirit shine through in every project, making her an approachable and inspiring leader. I am confident that Solei will continue making impactful contributions to MSPCFO and any organization fortunate enough to have her. For any team seeking a dedicated and talented Business Development Director, Solei, is undoubtedly the ideal choice.
