headline: Senior Account Executive at Rev.io
about:
After graduating with a degree in Agricultural Biotechnology from the University of Kentucky, my goal was to validate my scientific education with a job in the Biotechnology Industry. 
 After receiving this feeling of validation at Pfizer, I pivoted my career to logistics.  I have been involved in virtually every aspect of logistics: fork lift operator, route supervisor, truck driver, shipping management and freight brokerage.  I found measurable success from my logistics career in developing a wealth of knowledge of operations.  Following the results of the pandemic, I found myself looking to get back to work or law school.  I am happily in the telecommunications industry, working with integral BroadWorks staff to help improve their small business porfolio.

experiences.title: Senior Account Executive
experiences.jobDescription: 2025 Top Sales Rep at Rev.io

experiences.title: Odin Account Executive
experiences.jobDescription: Odin is specifically designed to address common BroadWorks challenges like manual provisioning, customer self-service, third-party integrations, data security, and managing multiple BroadWorks instances. With Odin, we can help you automate your provisioning process, empower your customers to manage their features, seamlessly integrate with third-party applications, and provide data security with comprehensive backups and point-in-time recovery. All these features aim to save you time, reduce costs, and enhance your customer satisfaction.

experiences.companyName: Park Bench Solutions, a Rev.io Company
experiences.title: Business Development Representative
experiences.jobDescription:
The odin platform for BroadWorks provides enhanced management and automation capabilities for service providers using BroadWorks, a VoIP solution. With the odin platform, BroadWorks-based service providers can expect to simplify and streamline their provisioning and management processes, improve accuracy and reduce errors, automate processes, and receive timely and effective support. Additionally, odin provides real-time reporting and visibility into BroadWorks operations, which can help service providers better understand their business and make informed decisions. Overall, the odin platform for BroadWorks helps service providers improve their operations, better serve their customers, and grow their business.

Park Bench Solutions was acquired by Rev.io in April of 2022

headline: Chief Executive Officer at Slide
about: Michael is a transformational leader in high growth, global technology environments. As co-founder and CEO of Slide he's leading the team that is re-inventing backup for MSPs.  Previously, he was the sole continuous executive leader at Datto throughout the company’s journey of scale from a 100 employee tech startup to a global, publicly-traded enterprise. Michael has led teams that created thousands of jobs and multi-billion dollar returns for investors.  He is a functional operator as well as strategic counsel, coach and leader. Michael is also a proud husband to Sarah and father to Ethan (college grad), Owen (college) and Zeke (high school), an avid guitar player, singer, songwriter, amateur chef and dog lover.

experiences.jobDescription:
Joined founder-led startup as first senior executive. Continuous member of executive team throughout the company’s journey from a local, 100 employee company to a global, 2,000+ employee, publicly traded technology enterprise. 

KEY HIGHLIGHTS

December 2017-present (GC & Chief People Officer)

•	Oversaw Datto’s Initial Public Offering in October 2020
•	Negotiated, closed and integrated 3 international acquisitions
•	Run global HR for a highly engaged, high growth, $4-5 billion cloud software and cybersecurity business:
        -   Led 4-year overhaul and total transformation of 60+ person global HR function
        -   TA metrics through 10/31/21:  >30% organic increase in YoY global headcount         
        -   Create and embed a high performance, diverse, inclusive company culture 
        -   Launched company-wide D&I, performance management frameworks 
        -   Recruited, hired, onboarded Gen 2 exec team as well as key functional leaders

•	Led, negotiated, closed Series A, Series B deals, several domestic acquisitions 
•	Managed $1.3 billion sale of company to Vista Equity Partners in December 2017
•	Successfully steered company through “Clinton email scandal” throughout 2015-2016 as principal strategist and spokesperson 
•	Recruited, hired, onboarded Gen 1 exec team (CFO, CTO, CRO, CHRO)

experiences.title: General Counsel, North America
experiences.jobDescription:
Principal legal officer for a $100 million global business.  
            
Contracts and Commercial Transactions – Oversee, structure, draft and negotiate agreements memorializing Toluna’s commercial dealings with customers, suppliers, employees, contractors, vendors, etc. on a global basis, including business and technology services agreements, software licenses, technology subscriptions, NDAs, joint venture and employment agreements, real property leases, etc.

Strategic Transactions, M&A -  Formulate, structure and close key strategic transactions such as mergers, acquisitions, commercial lending facilities, strategic investments and partnerships as well as joint ventures.  Draft and negotiate term sheets, letters of intent and definitive documentation.

Corporate Governance – Maintain corporate minutes and legal records with respect to 17 corporate affiliates across the globe.  

Compliance – Formulate, develop, manage and maintain Toluna’s global privacy policies and customer terms.  Conduct compliance training and mentoring.  Advise  on global regulatory requirements. Conduct internal investigations.
  
Dispute Management – Lead strategy, draft correspondence, negotiate and manage all disputes.  When necessary, engage and direct outside counsel.  Actively manage all litigation. 

Employee Relations –  Advise on all major employee relations issues.  Provide regular strategic and tactical advice, draft compensation plans, formulate policies and practices and execute on major employee relations initiatives. 

Intellectual Property – Manage global IP portfolio.  Oversee filing of all new patents and trademarks.  Manage all IP disputes.  Review and approve advertising copy and marketing collateral.    

Special Projects – Lead several strategic projects, including the development of a Business to Business panel, project management dashboard that tracks performance of all active North American client projects across 11 KPIs.

experiences.title: Franchise Owner
experiences.jobDescription:
Founded in 1971, DirectBuy operates members-only home furnishings and remodeling centers offering top brand name manufacturer products at insider prices.  DirectBuy, perennially ranked at the top of its category on Entrepreneur Magazine’s Franchise 500 list, has 160 locations throughout the US and Canada, employing over 3,000 people and helping over 400,000 members purchase over $1 billion in merchandise annually.

Established, owned, operated and sold award-winning, nationally-recognized DirectBuy franchise.  

Key Highlights:

•	For three straight years, earned a top-five customer service rating based on surveys of members conducted by Maritz Research and Leo J. Shapiro & Associates.

•	Negotiated, drafted and consummated $1.4 million sale of business at height of 2008 financial crisis.

•	Recruited, trained and maintained sales, marketing and service staff of 25 employees.

•	Managed $2-3 million in membership sales and over $5 million purchasing volume per year.

•	Managed advertising and marketing budget in excess of $500,000 per year.

headline: Senior Marketing Leader | Go-to-Market Strategy & Demand Generation | Building Scalable Marketing Functions
about:
Senior marketing leader with 15+ years of experience supporting go-to-market strategy, demand generation, and brand development across B2B, B2C, and multi-brand organizations. Known for a steady, structured approach to building marketing functions that align with business priorities and support sustainable growth through cross-functional collaboration and disciplined execution.

Core Skills
Go-to-Market Strategy · Demand Generation · Revenue-Aligned Marketing · Marketing Operations · Lifecycle & Retention Strategy · Pipeline & CRM Strategy · Team Leadership · Cross-Functional Collaboration · Executive Communication

experiences.title: CEO, Founder
experiences.jobDescription: Founded and led a boutique marketing consultancy supporting brand strategy, go-to-market planning, and digital marketing initiatives for small and mid-sized organizations. Provided executive-level advisory across positioning, demand generation, and cross-functional execution.

experiences.title: Director of Client Success & Growth
experiences.jobDescription:
• Led revenue-aligned acquisition, retention, and referral programs contributing to $1M+ in revenue within five months and $3M+ in total new and retained revenue.
• Supported new business growth through strategic client engagement and consultative discovery, contributing to $355K in revenue within 30 days toward a $1.5M annual target.
• Directed end-to-end client lifecycle strategy, introducing scalable onboarding and planning processes that improved time-to-value and retention.
• Partnered with cross-functional leadership to launch Investor Tax Summit and referral programs, expanding pipeline and strengthening brand credibility.

experiences.title: Director of Growth & Marketing (Director of Sales & Marketing)
experiences.jobDescription:
• Led growth and demand initiatives contributing to $700K+ in new revenue over seven months while building a marketing team and establishing scalable frameworks and reporting cadence.
• Introduced performance dashboards to improve spend visibility, ROI analysis, and executive-level decision-making.
• Led digital transformation initiatives across web, UX, and analytics, increasing site traffic by 60% and funnel engagement by 25%.

experiences.title: Director of Marketing And Business Development
experiences.jobDescription:
• Led multi-brand marketing strategy and Construc Industries’ rebrand, increasing brand recognition by 25%.
• Designed customer acquisition campaigns for Grand Christian Prep, achieving 100% enrollment growth.
• Led digital optimization initiatives across channels, increasing web traffic and online leads by 50%.

experiences.title: Director of Marketing and Art Production
experiences.jobDescription:
• Oversaw marketing operations for 22 restaurants and three corporate brands, managing a $500K creative budget and a 20+ member team.
• Supported 35% audience growth and 20% revenue increase through integrated promotions, loyalty programs, and repeatable growth frameworks.
• Launched scalable seasonal gift-card campaigns, producing a 75% sales spike and long-term revenue playbooks.

experiences.title: Senior Art & Marketing Associate
experiences.jobDescription:
• Supported marketing strategy for 24+ automotive aftermarket SKUs, standardizing packaging, digital assets, and product positioning.
• Conducted market and competitor analysis to refine GTM strategy and increase product discoverability and revenue opportunities.

experiences.title: Graphic Communication Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
• Led creative strategy across campaigns, digital platforms, and in-store experiences, aligning marketing initiatives with business objectives and revenue goals.
• Managed design teams of 30+ staff and external vendors, delivering consistent, innovative brand storytelling that strengthened customer engagement.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jennifer Rieck
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Salesforce | Implementation Partner | Blue City Studios, Inc.
recommendationsReceived.context: Jennifer reported directly to Julie
recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the pleasure of working closely with Julie during our Salesforce development for In-Telecom, where she served as Marketing Director, and I can confidently say she is one of the most strategic and impactful marketing leaders I’ve partnered with.

Julie possesses a rare blend of big-picture vision and operational execution. She doesn’t just “run marketing” — she engineers growth. Her ability to connect go-to-market strategy with real pipeline performance and revenue outcomes is exceptional. Throughout our work together, she consistently demonstrated a deep understanding of demand generation, client lifecycle optimization, and how to leverage CRM and marketing systems to drive measurable results.

What truly sets Julie apart is her leadership style. She builds high-performing, collaborative teams, aligns cross-functional stakeholders with clarity, and approaches complex challenges with both precision and momentum. Her focus on creating scalable systems, transforming client journeys, and strengthening retention models directly impacted how Salesforce was structured to support long-term growth at In-Telecom. She is not only a brilliant marketing executive but also a trusted strategic partner who elevates every initiative she touches.

Any organization seeking a leader who can accelerate revenue, strengthen brand positioning, and scale marketing operations with intention and intelligence would be incredibly fortunate to have Julie at the helm.

I highly recommend Julie without hesitation.

— Jennifer Rieck
Blue City Studios

▶︎ 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗜𝗦 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗧𝗘𝗖𝗛𝗡𝗢𝗟𝗢𝗚𝗬 𝗦𝗢𝗟𝗨𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡𝗦 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗚𝗥𝗔𝗠 • A business-tech initiative that helps companies analyze, optimize, and modernize their IT and telecom stack. • Identifies hidden costs across licensing, connectivity, and cloud services. • Gives executives visibility and control over spend, vendors, and infrastructure. • Turns technology from a reactive cost center into a profit driver. • Built for CEOs, CFOs, CTO’s and CIOs seeking control without added complexity. 
▶︎ 𝗛𝗢𝗪 𝗜𝗧 𝗪𝗢𝗥𝗞𝗦: • Starts with a comprehensive audit of infrastructure, contracts, and costs. • Benchmarks spend and performance to expose redundant or inflated services. • Delivers a custom modernization roadmap for savings and efficiency. • We manage vendor sourcing and negotiations end-to-end. • Funded through provider partnerships — no direct client expense. • Produces measurable gains in cost control, uptime, and scalability. 
▶︎ 𝗘𝗫𝗣𝗘𝗖𝗧𝗘𝗗 𝗢𝗨𝗧𝗖𝗢𝗠𝗘𝗦 • 30–70% reduction in recurring IT, cloud, and telecom costs. • Improved reliability through vendor consolidation and modernization. • Predictable budgets and stronger ROI for finance teams. • Simplified vendor management with unified reporting. • Reduced compliance risk from outdated infrastructure. • A leaner and more profitable technology environment. 
▶︎ 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗖𝗟𝗜𝗘𝗡𝗧𝗦 𝗦𝗔𝗬 • “This wasn’t just a phone upgrade — it changed how we run our business. We can now track every lead and train all nine locations to our best practices.” - Auto Dealership Group • “We strengthened our cybersecurity and cut our projected costs nearly in half. The new managed solution gave us enterprise-grade protection, deployment, and monitoring — all without adding IT headcount.” - National Dental Group • “The Team guided us through a full network transformation. We reduced costs, improved uptime, and turned a complex infrastructure into something effortless to manage.” - National Non-Profit

experiences.title: EXPENSE REDUCTION | BENCHMARK YOUR VENDORS | REDUCE EXPENSES TO BENCHMARK | 15 TO 40% SAVINGS
experiences.jobDescription:
▶︎ 𝗪𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗜𝗦 𝗢𝗨𝗥 𝗖𝗢𝗠𝗣𝗥𝗘𝗛𝗘𝗡𝗦𝗜𝗩𝗘 𝗘𝗫𝗣𝗘𝗡𝗦𝗘 𝗥𝗘𝗗𝗨𝗖𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗦𝗢𝗟𝗨𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 
• Eliminate the uncertainty and frustration of not knowing if you are truly receiving the most competitive rates for every business expense on your books. 
• Use us to lower your expenses by benchmarking every one through our 10 million company, $6 trillion data lake, ensuring evidence-based savings. 
▶︎ 𝗪𝗛𝗢 𝗜𝗦 𝗧𝗛𝗜𝗦 𝗙𝗢𝗥 
• If your business’s annual revenue exceeds $500K annually, this service is for you. 

Here are some of the expense categories we benchmark and optimize: 
• Telecom/software 
• Waste 
• Treasury 
• Insurance 
• Textiles/Supplies 
• Transportation 
• Advertising 
• HR 
• Utilities 
▶︎ 𝗛𝗢𝗪 𝗜𝗧 𝗪𝗢𝗥𝗞𝗦
• You provide us with the general ledger of your company’s expenses. We calculate your potential savings on every expense presenting findings (generally within 3-5 business days). Your rates are compared to our data lake of 10 million companies based in the USA. 
• We then go to work, negotiating new rates with your current vendors on your company’s behalf. 
• We continually monitor, benchmark and optimize rate savings for you dynamically, and will renegotiate accordingly. 
• You have an expense watchdog in us, allowing you to run your business while we ensure you continually pay the best rates your vendors offer. 
• We either find you savings or no fee = 100% performance based. 
▶︎ 𝗘𝗫𝗣𝗘𝗖𝗧𝗘𝗗 𝗢𝗨𝗧𝗖𝗢𝗠𝗘𝗦
• The average client sees a 25% reduction bottom line expenses (not including payroll) without switching vendors. Our goal is to find the best rate each vendor charges, and make sure that rate applies to your business! 
• You reap the benefits and vastly improve your bottom line. 
• You now can focus on growing revenue while we focus on reducing expense—this is a win-win for your bottom line.

headline:
CEO / Partner @ M1 Data & Analytics | Forbes Technology Council |
Data solutions and technology for brands and agencies to build custom audiences that increases engagement.
about:
I am a data and technology leader with over 20 years of experience in creating innovative data solutions and platforms for brands and agencies. As the CEO and Partner of M1 Data & Analytics, I lead a team that invented the patent pending SmartPiXL, which turns anonymous website visitors into visible prospects without relying on cookies or IP matching. We have also developed and launched other products, such as Traffic Alerts and LocationIQ, that leverage data science, analytics, and machine learning to enhance consumer engagement and retention.

My passion for data and technology stems from my early career in the automotive industry, where I founded and sold four data solutions companies that generated over $25 million in annual sales. I have also worked with industry leaders, such as Marcus Lemonis of CNBC's The Profit, and Credit Acceptance, where I helped them improve their data strategies and consumer experiences. I am always looking for new challenges and opportunities to apply my skills and knowledge to solve real-world problems and create value for my clients and partners.

experiences.title: CEO / Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Inventors of the patent pending SmartPiXL.  SmartPiXL turns your anonymous website visitors into visible prospects.   It is not cookie based and does not rely on IP matching.   

Founded in 2007 -M1 Data & Analytics is a full service data and DaaS company. 
www.GetSmartPiXL.com           https://vimeo.com/360144456

experiences.title: Board Advisor
experiences.jobDescription: Served as it's President / Board Member from June 2015 to December 2015.  Since 2015 Russell has remained active with executive leadership as a strategic advisor and resource to Cloud One founders.

experiences.title: Executive Vice President
experiences.jobDescription: Camping World Holdings, headquartered in Lincolnshire, Illinois, is the leading outdoor and camping retailer, offering an extensive assortment of recreational vehicles for sale, RV and camping gear, RV maintenance and repair and the industry’s broadest and deepest range of services, protection plans, products and resources. Since the Company's founding in 1966, Camping World has grown to become one of the most well-known destination for everything RV, with over 135 retail locations in 36 states and comprehensive e-commerce platform. Coupled with an unsurpassed portfolio of industry-leading brands including Gander Outdoors, Good Sam, Overton’s, The House and Windward/W82, Camping World Holdings has become the synonymous with outdoor experiences. Camping World’s stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "CWH."

experiences.title: Founder / CEO / Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Russell founded Xcelerated Investments, Inc. A data technology company with a focus in the automotive industry. He sold the company and left day to day management in June 2015.

Xcelerated's  focus is on solutions that provide data validation, verification, marketing, conquest, and underwriting modeling for companies. Xcelerated offers a number of solutions and services all designed to work within the consumer finance, automotive finance, and automotive after-market industry, as well as a number of other industries. Xcelerated developed and operates a proprietary technology platform called DATAVAST. DATAVAST is unique in the aspect that it solves the industry wide need for a savvy platform, that is fast AND has quality data assets warehoused.  Xcelerated is the leading provider of these data services in the U.S. based within the automotive marketing vertical based on client base and overall output.

headline: Chief Financial Officer at In-Telecom
addressWithCountry: Greater New Orleans Region, United States
about:
Accomplished Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and CPA with a progressive career spanning managed IT services, wholesale distribution, oilfield midstream, and logistics. Recognized for leading financial transformation, streamlining reporting and accounting systems, and serving as a trusted advisor to executives, boards, and private equity stakeholders. I bring a track record of aligning finance strategy with business objectives to unlock growth, improve profitability, and strengthen organizational resilience.

I specialize in redesigning financial processes, implementing scalable systems, and embedding risk management and compliance frameworks that enable organizations to operate with clarity and control. By translating complex financial data into actionable insights, I help leadership teams make confident, high-impact decisions. My passion lies in building sustainable financial disciplines, fostering continuous improvement, and guiding companies through periods of rapid change and transformation.

Selected Achievements:

Directed the successful integration of a $310M acquisition into Pilot Water Solutions LLC, completed on schedule and audit-ready for a Big 4 firm.

Oversaw independent valuations for nine entities, ensuring accuracy and alignment with organizational and investor expectations.

Negotiated the strategic sale of Produced Water Transfer LLC, eliminating costly private equity debt while delivering a strong exit and ROI for investors.

Core Strengths:

Finance Strategy & Leadership | M&A & Purchase Accounting | Private Equity Partnership | Financial Reporting & Analysis | Budgeting & Forecasting | Cash Flow Optimization | Audit & Big 4 Engagement | Risk & Compliance | Entity Integration | Systems Conversions | Corporate Finance | US GAAP

experiences.title: Chief Financial Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
In-Telecom is a full-service technology solutions provider specializing in cloud telephony, VoIP, managed IT, cybersecurity, physical security, and data backup.

Direct the financial strategy for a $40M+ MSP, including budgeting, forecasting, M&A due diligence, and purchase accounting.

Spearhead integration of acquired MSPs, aligning systems, processes, and financial reporting to deliver scalable growth.

Partner with the CEO and leadership team to drive profitability and ensure sustainable cash flow management.

Implemented enhanced forecasting, KPI dashboards, and reporting to improve executive decision-making and investor visibility.

experiences.title: Vice President of Finance - Chief Financial Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Pilot Water Solutions is a fully integrated produced water services provider supporting oil & gas producers.

Appointed CFO at company formation; later transitioned to VP of Finance for the saltwater disposal division.

Integrated nine operating entities valued at $900M over a three-year period, ensuring seamless financial and operational consolidation.

Oversaw $100M+ in capital investments in disposal wells and pipeline infrastructure, strengthening long-term growth capacity.

Designed financial models, reporting processes, and controls that supported Big 4 audit standards and private equity compliance.

Continued to serve as Consultant (2021–2022), advising leadership on financial structuring and capital allocation.

experiences.companyName: Produced Water Transfer (Predecessor to Pilot Water Solutions)
experiences.title: Chief Financial Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Private-equity funded venture focused on saltwater disposal wells and transportation infrastructure.

Initially engaged on a contract basis to organize financial operations and liaise between operations and investors.

Formalized as CFO upon private equity partnership; structured reporting and compliance processes for institutional investors.

Played a key role in negotiating the sale of the company to Pilot Flying J, securing a successful exit for investors and creating Pilot Water Solutions.

experiences.title: Consulting Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Top-25 national accounting and advisory firm.

Led client accounting services, litigation support, and special tax projects for mid-market and enterprise clients.

Standardized and automated the Client Accounting Services (CAS) practice, improving efficiency and scalability across the firm.

Partnered with clients to optimize accounting processes and strengthen compliance.

experiences.title: Corporate Controller - Head of Finance and Accounting
experiences.jobDescription:
Regional wholesale distributor of Anheuser-Busch, craft brews, wine, and spirits.

Directed finance and accounting functions, including GAAP reporting, debt covenant compliance, and treasury management.

Implemented cost reduction and cash management strategies that eliminated a multimillion-dollar credit facility within 30 months.

Managed cash flow forecasting, budgeting, and variance analysis for senior leadership.

Oversaw two major ERP and route accounting system conversions, ensuring accurate, timely reporting during periods of operational change.

recommendationsReceived.context: Jeremy worked with Michael Chad but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: I've worked with Michael as both a candidate and a hiring manager. As a hiring manager, I found his responsiveness to be far above any other recruiter I've worked with and I discovered why he was able to explain the opportunity to me so accurately when I was a candidate; he took the time to learn about the company, the role, the compensation, and the benefits, which meant when I spoke with candidates they had a clear understanding of what they were in for and they were usually very qualified for the role. Definitely a recommended partner for recruiting!

experiences.title: Chief Operating Officer
experiences.jobDescription:
Co-founded and launched the organization and provides day-to-day leadership, management, and guidance to ensure the advancement of the company’s vision and operating effectiveness. Responsible for planning, organizing, directing, monitoring, and guaranteeing the enterprise has the proper operational controls, reporting procedures, and systems in place to attain targets and objectives. Collaborates with Senior Leadership and engages in short and long-term planning and goal setting. Builds a highly inclusive and engaged culture ensuring team members thrive and organizational outcomes are met. 
•	Formulated and introduced operational structures that provided for growth in year one while defining and measuring KPIs that offer a metric-driven operational process and increase bandwidth.
•	Directs and develops a team of direct reports and contractors while managing forecasting, profit and loss (P&L), strategic project management, customer success initiatives, and customer acquisition process development and implementation.
•	Leads the organization through advanced research, competitive analysis, proof of concept validation, organization development, design and implementation of SaaS products, and more. 
•	Leverages innovation and automation to architect and realize back-office CRM and SaaS solutions; results reduce human costs, improve efficiency, drive scalability, and maximize net income.

experiences.title: District Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Provided leadership, coaching, and direction to 21 brick and mortar store locations. Charged with forecasting and managing profit and loss while seeking to consistently improve store operations, maximize long-term sales, and build positive business relationships with stakeholders and customers. Established targets and ensures stores within the profit center attained goals. 
•	Achieved sales growth within Southeast Louisiana territory while reducing turnover rate.
•	Identified and removed roadblocks for store Leadership teams to reach and exceed KPI targets. 
•	Spearheaded change initiatives by eliminating silos and barriers to success; built consensus across assigned stores. Uncovered and addressed external factors and local threats or trends that impede goal attainment; led teams through challenges to minimize distraction and ensure productivity. 
•	Introduced innovative strategies to maximize retention and create a high-quality talent pipeline.

experiences.title: Area Service Manager

Managed a portfolio of accounts and focused on maximizing client value by emphasizing contract renewals and negotiations. Developed a full understanding of client objectives and success metrics to drive tailored solutions that ultimately increased account longevity and retention. Ensured a seamless experience for the client while developing and executing on internal growth strategies via product launches and additional product placements. 
•	Attained customer success through goodwill; tracked customer feedback by monitoring varied systems. 
•	Collaborated with Service, Sales, Plant, and Office teams and supported P&L goals for Southeast Louisiana market; ensured maximum net income was achieved for a customer base comprised of 1,000+ locations. 
•	Led presentations for Service and Sales on new product releases, pricing strategies, and quarterly and yearly internal competitions. 
•	Captained varied employee engagement initiatives, managed retention, and handled performance management.

experiences.title: Executive Team Leader—Logistics, Store Remodels & Assets Protection

Recruited to the organization to lead inbound and outbound back-end store operations, design and implement process improvements, and enhance workload efficiencies. Supported business priorities focused on productivity and P&L improvement while building a guest first culture within the team and ensuring guest service fundamentals and best practices were adhered to. Utilized varied workload planning tools when managing projects and strategic initiatives while leading and coaching a multi-disciplinary team to ensure accuracy and efficiency.
•	Oversaw talent management endeavors, including recruiting, training, and mentoring of 100+ direct reports. 
•	Created and executed upon a 30/60/90-day store remodel project; maintained vendor relationships and strategic partnerships while collaborating with city entities to obtain proper permitting. Results effectively minimized guest disruption and promoted on-time completion.

headline: Cyber Security Recruiter | Podcast Host |
addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
about:
Thomas is widely regarded as one of the leading cybersecurity headhunters in the US market, specialising in senior, executive, GTM / sales, & technical hiring. 

He is trusted by many of the most recognised cybersecurity brands in the United States who engage him repeatedly to deliver elite leadership, engineering, and sales talent. 

Thomas operates at the sharp end of the market, running complex searches across:

• Executive Security Leadership (CISO, VP Security, Director, Head of Product)
• Elite Cybersecurity Sales & GTM Leadership (VP Sales, Regional Directors, Enterprise AEs, Channel Leaders)
• Senior & Principal Security Engineers (Offensive Security, Detection & Response, Cloud Security, AppSec, Platform Security)

These are roles that directly influence revenue, product integrity, and company valuation. His projects are typically executed in highly competitive conditions. 

His edge comes from combining deep technical credibility with an insider’s understanding of how cybersecurity products are built, bought, sold, and scaled in the US market.

This allows him to identify not just people who look good on paper, but those who can ship, secure, close, lead, and perform in real-world environments.

Thomas’s reputation is built on:

• Executive-level cybersecurity recruitment
• High-impact sales and go-to-market hiring
• Senior and principal engineering searches
• A track record across high-stakes mandates
• Long-term partnerships with category-defining security vendors
• An uncompromising focus on quality, precision, and results

Case studies & full references are available upon request for organisations hiring at the very top of the cybersecurity market.

Email:
thomas@nexo-sch.com

Podcast & Market Insights:
https://www.youtube.com/@TheCyberSecurityRecruiter/videos

experiences.title: Cyber Security Recruiter - Founder
experiences.jobDescription:
Nexo is a boutique cybersecurity search business operating exclusively within the United States. Trusted by some of the most recognised security brands in the world, Nexo partners with organisations where cybersecurity is mission-critical. Every search is founder-led, deeply hands-on, and executed with uncompromising delivery standards. The methodology is forensic by design. Deep US market mapping, rigorous security-first assessment, and relentless execution. 

This is not generalist recruitment every engagement is treated as critical to an organisation’s security posture. Service levels are obsessive. Precision is non-negotiable. Nexo exists to identify and secure the very best cybersecurity talent in the United States.

Case studies & references are available upon request for organisations seeking to hire.

updates.postText:
Keep talking to your cyber security recruiter. It matters more than you think.....


Had a brilliant candidate miss out on a role they were perfect for. 

Client loved them. 

I loved them, but they fell short during the process. 

One key difference? Communication went quiet during the hiring process.

Look, I get it. 

You're senior
You're highly passive
You're busy
You probably don't love being approached by headhunters. 

You're focused on 'popping shells' or managing teams, not chatting with recruiters.

But here's the thing, I'm in hiring processes all day, every day. 

I know the ins & outs.

This is an area I've obsessed over for years. 12-16 hours a day! 

The candidates who stay communicative throughout? They're the ones landing the roles. 

Even quick 2-3 minute calls between stages makes a massive difference. 

Little things crop up that might seem insignificant but compound to matter at the end.

Keeps the lines open! 

You might know way more about the technical stuff than me, but I know recruitment. 

This isn't about hand-holding it's about making sure you're properly informed going into something, to ensure a long-term career move for everyone involved.

Your recruiter isn't just there to submit your resume. 

& if they are you're dealing with the wrong one. 

Use the right one. 

Use us properly.

Apart from family & health....

There is nothing more important in life than your cyber security career. 

What's your experience been with recruiter communication during hiring processes?

Hire number 53 made with Halborn, all within just 48 months......


Grateful, proud, & blessed to have played a part in shaping / building such a mega team. 

It’s been a privilege to help bring so many talented security rockstars on board at Halborn & 53 hires made with extremely high internal standards has meant I've had to give this my all....

There's been little sleep at times but lots of fun always! 

Excited for what’s next and here’s to hiring even more world-class security talent together in the future! 

Thank you to Rob Behnke, Steven Walbroehl, & Gabi U. for your continued loyalty. 

Right now it might seem easy to put your trust in a recruiter like myself but 4 years ago that simply wasn't the case....

Rob Behnke you took a chance on me when no one really knew if I was any good at this cybersecurity recruiting thing or not.....

The risk paid off & I'm grateful for the opportunity buddy! :)

My very honest opinion about the US cyber security market……


The US remains the place for cybersecurity careers & business. 

Halfway through another week, and I wanted to share some perspective that might get lost in all the noise. 

Despite all the headlines and political rhetoric, the reality is this: 

The US is still hands-down the best place on earth to build a cybersecurity career or business. 

Yes, there's incredible growth happening globally (the Saudi market is absolutely booming atm), but the US market remains unmatched for:

Scale of opportunity 
Pace of innovation 
Quality of companies 
Career progression potential

The difference is night & day. 

Is it competitive? Absolutely. 
Is it easy? Not a chance! 
Will success be linear? Never is.

But if you're serious about maximizing your cybersecurity career potential, there's simply no substitute for the US.

You're in the right place. 

We're all very privileged! 

To operate & to be a part of the world’s best economy is a blessing. 

Don't let the negativity from the news cloud the reality. 

We should all feel grateful to operate in an ecosystem with this level of opportunity.

What's your experience been with the US cybersecurity market? 

Drop your thoughts below! :)

Getting the vote of confidence from SANS Institute feels so special……




Thank you once again to SANS Institute for ‘backing up’ my cyber security recruitment capabilities this means the world as does the volume of inbound business that’s been hitting my inbox…….


After a long 2 weeks down in the south of France I’m back to the 16hr work days & loving the grind once again……


We don’t choose our passions they choose us…..


I hope everyone has a lovely weekend whilst I’m working hard to catch up with on my ultra long ‘to do’ lists! :) 


Happy Saturday :)

Key learnings when hiring a VP of Security for one company...



When Lindsay White Director of Recruiting at CompassMSP approached me via LinkedIn to see if I'd be open to partnering with her & the leadership team on this super senior & business critical hire, I was both honoured and flattered. CompassMSP have an impeccable reputation within the MSP space & after multiple calls with both Tom Praschak (SVP of Operations) & Lindsay I could tell right away these guys and girls meant business...


The assignment was going to be challenging. The calibre of individual required by CompassMSP wasn't going to be an easy headhunt. We needed someone with incredible security knowledge, an amazing financial acumen, and we didn't have time to waste. After multiple meetings and exchanges of countless LinkedIn messages (even on a Sunday, kudos to 
Lindsay White for being as obsessive as me about securing this hire) it was time to 'pull the trigger' on this search, hit things hard, & make it happen...

As with most big searches I'm engaged on, I 'sat my family down' and informed them I'd be 'off limits' for the next 3 weekends - this hire needed total focus & commitment, nothing could be left to chance...

Fast forward a month or so and after both virtual & dinner interviews had been scheduled, multiple flights for in-person meetings had been arranged (with the awesome support of Rebecca Williams Executive Assistant at CompassMSP) we'd secured the candidate we were all absolutely 'over the moon' with. Knowing we'd all added huge amounts of value to CompassMSP organization felt very special. 


What did I/we learn from making this hire that could help other employers secure grade A talent at VP level:


✔️ - The communication was insanely strong. Myself & Lindsay would hop on/off video calls every 3/4 days for mini updates, we'd exchange video & voice messages as well as DMs on LinkedIn throughout the search. Our candidate shortlist debrief calls were direct, to the point, and immensely valuable! 

✔️ - True transparency throughout the process was key & telling each other how we felt mattered. Was this search 'nailed' after the first send over? No way! Did the strength of the relationship, openness, and the pace Tom, Lindsay, & I built rapport make it almost impossible to not get a successful outcome here? You bet! 


I'd like to say a personal thank you to CompassMSP for their business & trusting me with this tremendously important hire! Have a great Q4 everyone....

More educational / real life cyber security hiring stories coming up soon! :)

headline: Technology Operations Leader
about: Collaborative leader and problem solver with expertise in technology engineering, process improvement, financial modeling, project management and mentoring coach to turn around troubled operations. Identifies root cause of issues and translates complex processes into clear, understandable and actionable steps. Passionate leader, proven to build successful teams that consistently exceed commitments with integrity.

experiences.title: Director Cox Business Engineering Operations
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Built 100-employee team supporting Complex Fiber service fulfillment and assurance across ten markets in Central Region. Increased revenue for Cox Business through efficient workflow processes to install customers in shorter SLA timeframes.
•	Oversaw team of 9 leaders supporting Oklahoma, Arkansas, Kansas, Nebraska, and Louisiana, supporting Fiber Design / OSP Construction and Engineering for Central region. Reduced installation interval by 60% for On-net installs and 40% for new build deployments accelerating revenue.
•	Streamlined install work-order process, exceeding revenue of $500M and achieving top sales performance for 2018. 
•	Oversaw deployment of Core NOKIA Network across Central Region, with oversight of initial deployment and CAPEX growth of NOKIA Network exceeding $40M in Central Region, enabling CB to sell suite of Service Provider services across footprint, achieving $900M revenue goal. Built both metro and long-haul fiber networks across 10 cities in Central region with 1.8K+ route miles deployed both aerial and underground construction.
•	Enterprise leader for Software Development team using Agile method utilizing JIRA software tool within Field Engineering & Operations, developing 4 custom software tools for Network Monitoring and provisioning services via standard engineering configuration. 
•	Oversaw development of product launches for Managed Router, Managed Cloud, Managed Firewall and Managed Wi-Fi for Cox Business, driving $75M+ in new revenue for company in first year of deployment.
•	Led engineering and operations team with an MRC $100K+, supporting deployment of 82 school sites with Primary and Secondary Datacenter design.

experiences.title: Senior Manager Cox Business Engineering Operations Southeast Region
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Oversaw Complex Fiber service fulfillment and assurance and ensured delivery of $300M+ in revenue for Southeast region. 
•	Developed leadership team to support customers, supported all customers across 3-state region. Delivered Capital Plan of Record / LRP budget ahead of schedule without going over budget. 
•	Developed leaders to support high growth pace of company, enabling leaders to grow into new roles with some promoted into new roles.

experiences.title: Engineering Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
•	Led CB and Metro / DOCSIS Access Engineering and Operations team, deploying 100+ Cisco UBR10K DOCSIS platforms, supporting capacity growth for 600K customers and driving revenue growth.
•	Fully deployed Core / Access Network of Alcatel / NOKIA MPLS Network across 70 Critical Facilities / POP sites, selling new services into markets across Southeast region, accelerating revenue growth.
•	Worked with sales leadership on 75 E-rate school projects across footprint enabling 70%-win rate and driving new revenue opportunities.
•	Managed multiple DOCSIS / Metro Access projects exceeding $90M in capital growth for yearly Plan of record / LRP in support of Residential and Cox Business revenue growth.

recommendationsReceived.name: Carlos Sanchez
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Helping MSOs Drive Network Transformation | Cloud-Native CNFs & Converged Edge Architectures | MSEE | CCIE (Emeritus)
recommendationsReceived.context: Timothy was Carlos's client
recommendationsReceived.description:
Tim is a terrific and personable Engineering manager. Tim has a perfect balance of understanding his network and technologies, the business drivers on the industry, and a strong commitment for operational excellence. He is passionate about always making sure all engineering decisions will have the best business impact and minimize the network downtime and issues.

Tim manages a big group of very talented engineers covering a statewide network, and he certainly knows how to be on top of all aspects of his organization. This is in fact one of the things that I admire the most about Tim, that he has a very clear view of the big picture and future things coming and at the same time he is very detail oriented to the very small aspects of the daily engineering and operation. 

I had the opportunity to work with him as the SE for his team for 5 years and we did great projects together. We transformed their network to make it accommodate all the traffic growth and new services, and were able to form a very close and trusted business relationship with him and his team. He is very well respected within his organization and is a very honest and upfront manager. Tim is a very dedicated and tenacious individual who will bring any project assigned to a successful completion.

headline:
Director of Service Delivery 
- People Centric | Be Present | Champion Performance
about:
I’m a results-driven Service Delivery Director with a passion for building high-performing teams, optimizing operations, and delivering exceptional client experiences. With oversight of the largest department at In-Telecom, I lead initiatives that align people, process, product, and profit to drive measurable outcomes.

My leadership has helped double service-generated revenue, elevate team utilization to best-in-class levels, and transform our company culture through recognition, development, and engagement programs. I thrive on creating clarity, empowering others, and building scalable systems that support long-term growth.

Whether launching leadership programs like CONNECT, certification paths like ELEVATE, or refining service delivery through POD structures and audit processes, I bring energy, strategy, and accountability to every challenge.

Let’s connect if you’re passionate about operational excellence, team development, or transforming service delivery.

experiences.title: Director of Services Delivery
experiences.jobDescription:
People & Culture
• Led 25% of all company staff, overseeing the largest team umbrella in the organization.
• Reduced departmental turnover by implementing consistent 1-on-1s and feedback-driven coaching.
• Developed and promoted 2 internal managers and successfully onboarded 1 new external manager.
• Spearheaded the CONNECT internal leadership program and launched the ELEVATE certification roadmap to foster career growth.
• Revitalized company culture by enhancing the CREWHU recognition program, boosting engagement from 40% to 80%+.
• Boosted team engagement via "ITC Hero" profiles, quarterly team-building, and company-wide result infographics.
• Amplified company culture and recognition initiatives on LinkedIn, driving 83,764 impressions and reaching an audience of 16,500+ members.

Profit & Financial Impact
• Doubled service-generated revenue, adding $30,000+ in new monthly revenue by improving agreement clarity and instituting daily audits.
• Reduced overtime costs by an average of $3,500 per month through improved labor controls and efficiency.

Product & Service Excellence
• Achieved a best-in-class 98%+ CSAT rating while simultaneously doubling monthly service conversions from 250 to 500.
• Elevated team efficiency to 85%+ realized utilization, setting a new benchmark for performance.
• Enhanced client experience by implementing a POD (dedicated team) structure in the service department.
• Created and launched company pillars and the "REACH" theme to align vision and values for 2025.

Process & Operations
• Developed and implemented monthly report cards and departmental scorecards to drive performance visibility, accountability, and trend analysis.
• Instituted a daily audit process to ensure service agreement clarity and operational consistency.
• Rolled out new monthly fleet inspection and inventory control processes for all field technicians.

experiences.title: District Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Engaged retail leader committed to driving profitable performance growth, and developing talent.  Through communicating effectively, and empowering others, I have achieved positive impact to total company profitability.  I am strategic with data analysis, and execute the company play.  I am known for creating engaged environments for the associates, and customers, and recognizing top performance.

Areas of Expertise:
* Team Leadership - Engagement, Mentorship, Talent Retention
* Data Analysis / Business Acumen
* Strategic Merchandising
* Commitment to Customer Service (driving loyalty).

Key Accomplishments / Routines:
 
> Profitable Growth:  FY 2017 grew sales by over $1 million dollars exceeding $30 million, out pacing district and company averages.  Top performance consistently in managing labor, credit accounts, services, pro sales, online, and tool rental.  Lead the district in customer satisfaction feedback in two different locations driving loyalty.

> Operational Excellence:  Reduced YoY shrink in two stores through executing inventory controls.  Built  top teams in the district in Receiving / Freight Flow.  Conducted daily facility walks inspecting company standards, and safety.  Strategic focus, weekly, on "at risk" inventory to reduce lost profitability to margin erosion.  Weekly audits on front end check out, and service desk execution, to ensure P.O.S process is fast, friendly, and accurate.  Conducted daily inventory in-sock walks inspecting accuracy, and replenishment.

> People Development:  Reduced attrition in two locations exceeding district, and company, averages.  Weekly reviewed staffing needs, and conducted final interviews.  Conducted quarterly performance check-ins with salary team, and ensured all store reviews were completed timely, and with substance.  Held monthly town halls with team on growth opportunities, and blueprints to advance.  Rolled out many internal ways to drive engagement, and recognition.

experiences.title: Store Manager
experiences.jobDescription: Positively drove comp sales ahead of the market average.  Consistent leader in KPI's.  Responsible for total store performance, operations, staffing, safety, training, customer relations, shrink prevention, and profitability control.  District Community Captain and lead Market in grants awarded to the community.  Passion for people development, and driving associate engagement.

Passionate about people development and casting.
Positively grown store comp sales and services YOY.
Create a "pulse" in our store daily driving associate engagement,

Exceeded sales, credit, and customer satisfaction goals.
Facilitated store audits improving operations, and building impact action plans.
Monthly meetings with SVP of sales.
Improved management talent bench in market.
Facilitated market training in front of large groups.

* Led community involvement projects (Adopt a Family)

* Created district wide internal talent bench program
* Facilitated district trainings

recommendationsReceived.name: Delano Collins
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Chief Operating Officer @ Electronic Office | Cybersecurity, IT Services
recommendationsReceived.context: Matt was senior to Delano but didn't manage Delano directly
recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the privilege of working alongside Matt Gebbhart at In-Telecom, and I can say without hesitation that he embodies what it means to be a people-first leader. Matt leads with empathy, clarity, and purpose — always putting his team’s growth and well-being at the center of every decision.

What stands out most is his ability to create trust. He doesn’t just manage; he invests in people. Matt knows how to bring out the best in those around him, whether that means giving someone space to lead, offering thoughtful guidance, or rolling up his sleeves to help solve a problem.

He has a rare blend of operational sharpness and genuine human leadership — the kind that inspires loyalty, builds high-performing teams, and creates a culture where people want to give their best. Any organization would be lucky to have him leading the way.

I have had the pleasure of working with Matt and I can confidently say they are one of the most effective and inspiring retail leaders I’ve encountered. As a District Manager, Matt consistently demonstrated exceptional leadership, strategic vision, and an unwavering commitment to both people and performance.

They have an incredible ability to drive results through coaching, clear communication, and genuine care for their teams. Matt doesn’t just focus on metrics, but they build strong, motivated teams that deliver outstanding customer experiences and operational excellence across every location.

Their balance of analytical thinking and hands-on leadership makes them a trusted partner in any business initiative. Anyone who has the opportunity to work with Matt will quickly see their passion for developing talent and achieving sustained success in a fast-paced retail environment.

I highly recommend Matt for any leadership role that requires integrity, accountability, and a true ability to inspire others.

headline: 30+ Years Delivering Complex Technology Projects On Time, On Budget, and Securely
about:
With extensive experience in IT project management and security, I currently serve as an Information Security Engineer at Avexon. I contribute to reinforcing system security and privacy protocols, supported by my recent Criminal Justice Information Services Security and Privacy Training certification. My expertise includes leveraging tools like ConnectWise RMM, Jira, and Magix Vegas Pro to support secure web applications and related solutions.  

Previously, I managed application development projects for the State of Louisiana Department of Education, where I oversaw project planning, resource coordination, and quality assurance. Guided by a commitment to effective project execution, I focus on delivering secure, efficient solutions that meet organizational needs.

headline: MSP Executive Search Partner | Builder of High-Impact Leadership Teams | Talent Advisor
about:
Trusted Executive Search & HR Leader with deep experience designing and executing high-impact Talent Acquisition and People strategies. I bring a proven track record of building and leading HR functions in the MSP space—growing an organization from a founder-led, privately held business to a private equity-backed enterprise with a strong M&A and transaction focus.

This journey has fueled a fulfilling shift into Executive Search, where I’m now focused on leading seamless, high-touch CXO and VP-level searches across the MSP and IT services landscape.

Specialties: 
Executive Search | Talent Strategy | MSP & IT Services | Private Equity | Succession Planning | M&A Integration | Strategic Workforce Planning | Organizational Design | Culture & Vision Development | Leadership Coaching | Total Rewards | Talent Development | Employee Engagement | Change Management | Cross-Functional Collaboration | Human-Centric Leadership

experiences.title: Managing Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Position Summary:
SV Executive Search is a specialized retained search firm focused exclusively on the MSP and MSSP space. We partner with growth-minded, mid-sized IT services firms to help them attract and hire transformative CXO, VP, and Director-level talent.

What I Do:
Drawing on my experience scaling a national MSP platform, I lead retained executive searches that connect top-tier IT services leaders with forward-thinking MSPs and MSSPs across the country. My work is grounded in industry expertise, trusted relationships, and a hands-on approach that ensures every search is deeply tailored and executed with precision.

Searches Include (but not limited to):
• CEOs, CROs, COOs, CFOs, CMOs, CPOs, CISOs
• VPs of Sales, Operations, Delivery, Managed Services, Consulting, HR, and Marketing

I regularly collaborate with Boards of Directors, Private Equity firms, and executive leadership teams to build world-class organizations through high-impact leadership placements.

experiences.title: Vice President Human Resources
experiences.jobDescription:
Dataprise is one of the nation’s largest IT Managed Services Providers, headquartered in Rockville, Maryland with regional offices across the U.S.

As the most senior Human Resources leader, I reported directly to the CEO and led the People strategy through significant organizational transformation and growth.

Key Highlights:
-Provided executive HR leadership for a high-growth IT Services organization, aligning People strategy with business goals during a pivotal phase of PE-backed evolution and scale.
-Built and scaled the HR function from a privately held, founder-led business to a private equity-owned platform with an emphasis on M&A integration and organizational readiness for financial transactions.
-Served as a strategic advisor to the executive leadership team and a trusted advocate for employees—ensuring alignment, transparency, and engagement.
-Partnered cross-functionally to deliver HR solutions in employee relations, talent acquisition, compliance, performance management, organizational design, and workforce planning.
-Led a high-performing HR team responsible for the full employee lifecycle, including: recruiting, onboarding/offboarding, learning & development, performance management, DEI, payroll, benefits administration, and HR operations.

recommendationsReceived.context: Elena reported directly to Marissa
recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the pleasure of working with Marissa as my manager at Dataprise for about two years. When I started working with Marissa, my role as a Manager of L&D was completely new to the company, but she guided me and coached me so that I never felt lost. Under her leadership, I was able to grow professionally in numerous ways, and I owe much of that to her strategic ability to introduce me to new tasks and responsibilities that aligned with her deep knowledge of my strengths and interests.

As a leader, Marissa was always willing to share and discuss ideas, and she created an open, collaborative environment across our team that helped all of us grow. She understood each of her direct reports as people, which allowed her to lead with an empathetic, human-centered approach that ultimately led us to drive success across all of our employee experience initiatives. Any team or organization would be lucky to have Marissa leading their talent, HR, and people operations efforts.

I had the pleasure of working with Veronica during our time together at Dataprise, where she served as our Senior Credit & Collections Manager. Simply put, she was exceptional.

Veronica brought a rare combination of precision, persistence, and professionalism to everything she did. She navigated complex receivables with confidence and clarity, building strong relationships with both clients and internal teams along the way. Her ability to strike the right balance between firmness and diplomacy consistently drove results—improving collections performance while maintaining positive client rapport.

Beyond her technical skills, Veronica was a fantastic team player and collaborator. She approached challenges with a solutions-first mindset and was always willing to roll up her sleeves to support broader initiatives. She made a real impact during her time at Dataprise, and any organization would be lucky to have her on their team.

headline: MSSP GTM Partnerships @ Dispel
about: I am a Channel Leader with experience growing partnerships in SaaS/Cybersecurity organizations. My successful track record as a concierge to the partner community relies on my ability to foster relationships within my organization and with our partners. I also utilize a player/coach leadership style with my teams, which has allowed me to establish a performance culture where sales professionals are able to thrive. Channel Sales... is a passion not just a career.

experiences.title: Manager, Channel Sales
experiences.jobDescription:
- Accountable for the North American MSP sales, go-to-market activities and plans
- My team executes on this MSP go to market strategy by enabling, recruiting, and cross selling to MSPs directly and via RMM partners
- Responsible for leading and coaching MSP sales team in driving them to exceed targets
- Ensure our team strategy aligns with OpenText’s overall channel and sales strategy to drive top line revenue growth
- Actively work with Channel Marketing teams to foster a healthy partner ecosystem while driving executive level relationships within our partners
- Recruit, manage and develop new MSP salespeople when needed
- Contribute as a member of the channel leadership team, in an ongoing development and execution of the partner growth strategy.
- Capture and communicate market intelligence, best practices, and partner feedback across assigned territories to improve products and processes

experiences.title: Manager, MSP Partner Recruitment
experiences.jobDescription:
-While in my previous role as Sr. Partner Recruit Manager I helped developed Zix | AppRiver's first MSP centric recruit model and hired/trained/managed a growing team of BDRs, Channel Recruit Managers, and Onboarding Engineers. 
-Now lead the team of value driving hunters who specifically target MSP partners throughout North America with tangible partner benefits ahead of a prospective partner signing. 
- My team primarily leads with our Microsoft 365 offering to Microsoft CSP's with a long term goal of helping these partners identify opportunities within their own client base to upsell/cross sell additional managed services
-Work with Channel Marketing, Product Marketing, events team, and Product Managers to advocate for top of funnel MSP needs/issues cross-departmentally
-Post Onboarding my team facilitates a warm introduction and thorough handoff of MSP partners with the MSP CAM organization
-Work closely with the CAM/ICAM and other sales orgs along with sales leadership to execute GTM plans. 
-A Lead speaker at all OpenText Cybersecurity recruit focused tradeshows, keynotes, boardrooms, forums, and interviews.

recommendationsReceived.name: Danielle Ładzik
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior Account Manager | Delivering Scalable Revenue Growth & Client Success | Enterprise & SMB Sales
recommendationsReceived.context: Danielle reported directly to Kyle
recommendationsReceived.description: I highly recommend Kyle to any organization seeking a strong, people-focused leader. He consistently advocates for his team, fosters high morale through positive reinforcement, provides valuable learning resources, and empowers individuals with autonomy. Kyle was an exceptional manager, and I am confident he has the ability to guide any team toward sustained success.

recommendations.name: Jason Macias
recommendations.subtitle: CRO | SaaS & Cybersecurity Revenue Leader | Builder of High-Performing GTM Teams | Passionate About Growth, Retention & Customer Success
recommendations.context: Kyle reported directly to Jason
recommendations.description:
I’ve had the opportunity to work for Jason at multiple companies, and I can confidently say he’s the kind of leader you follow — not just because of title but because of the type of leadership he embraces. He consistently leads from the front, rolling up his sleeves, supporting his team, and staying deeply connected to the business. 

Jason gave me my first opportunity to lead a team, and I’m incredibly grateful for the trust and mentorship he provided. He’s a sales-savvy executive who understands how to align go-to-market strategy and revenue goals in a way that drives real, sustainable growth. But beyond the numbers, he cares deeply about the people on his team and is genuinely invested in helping others grow their careers.

If you’re looking for someone to lead your sales organization — or if you ever have the chance to work for Jason... do not hesitate.

recommendations.name: James Waters
recommendations.subtitle: Strategic Partner Account Executive
recommendations.context: Kyle managed James directly
recommendations.description:
I’ve had the privilege of working alongside Jim for several years, and it’s been incredible to watch his growth as a sales professional across a variety of roles. Whether leading direct sales efforts or more recently building and strengthening channel relationships, he brings the same level of energy, passion, and commitment to every opportunity.

Jim thrives in face-to-face environments — he’s at his best when out in the field, building real relationships with partners and customers, and selling with them, not just to them. He’s a sharp, value-driven sales professional who understands complex technology deeply, but what really sets him apart is his ability to pair that technical knowledge with strong rapport and trust — a combination that consistently drives results.

He’s a natural player-coach: a leader who leads from the front, puts his team first, and helps create a culture where people want to win together. Any team would be lucky to have him in their corner.

recommendations.name: Chelsea Sunderman
recommendations.subtitle: Passionate Partner & Customer Success Professional | Driving SaaS Growth & Engagement
recommendations.context: Kyle managed Chelsea directly
recommendations.description:
Chelsea made an immediate impact when she joined our team as a Regional Account Manager. From the start, she brought a fresh perspective, a sharp eye for inefficiencies, and the confidence to speak up and drive meaningful change. Her ability to challenge the norm — always with the goal of improving outcomes — helped us streamline several key processes and operate more effectively as a team.

She picked up our technology incredibly quickly and was soon demonstrating deep knowledge of our platform with customers, earning their trust and delivering real value. Her combination of quick learning, strategic thinking, and fearless communication made her an indispensable part of the team in a very short time.

Chelsea is the kind of person who doesn’t just take on a role — she elevates it. She is an asset to any organization.

recommendations.name: Abram Elmore
recommendations.subtitle: Graduate of the University of Southern Mississippi. Providing Excellence in Sales, Team Strategy, Account Management and having a good time since '99
recommendations.context: Kyle managed Abram directly
recommendations.description:
It was a pleasure having Abram on my team as a Regional Account Manager. From day one, he brought incredible energy and enthusiasm to the role — especially in his eagerness to get out in front of customers, build relationships face to face, and truly understand their needs.

Abram has a natural ability to connect with people, both externally with clients and internally across the team. They brought a spark to every meeting, contributed positively to team culture, and were always the first to step up and support others. At the same time, they never lost sight of the goal: delivering results for our customers and ensuring they got real value from our partnership.

With his work ethic, attitude, and hunger to grow, I have no doubt Abram has a very bright future ahead. Any team would be lucky to have them.

recommendations.name: Danielle Ładzik
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Account Manager | Delivering Scalable Revenue Growth & Client Success | Enterprise & SMB Sales
recommendations.context: Kyle managed Danielle directly
recommendations.description:
I had the pleasure of leading Danni in her role as an Strategic Account Manager, and I was consistently impressed by their work ethic and dedication to both our customers and our internal team. Danni brought a strong sense of ownership to everything she did — always going the extra mile to ensure our clients saw real, measurable value from our solution.

What stood out most was their willingness to challenge the status quo. She wasn't afraid to ask the hard questions or propose new approaches when something wasn’t working, always with the goal of improving the customer experience and our team’s performance. Danni combines strategic thinking with a strong customer-first mindset — a rare and valuable combination.

I’d highly recommend them to any organization looking for a thoughtful, driven, and customer-obsessed team member.

recommendations.name: Steven Harrell
recommendations.subtitle: Projects, services, and partner success specialist.
recommendations.context: Kyle managed Steven directly
recommendations.description:
I had the pleasure of managing Steven during his time as a Partner Success Representative at Liongard, and I can confidently say he’s one of those rare individuals who brings both technical acumen and a deep customer-first mindset to the table.

Steven has an exceptional ability to quickly grasp complex technologies and, more importantly, translate them into real-world solutions that make sense for his customers’ business goals. He’s not just focused on product knowledge—he focuses on outcomes. Whether it’s onboarding new clients, solving nuanced technical challenges, or proactively identifying ways to add value, Steven consistently showed up with thoughtfulness, initiative, and a great attitude.

He’s the kind of teammate you can always count on to dig in, stay curious, and deliver, customers trusted him, and so did the team.

If you’re looking for someone who can bridge the gap between technical depth and customer success with professionalism and a personal touch, I highly recommend Steven to any organization.

recommendations.name: Rajat Parmar रजत परमार
recommendations.subtitle: Inside Sales | IT Consulting | North America | Growth & Client Acquisition
recommendations.context: Kyle managed Rajat directly
recommendations.description:
I am pleased to recommend Rajat who has worked with me as a Partner Success Representative. During this time, he demonstrated exceptional skills in customer engagement and support.
Rajat has a remarkable ability to understand customer needs and provide tailored solutions. He consistently goes above and beyond to ensure customer satisfaction, and his proactive approach has significantly contributed to our retention rates.

One of Rajat's key strengths is his excellent communication skills. He has a natural talent for building rapport with customers, which not only fosters trust but also encourages open dialogue. This skill has enabled him to effectively handle inquiries and resolve issues promptly.

Additionally, Rajat is highly organized and detail-oriented, managing multiple accounts with ease. His ability to analyze customer feedback and leverage insights for continuous improvement has been invaluable to our team.

I wholeheartedly recommend Rajat for any position in customer success or related fields.

recommendations.name: Marco Lobo
recommendations.subtitle: Channel & Partner Strategy Evangelist | Driving Partner Growth & Alliances in Cybersecurity & SaaS | Helping VARs & MSPs Scale
recommendations.context: Kyle was senior to Marco but didn't manage Marco directly
recommendations.description: Marco is exactly what you look for when searching for top sales talent. He is extremely professional, brings a great attitude and out works the group. He is a quick learner that will develop quickly not only organically but he will take the time to apply himself to perfect his craft. Any organization would be lucky to have him onboard.

headline: Pragmatic Geospatial & Technology Leader • GIS, Cartography, Data Governance, and Technology • Mapping the future as Technology Director at the St. Tammany Parish Assessor’s Office
addressWithCountry: Greater New Orleans Region, United States
about:
I am a data and technology leader who gets excited about good maps, clean data, connecting people and systems, and building tools that make life easier for everyone who uses them.

For the past decade I’ve led the GIS transformation at the St. Tammany Parish Assessor’s Office, where I now serve as Technology Director. My team rebuilt our parcel data from the ground up, mapping more than 135,000 parcels in 12 years. We now share all of that data with the public via an interactive parcel map that is available on the Assessor's website. We also meticulously scrubbed legacy data errors in the Assessor's data management system and launched a modern, fully-integrated CAMA platform that shortened our production backlog from one year's worth of outstanding work items to just two weeks worth.

Along the way I’ve written the office’s guidance manual, automated data pipelines and custom quality control reports with Python, deployed a high-tech field data collection application, and created print and digital maps using a variety of modern mapping solutions. The common thread is craftsmanship, with focuses on quality over quantity, hands-on work, simple design, and an unwavering commitment to building a strong map, data, and technology foundation that will outlive my tenure at the office.

experiences.title: Technology Director
experiences.jobDescription: As Technology Director at the St. Tammany Parish Assessor's Office, I set the technology vision and data strategy, directing a multidisciplinary team that keeps our assessment, mapping, analytics, and technology platforms running around the clock to support the business of the office. In 2021 I led the rollout of a cloud-ready CAMA platform fully integrated with GIS and Clerk of Court records, significantly cutting parcel discovery time for Appraisers and improving throughput of recorded documents for Transfers Specialists. Since then I continue to oversee programs and projects that mapped 135,000+ parcels, surfaced missing improvement values, and scrubbed legacy data errors. I manage a large technology budget, help negotiate vendor contracts, and reinvest savings from automation and AI-supported solutions into training and new technologies. Above all, I mentor a high-performing crew of GIS analysts, developers, and other technology professionals, and help them turn “what if” ideas into production solutions.

experiences.title: Geographic Information System Coordinator
experiences.jobDescription: As the GIS Coordinator, I built the Assessor’s GIS program from the ground up, transforming a blank map into a mission-critical asset for Appraisers, the public, and partner agencies. I helped develop the public parcel map, creating a public product that increased data transparency and the office's interactions with the public. I created and maintained the STPAO GIS Guidance Manual, the standard for parcel mapping in the Assessor's Office. I designed and administered a version-controlled enterprise geodatabase that supported nearly a dozen daily users, spawned a robust quality control team, and saved staff time each year through the development of automated processes. Leading a team of GIS and Research Analysts, I delivered regular parcel-map updates, on-demand visuals for litigation, print and digital communications, and educational efforts, as well as strategic insights for leadership. I also developed interactive Leaflet web apps that visualized land-value changes and building-footprint evolution and led the initiative to provide maps and data capture tools using cutting-edge technology for field workers.

experiences.title: Cartographer
experiences.jobDescription: I created MM Maps in 2019 as a side venture for freelance cartographic work. I offer GIS services, custom data visualizations using Python, print and digital cartography, and interactive web mapping using Leaflet or ArcGIS Online for clients.

experiences.title: Board Member
experiences.jobDescription: Co-founded the Team O Classic, a Louisiana-based 501c3 non-profit organization, with my wife Sarah to raise money and awareness for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. Annual fundraising events include a professionally-sanctioned disc golf tournament named the Camellia City Classic.

updates.postText:
Saturday morning started in the 40s and warmed into the 70s by afternoon. 

While those temperatures were lovely for a day outside, they weren't the most impressive numbers that day.

#️⃣ 70 players
1️⃣ Our first ever Birdie-level sponsor Atmos Energy
2️⃣ Food sponsors (American Bank and Louis Fitzmorris)
➡️ 26 total hole sponsors

But the most important number of them all ...

🌟 $8,717 raised for St. Jude Children's Research Hospital

TEAM O CLASSIC's 5th annual Camellia City Classic disc golf tournament benefiting St. Jude was hosted at Fritchie Park in Slidell, Louisiana, this past Saturday and was a smashing success. It was a glorious day for disc golf and fundraising alike.

And our best year to date!

I am blown away, yet again, by the level of support for St. Jude from our local corporate partners and disc golf community. We've been able to raise more than $28,000 total now in the past five years through the Camellia City Classic.

Thank you to all the players, sponsors, the Professional Disc Golf Association, and our volunteers who continue to make this tournament a success every year.

See y'all again next Fall for year six!
The Pin Drop is a newsletter exploring mindset, leadership, and philosophy through the mediums of cartography, travel, and technology.
