When you run as a St. Jude Hero, your commitment to annual fundraising goals supports the life saving mission of St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital. To date, I've helped raise more than $100,000 for St. Jude via the Heroes program.

publications.title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Deal with the Hardest Part of a Mapping Project
publications.summary: With the proliferation of generative artificial intelligence tools like OpenAI's ChatGPT and Google's Bard in the past year, cartographers, GIS professionals, and geospatial developers alike are wondering: how can these powerful new tools be used to JUST GET STARTED, ALREADY?!? This presentation will demonstrate the power of ChatGPT in terms of dealing with data ETL, the often challenging first step of any mapping project.

publications.title: Making Trail Maps with Strava & QGIS
publications.summary: Mix one part love-of-running with one part love-of-mapping and BAM! A trail map! Combining these ingredients with the right utensils to make a map of your favorite local park is easy as pie.

publications.title: Authoring and Adhering to Standards in a GIS Environment
publications.summary: What do you get when you throw a dozen GIS professionals at a mapping project? A dozen different datasets, collected a dozen different ways, using a dozen different tools. In order to produce uniform data, authoring and adhering to a standards manual is essential for any GIS enterprise environment. But where do you begin? This case study of a small local government agency using a common note-taking application to achieve this goal will answer this question.

headline: Wholeness-Based Leadership | Formation, Faith, and the Inner Life of the Leader
about:
I explore leadership as a formative way of life, rooted in wholeness and shaped by lived experience in organizations, ministry, and study.

Through years of professional leadership, ministry, and academic work, I have become increasingly attentive to how leadership shapes people as much as outcomes. I have observed that leadership disconnected from the inner life of the leader often produces fragmentation within individuals and within the systems they are entrusted to lead.

My academic work in seminary has given language to this concern through a sustained focus on wholeness as an integrated way of being that attends to the intellectual, spiritual, emotional, and physical dimensions of a person. This has led me to articulate what I describe as wholeness based leadership, the conviction that leaders lead most faithfully, effectively, and sustainably when they attend to the whole person rather than separating public responsibility from private formation. Leadership grounded in wholeness forms resilient people who are capable of becoming leaders themselves.

Alongside this work, I lead and advise organizations across finance, media, and e commerce, serving in founder and executive roles while partnering with trusted operators and platforms. My understanding of leadership has been shaped in real organizations, with real people, real constraints, and real responsibility.

I approach leadership as a formative process rather than a technique, and I use this space to reflect publicly on leadership, integrity, vocation, and the inner life through experience, study, and ongoing discernment. I am not here to persuade or promote. I am here to think carefully, live honestly, and contribute to conversations that help leaders become more whole and help communities flourish as a result.

headline: Telecom Technical Project Manager
about:
Results-driven Telecom Manager with +16 years of experience and a proven track record in delivering successful projects within the telecommunications industry. Demonstrated expertise in Project Management, Vendor Management, Quality Control, Stakeholder Coordination and Customer Service. Proficient in ensuring adherence to industry standards, safety regulations, and customer requirements. Analytic troubleshooter with direct contact to technical Leaders, Managers, Project Directors and AVP with ability to communicate technical aspects to non-technical audience. Customer Oriented with creativity, motivation, teamwork, and leadership delivering in-time solutions, services and projects. Proficient in identifying customer needs and business opportunities. Interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills. Fluent in Spanish.
Expertise in:
- Project Management
- Team Building and Development
- Relationship Management (Cross-functional teams)
- Customer Service
- Vendor Management
- Training and Mentoring
- FOA (First Office Application), Service Delivery
- Engineering, Site Walks, PreNTP, Installation, Commissioning, Integration, Troubleshooting, Testing, Acceptance, Operations (TAC)

**Networks and Solutions**: Macro Outdoor and Indoor, IBS, Smallcell, Strands, CBRS, Distributed Antenna System - DAS, Base Band Unit - BBU, Radio Head Units, vDU, RF antenna systems, COW Cell on Wheels, OpenRAN, 4G and 5G KPI’s. CCNA IP knowledge, Router/Switch IP Connectivity, WiFi and low voltage.

🖥️ Software and Tools: Microsoft Windows, Linux, Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook), MS Visio, MS Project, Google Earth, Google Suite (Sheets, Slides, Docs, Forms, Drive, Gmail), Onevizion, Jira, Verizon Fuze, Smartsheet, PowerBI.

experiences.title: Construction Project Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
• Directed cell site orchestration and integration projects for vDU, in-building, small cells, and macro sites, while resolving complex vDU troubleshooting issues to ensure seamless site integration across the CTX Region.
• Led the crucial SC CDU30 to uADPF Conversion Program, successfully virtualizing Small Cell (SC) CRAN infrastructure by converting sites from the CDU30 platform to the uADPF configuration to enable vLTE technology.
• Managed the full lifecycle of the conversion, including coordinating execution across RF, Transport, Switch and Field teams and resolving technical issues to enhance network performance and efficiency.
• Collaborated with cross-functional teams to diagnose and resolve critical network equipment issues, ensuring maximum uptime and improving overall network performance.
• Leveraged deep expertise in RF, cell site construction, switch, and 5G technologies, utilizing advanced data management skills to accurately analyze, track, and report on project status and deployment results.

experiences.title: Program and Project Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
• Lead Verizon / Comcast / Dish Projects deploying Samsung Networks Solutions.
• Managed a remote commissioning and integration team of engineers to deploy Samsung RAN products in customer’s network, cell site integration work/commissioning of Macro Indoor and Outdoor, Inbuilding – IBS, SmallCell, Strands, CBRS, BBU, Radio Head Units, Antenna Lines, RET’s, 5G KPI’s, PIM, VSWR, MIMO, USM. Knowledge LTE, VoLTE, 5G KPI’s.
• Maintained internal dashboarding about Vendor scorecard and engineer performance scorecards for continuous improvement projects.
• Assisted on Resource planning, task assignment, tracking deliverables, and risk management, project LOEs, Statement of works, migration plans and unique deployment strategies for Samsung customers.
• Managed processes and best practices to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the commissioning team; Formulate, organize and monitor inter-connected projects.
• Collaborated with Stakeholders and upper management to determine suitable strategies and objectives, analyze and make decisions with the data that affect the project on a regular basis.
• Provided 24/7 on-call support as needed for commercial Network outages and network performance issues leading to RCA’s.

experiences.title: Technical Project Manager, Wireless Networks
experiences.jobDescription:
• Led end-to-end deployment for cell sites projects on following markets: Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Nebraska, Kansas, Oklahoma, Texas, including installation, commissioning, integration, and acceptance.
• Managed stakeholder relationships with AT&T, Ericsson, Nokia, T-Mobile, Verizon, Samsung and GBS PMO/Financial teams.
• Conducted in-depth data analysis to identify project risks and opportunities, optimizing resource allocation and project timelines.
• Collaborated with management and project teams to improve key performance indicators (KPIs) and ensure project success.
• Provided data analysis and reporting support to the India GBS team.
• Fulfilled regional responsibilities for HR, administration, and logistics in Chicago and Indianapolis.
• Overseen construction activities to ensure timely completion of the T-Mobile AEHC Swap project.
• Maintained effective internal and external communication with foremen, crews, quality teams, and management to coordinate project execution and maintain quality and compliance.
• Safety on-site audits: Conduct safety and environmental audits to ensure safety parameters are met on each activity.
• Incident investigations: Investigate incidents and near misses to identify root causes and corrective actions.

experiences.title: Telecomm Construction Manager
experiences.jobDescription:

- Facilitated effective communication between foremen, crews, quality assurance, and management teams to streamline project execution.
- Conducted thorough site inspections (site walks) to assess site conditions and prepare for efficient project implementation.

experiences.title: Deployment Project Manager

PM, supporting Network deployment of México central and south areas (R7, R8, R9).
- Ensured 99% effectiveness of network deployment and site integration according to rollout plan, working along with design, RAN, Transport (TX) and optimization areas.
- Managed FOA (First Office Application) for new equipment and devices to work on commercial environments.
- Pioneered technology adoption by deploying trial projects with new vendors and suppliers, introducing innovative RAN and Transport-TX solutions into the ALTAN commercial network.
- Optimized network performance by executing projects to enhance network quality and capacity, including split-sector implementations on existing sites.
- Maintained network uptime by planning, monitoring, and controlling RAN maintenance window activities, guaranteeing 100% network availability and zero service disruptions.
- Supported Sites Acceptance Process and Site transferring from Deployment Department to Operation Department.

headline: Business Owner | Director of Marketing | Digital Brand Strategist
about:
As a dedicated business owner, my focus is on delivering exceptional results for my clients while actively giving back to the community and creating a positive work environment for my team.

I am committed to providing my clients with high-quality design and marketing strategies tailored specifically to their brand and industry. By leveraging innovative approaches, I ensure that each solution not only meets their unique needs but also drives measurable business growth. 

I believe in the power of volunteering and giving back to our community, and I strive to contribute positively wherever I can.

I invite you to connect and discuss your business goals. Whether you’re looking to expand your social media presence, enhance your Google rankings, or develop a comprehensive marketing strategy, Anntoine Marketing + Design is here to help.

experiences.title: Company Owner
experiences.jobDescription:
Develop and implement strategic marketing and design plans for clients that align with their business goals and objectives.
Manage and oversee a team of marketing and design professionals, providing mentorship and guidance to ensure high-quality work and continued professional development.
Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, acting as their primary point of contact and ensuring excellent customer service.
Stay up-to-date with the latest marketing and design trends, technologies, and best practices, and incorporate them into client campaigns and projects as appropriate.
Conduct market research and analysis to inform marketing and design strategies and tactics, and provide insights and recommendations to clients.
Manage and oversee branding and visual identity materials, including logos, graphics, and style guides, that accurately represent clients' brand values and messaging.
Manage and oversee the development of marketing collateral such as websites, email campaigns, social media graphics, and print materials that meet clients' business needs and objectives.
Monitor and report on the effectiveness of marketing and design campaigns and projects, using data and analytics to measure success and make adjustments as needed.
Collaborate with other departments and stakeholders within the agency to ensure seamless execution of client campaigns and projects.
Ensure that all marketing and design work produced by the agency is of the highest quality, meets client expectations, and aligns with the agency's brand standards and values.
Manage budgets and timelines for client projects, ensuring that all work is completed on time and within budget.
Foster a positive and inclusive work environment for agency employees, promoting teamwork, creativity, and innovation.

headline: Sales Director | Helping Businesses Scale with CPaaS, CCaaS & UCaaS Solutions | Channel Partnerships | Driving Growth Through #BusinessTexting | 🥋 BJJ Black Belt
about:
I’m a sales leader passionate about helping organizations communicate better, through technology that builds trust and drives growth.

Over 10 years in SaaS, UCaaS, and CPaaS, I’ve led go-to-market and revenue strategies that grew pipeline and partnerships across industries from higher education to cloud communications.

As Sales Director at Beetexting, I lead direct and channel sales efforts, working with partners like RingCentral, AT&T Office@Hand, SpectrumVoIP, In-Telecom and Phone.com to deliver compliant, scalable business texting solutions. Our goal: make meaningful connections at scale without sacrificing compliance or customer care.

My leadership philosophy is rooted in service and empowerment, helping teams reach their full potential, supporting partners’ success, and always leading with integrity.

Let’s connect if you’re passionate about communication technology, partnership growth, or leadership through service.

experiences.title: Sales Director
experiences.jobDescription: As the Director of Sales, I lead a team of high-performing sales professionals who excel at building strong relationships and providing excellent customer service. I am responsible for developing and executing strategic sales plans, identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, and ensuring customer satisfaction and retention. My core competencies include strategic sales planning, revenue and growth, business development, client relations and service, account management, and relationship management. I am also a BJJ black belt who enjoys challenging myself and learning new skills.

experiences.title: Mid-Market Account Executive - CPaaS
experiences.jobDescription:
* Collaborated with cross-functional teams to launch go-to-market campaigns for 8x8’s CPaaS product line in the U.S., driving significant pipeline growth.
* Actively demoed and advised on 8x8’s communication APIs to C-level executives, co-founders, and developers—generating over \$2M in net-new ARR in 2022.
* Secured key logos across North and South America, including Square, Bloomberg, Deloitte, BetterHelp, Vsoft.com.br, ON24, Voxox, Athena Health, and Elevate K-12—each with \$10K+ in MRR.
* Partnered cross-functionally to identify API consumption trends and uncover new areas for growth and expansion.
* Consistently built personal pipeline using tools such as Groove, Outreach, and Seamless.ai.
* Proven success selling to both enterprise and SMB accounts—navigating long, complex sales cycles as well as fast-moving transactional deals.
* Proactively prospected and developed new Mid-Market accounts in the \$1K–\$3K MRR range.
* Hired, trained, and coached SDRs across EMEA and APAC, supporting international expansion efforts.

experiences.title: Enterprise Business Development - UCaaS/CCaaS
experiences.jobDescription:
Coordinated with marketing to assist enterprise-level accounts with their communication and collaboration solutions  
•	Advised director-level and C-suite representatives of their collaboration tools   
•	Worked with seasoned enterprise account managers in researching and assisting in finding the right contacts to assist with a better communications platform
•	Actively participated in live demo meetings to support and assist sales representatives
•       Partner with cross functional teams identifying opportunities
•       Hunted organically for new opportunities

experiences.title: Director Of Admissions
experiences.jobDescription:
Managed teams ranging in size from 13-32 individuals. 
•	Trained, coached, and mentored advisors on goal setting and leadership. 
•	Assisted with streamlining enrollment processes and procedures. 
•	Served as project manager for mass student acquisition from a closing for-profit university. 
•	Maintained consistent performance record of running a high-producing team, continually meeting or exceeding budget for 2+ years. 
•	Assisted numerous team members in developing professionally and advancing into leadership positions. 
•	Created leadership program focused on assisting future leaders of TUI with their career development.

experiences.title: Director of Admissions
experiences.jobDescription: Assisted with the development and implementation of the online program.  Worked with potential online students and assisted with the enrollment process.  Interviewed, hired, and trained new staff on enrollment strategies and processes.  Coached, mentored, and motivated current staff to hit monthly budget numbers in the areas of enrollment, retention, and graduation rates.  Ensured all departments were working together for the best interest of the student. Assisted financial aid department with completion of student files.

experiences.title: Senior Enrollment Advisor/Team Lead
experiences.jobDescription:
Coached, mentored, and advised new and existing counselors on new enrollment methods from the online campus. Introduced a retention strategy to the academic and finance department, which in turn produced a 15% increase in retention of new students over 6 months. Worked as a specialty counselor with nursing, education, and military students. Helped implement QC call to APIN strategy, which in turn raised lead-to-enrollment ratio among the campus. Maintained a QC conversion of 25% and a lead to contact ratio of 89% with a retention rate of 92%. Held weekly meetings to motivate, encourage, and communicate important changes of the enrollment process. Assisted with implementation of new federal rules and regulations.

Recognitions: Sperling Club Winner, Online Campus Southeast Region - 2007. Consistently placed in Top 5 Stack Ranking for Enrollment Counselors

OPDA is a group of privately held technology businesses that work together to create “business sounding boards” for each other. The organization controls membership so that there are no competing companies within the group. As a result, each member can participate as part of the group and feel free to openly discuss business issues with fellow business owners and senior leadership of OPDA organizations.

The organization focuses on helping the business owner and senior leadership of our membership companies with an open sharing platform offering advice and support as those companies determine their futures.

Excited to continue to help such a great set of volunteers and work with the new President, Ross Adair, and help his direction for Mill Creek Football in the future.
Helping direct the Mill Creek Touchdown Club as a former President and board member.

The Mill Creek Touchdown Club is a group made up of parents, volunteers, community members, business leaders and former students that are dedicated to helping our football program and community. 

Since the inception of Mill Creek High School, the Mill Creek Touchdown Club has served as the cornerstone of our football program.  We have helped establish Mill Creek High School as one of the premier high school athletic facilities in the South and have served to provide all players with a first-class experience during their high school career.  Your involvement in the Touchdown Club is one of the most important ways you can directly impact this experience.

Mill Creek Athletic Association was formed as the announcement of Mill Creek High School cluster was made as an organization that would provide children the ability to play many different sports using Gwinnett County Parks & Recreation facilities.   As Football Director I was ask to manage and facilitate what would become the largest youth football program in Gwinnett County and one of the larger in Georgia.  Along with 18 other volunteers the MCAA Football Board provided access to over 650 football players from the age of 6 years old to 8th grade the ability to experience and learn team sports.

Thanks to the great committee members who agreed to be part of our experts board.

Focus and passion are what I believe are the most important traits in the people that I work with, Tim has both!

recommendations.name: Sherrie Estep
recommendations.subtitle: Embroidery Entrepreneur | Making Things That Matter | Backing Ideas That Grow
recommendations.context: Michael was Sherrie's client
recommendations.description:
They say you only get one chance to make a first impression, well, in most cases for our company that first impression is our website.  Our account managers are constantly contacting and updating people via social media and email and the one common thread is our website.

BECA's most recent update was all Keweje's "brain-child"!  LIke many organizations in this economy our focus was on our day to day operations and trying to update our site and manage our site was just an after-thought, even though it is our first impression.  We wanted video and better interaction with our clients and a page that updated automatically via emails and other social media ... we got everything we wanted and now can even do day to day updates on items we want to resolve right away.

If your business requires a website and first impressions concern you, then I definately recommend Sherrie and her team to solve the problems!

Mike

about:
I am a Senior Medical Laboratory Scientist and public health professional with over a decade of experience in clinical laboratory science, research, and global health. A Johns Hopkins MPH graduate and MBA candidate, I bridge science, strategy, and policy to drive health innovation and regulatory excellence.

My career spans leading diagnostic operations, advancing women’s health initiatives that informs policy and practice. As a Senior Medical Laboratory Scientist and Clinical Researcher, I am committed to improving health systems, ensuring compliance with global standards, and mentoring the next generation of health professionals.

I thrive at the intersection of evidence-based decision-making, regulatory governance, and strategic leadership—turning data into actionable solutions that advance health equity and empower communities.

headline: WHO Advisor | Physician-Scientist  | Global Health Leader | RWE & Access | External Scientific Engagement & Evidence Translation | PhD Candidate (Epidemiology), Johns Hopkins
about:
Physician-epidemiologist and global health strategist with over a decade of experience bridging data, policy, and execution. Trained at Johns Hopkins (PhD, MPH, MBA), with advisory roles at WHO, Africa CDC, and the Tony Blair Institute and with African governments. 

My work focuses on translating science into impact through strategy, systems leadership, and health innovation.I have successfully led high-impact global initiatives in vaccine policy, drug safety, and pandemic preparedness, advising international organizations and various governmental and health-sector stakeholders. 

My leadership bridges the gap between epidemiological insights, public health strategy, and industry-driven health solutions.

Core Areas of Expertise:

1. Global Health Security & Strategy – Advising global institutions on disease prevention, emergency preparedness, outbreak response, and strategic health policy implementation.

2. Pharmacoepidemiology & Real-World Evidence (RWE) – Leading studies on vaccine effectiveness, drug safety surveillance, and regulatory science to inform public health policy and clinical practice.

3. Health Systems Strengthening – Developing sustainable interventions and robust healthcare frameworks in collaboration with global stakeholders to ensure preparedness and resilient health systems.

4. AI & Data-Driven Health Innovation – Utilizing advanced analytics and artificial intelligence to translate complex epidemiological and clinical data into actionable health solutions.

5. Multisector Leadership & Collaboration – Managing diverse international teams and cultivating strategic partnerships across academia, industry, governments, and NGOs to drive impactful global health outcomes.

I am passionate about leadership roles where I can shape global health strategy while also supporting the next generation of leaders. 

I want to leverage my experience in epidemiology, policy, and multisector partnerships to help foundations and institutions make smarter investments, strengthen health systems, and translate science into long-term impact.

updates.subTitle: Banda Strategy Brief – Newsletter
updates.title: Banda Strategy Brief – Newsletter

updates.postText:
I am honored to accept my appointment to serve on the newly established World Health Organization’s  Technical Advisory Group





The World Health Organization’s Emergency Preparedness & Response Technical Advisory Group (EPR-TAG) is an independent body of experts that will serve as the principal advisory group to the World Health Organization for strategic guidance.


Our focus will be on all matters pertaining to public health emergency preparedness and response across the African Region.


This is both an honor and a formidable challenge. 

It's surreal to be working alongside 14 highly accomplished experts.

Serving on this advisory group alongside Dr Ebere Okereke (Nigeria 🇳🇬 ), Prof. Helen Rees  (South Africa 🇿🇦), Prof. Rebecca Martin, Rick Bright (USA), and other exceptional professionals is a true honor. 


I do not take this opportunity and privilege for granted, knowing that more than 500 people were under consideration for this advisory group. 

Those who know a little about where my journey began will appreciate why this is a huge milestone.

This is a personal commitment to making a tangible difference.


Thank you to the regional director of WHO/AFRO and the independent selection committee for this incredible honor. 


——————————

Fun fact: I realized I am the youngest member of the Technical Advisory Group.   

I look forward to contributing to and learning from this distinguished group. 

Thanks to my wife, Umaima Tahir Banda MLS, MPH, and my Advisor, Prof. Emily Gurley, for their continuous support. 

And thanks to Dr Ebere Okereke for encouraging me to step up to the occasion.


 
Read More About the Press Release here

https://lnkd.in/ew4ht6Hu


#PublicHealth #WHO #EPRTAG #HealthSecurity #GlobalHealth #JohnsHopkinsAlumni

We ranked #1 Worldwide in Public Health; 

#3 Worldwide in Health & Medicine 



Few days ago, someone reached out via dm and said 


“Hi Dr. Banda,

I was perusing Favikon, a global creator ranking platform, and saw your name among the Top 3.
I thought it was worth sharing: congratulations!”


Naturally, I got curious and went to check on Favikon created by Jeremy Boissinot  & team



I’m still not sure about the full methodology Favikon uses…


But here’s what I found

—————-

🏆 #1 in Ghana (All Categories)

→ Ranked as the top voice across all content types among the top 200 LinkedIn creators from Ghana.



🏆 #1 Worldwide in Public Health & Epidemiology

→ Ranked as the top voice among 200 Linkedin creators in one of the most critical knowledge domains. (Public Health & Epi)



🥉 #3 Worldwide in Health & Medicine

→ Recognized among the top 200 Linkedin creators in medical and health



🌍 #83 Worldwide in All Categories

→ Listed among the Top 200 creators globally

Just behind the CEO of LinkedIn, Ryan Roslansky  :)
———————————————


➤ To be honest, I never set out to “rank.”

→ This community was never built for metrics.



It was built to:

→ Help students win scholarships

→ Guide international applicants

→ Bridge academia with global health practice

→ Share honest, practical advice at scale



But seeing that this message is reaching far beyond what I imagined?

That’s humbling. 

And it’s thanks to every single person who reads, shares, learns, and teaches others through this platform.

———————————————


The work continues on and off the timeline.

Rankings fade. 

But impact compounds.


Thank you for being part of the journey.



#FavikonTop200 #LinkedInCreators

How did a boy from a random village in Ghana end up in rooms with global leaders? The answer is simple




“ Education”.

 Let me explain

I still have a vivid image of exactly where I sat in class in my junior high school (building below)


Context:

↳ My parents cannot write their own names.


Yet, because of education, they raised:


→ A Member of Parliament and and a renowned politician. Hon. Banda Ben Abdallah. ESQ 


→ A Director of a major state institution.
 Abdallah Z.K.  Banda 


→ Multiple professionals impacting various sectors.


But let’s be clear: It wasn’t easy.


→ Parents & loved ones made sacrifices that we can never fully repay.


→ They chose our future over their present comfort.


→ They understood that education was the only way to change a family’s destiny.

—————————


So when people say, "Education is a scam," I think of only one thing: privilege.


🔹 They’ll cite examples like "Most billionaires didn’t get advanced degrees."


🔹 They’ll talk about "How some people made it without formal education."


🔹 But they forget the most important factor—the background of those people.


→ Not everyone is born into wealth. 

→ Not everyone has access to networks, capital, or opportunities that allow them to succeed without education.


For many of us, education was the ONLY bridge to a different future.


📌 Education can change the trajectory of generations.


📌 It breaks cycles of poverty, shifts mindsets, and creates opportunities that once seemed impossible.


➤ So when people ask me why I advocate for access to quality education, this is why.


Because I’ve lived it.


Because of education, I met my amazing wife Umaima Tahir Banda MLS, MPH  in the University. 

Who still teases me at times for attending a village school… lol..
————————

💬 What’s one lesson education has taught you? 

♻️Repost for education…😄


#Education #GenerationalImpact #Opportunity #Leadership #BreakingBarriers

publications.title: Barriers and determinants of consistent offering of HPV vaccination by healthcare facilities
publications.summary: Co-authored study on HPV Vaccination practices in Texas, revealing critical insights into healthcare providers' inconsistencies in vaccine offerings. Our research uncovers key barriers, especially in solo practices, and emphasizes the importance of system-level interventions for improved HPV vaccine management.

publications.title: The Global Health Security Index is not predictive of vaccine rollout responses among OECD countries
publications.summary: The findings suggest an absence of correlation between the GHS index rating and the COVID-19 vaccine rollout of OECD countries, indicating that the preparedness of OECD countries for infectious disease threats may not be accurately reflected by the GHS index.

publications.title: Statins use and COVID-19 outcomes in hospitalized patients
publications.summary: There is an urgent need for novel therapeutic strategies for reversing COVID-19-related lung inflammation. Recent evidence has demonstrated that the cholesterol-lowering agents, statins, are associated with reduced mortality in patients with various respiratory infections. We sought to investigate the relationship between statin use and COVID-19 disease severity in hospitalized patients.

publications.title: A Retrospective Analysis of the Impact of Bariatric Surgery on the Management of Chronic Migraine
publications.summary: Our study adds to the extant body of evidence that explores the relationship between weight and chronic migraines. Our study found a statistically significant association between bariatric surgery and chronic migraine remission.

publications.title: The Global Health Security Index is not predictive of coronavirus pandemic responses among Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development countries
publications.summary: This paper presents the first comparison of Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development OECD countries' performance during the pandemic, with the pre-COVID-19 pandemic preparedness as determined by the GHS Index.

recommendationsReceived.description:
I was Dr. Banda's preceptor for almost eleven (11) weeks in his  internship work in Lesotho physically and from a distance before he arrived and after he left.

I have worked with different learners with different calibers, but Dr. Banda’s was an outstanding one, as I worked and supervised Dr. Banda when we were writing and finalizing an Operational Plan for Voluntary Medical Male Circumcision (VMMC)/Early Infant Male Circumcision (EIMC) for Lesotho, from technical program implementation to costing its operationalization.

We worked from designing the technical implementation of the plan to the costing part of the plan where really demonstrated a driven mind-set of sustainable focused HIV services.

He demonstrated curiosity and motivation to learn, something rarely found in scholars of his caliber, as a highly learned and qualified person. His ability to listen more than talking gave him a chance to acquaint himself with the project thus able to share his understanding and proposed ideas, where the team members accepted most of them with much appreciations.

The operational plan that was Dr. Banda’s project for his internship is implemented by the country to save more lives and lessons learned being shared across the globe.

Considerably, Dr. Banda is a warm, engaging individual and is inclusive as he works, articulating his ideas and assignments intellectually.

Dr. Banda demonstrated his ability to articulate, read and utilize his knowledge effectively in the preparation of strong country strategic documents, which have greater impact in the future. He is technically built for sustainability of health services that involve lives saving innovatively and cost-effectively.

Colleagues were impressed by Dr. Banda’s knowledge on costing for the operational plan but also his ability to quickly understand the program services he was attached to work on. This was highly demonstrated in his comprehensive presentations not only to the organization but also to the Ministry of Health colleagues.

He is a resource to the global public health practices, and as a former preceptor for his internship, I strongly recommend him on possible engagements that will need his expertise.

headline: Health Informatics Program Director, PMP
about:
I am a results oriented Executive Consultant working with Clinical and Research Organizations to effect healthcare reform by integrating and analyzing data to effect change.  I am utilizing, as the program manager and the lead architect, the lessons learned from years working with other industries (retail, industrial and social services) that transformed themselves in a large part by integrating and analyzing data throughout the entire organization. Healthcare costs is the most important issue we all face in today’s market.  The healthcare industry is facing great challenges to effectively integrate great quantifies of operational data to increase the speed and accuracy of research and to improve the quality of clinical care while decreasing the cost of delivery.  My success in delivering informatics systems that provide real long lasting business value is my commitment to solving the customer’s problem with pragmatic, quality solutions.

Specialties: 
Healthcare Informatics Roadmaps, Architecture, and Implementation
Architecting Data Governance Solutions 
Managing the implementations of Enterprise Data Warehouse, BI Solutions, Metadata Repositories

experiences.title: Principal
experiences.jobDescription:
Principal and founder of a consultancy focused on delivering informatics solutions to enable organizations to harness their data to gain business insight and facilitate information transparency.  Services available:

Proposal Development
Stakeholder Relationship Management guidance
Project Management guidance
Data Governance Program Design
Informatics Design

experiences.title: Director Business Intelligence Programs
experiences.jobDescription: Responsible for developing data management, information sharing, business intelligence and information integrity solution for selected Federal Government Agencies and Health Care Organizations. For Customs and Border Protection agency, developed the roadmap for the creation of an enterprise wide data management branch chartered to provide guidance and governance for component wide sharing of information.  The data governance guidance, the data architecture definition, data quality council and the metadata and master data pilot implementations are serving to facilitate information sharing and data reuse and reduce the instances of duplicate and inconsistent data.  These practices are improving the mission of the CBP and reducing the costs to deliver services.

experiences.title: Associate Partner
experiences.jobDescription:
Responsible for the sales and execution of information on demand solutions to public sector clients including Federal Government Agencies, State and Local Government Agencies, and Health Care Organizations. Designed and implemented over a dozen large scale enterprise wide data warehouses in various health care organizations, state government and federal agencies.

Working with the Geisinger Health Systems’ CIO, Chief Innovation Office, and Chief Quality Office, I architected and managed the implementation of the first release of Geisigner’s Clinical Decision Intelligence System (CDIS), an enterprise-wide warehouse which integrates patient information from data sources including electronic medical records, pathology data, risk data, clinical billing records, medical and pharmaceutical claims, and patient satisfaction data. From Geisinger’s website (http://www.geisinger.org/research/gchr/BRDC.html). The CDIS supports “Geisinger investigators, physician-scientists, and clinicians and is an indispensable quantitative resource for interpreting and understanding scientific data and furthering biomedical investigations. The BC has many on-going projects within and outside of the Center for Health Research. There are several with the critical care medicine, rheumatology, nephrology, and cardiology departments, and the Sigfried and Janet Weis Center for Research.”

headline: Senior Technical Program Manager @ Pure Storage | Leading Agile Transformation and Technical Program Management
about:
Results driven program management professional with skills in directing full cycles of complex, multi-site programs and initiatives. 15+ years leadership experience in software development and quality assurance with start-up to Fortune 500 companies. Demonstrated success in working with cross-functional teams and building relationships with all levels of organization to drive business results, continuous process improvements, and superior customer satisfaction. Self-starter with an infectious “Can do” attitude. Strong Business Focus, Execution Ability, Leadership, and Interpersonal skills.

Drive and manage at project, program, and portfolio level activities from product concept, early design stages to production and EOS/EOL.

Certifications:
• Certified Scrum Master (CSM)
• Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO)
• ICAgile Certified Professional
• ICAgile Agile Team Facilitation (ICP-ATF)
• ICAgile Agile Coaching (ICP-ACC)
• EXIN DevOps Foundation
• Certified DevOps
• In the process to obtain Project Management Institute (PMI) PMP certification

Specialties:
• Portfolio / Program / Project Management
• Manage multiple projects/releases at the same time
• Manage on premise and Cloud/Software as a Service (SaaS) releases
• Comprehensive Knowledge of Software/Product Development Life Cycle (SDLC/PDLC)
• Manage teams Local, Remote & Offshore
• Agile/Scrum/Kanban/Iterative/Waterfall
• Team Building, Mentoring & Leadership
• Problem identification & solving
• Process Management
• Release & Change Management
• Product Management
• Vendor Management
• Process Improvement
• User Experience (UX)
• Quality Assurance, Quality Engineering
• Community Management
• Webmaster
• Coaching, Mentoring, Facilitating, Training, Teaching

Volunteer Services:
• Served as webmaster for middle/high schools in San Ramon, CA.
• Served as site council member for middle school in San Ramon, CA.
• Involved in PTSA and Academic Booster for middle and high schools in San Ramon.

experiences.title: Agile Coach / Sr. Technical Program Manager
Senior Program Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Hands-on technical experience to lead and manage product releases from initial concept to general availability (Agile/Scrum). Lead cross functional multi-location teams and drive cross functional deliverables. Drive process improvement.

Managed Multiple Product Releases (major, minor & maintenance) – SaaS base applications - Equinix Cloud Exchange Portal (Node.js, Docker & Shipyard), Equinix Cloud Exchange API/SDK (APIGEE), Equinix Internet Exchange Portal/API, Equinix NOC Console/API

experiences.title: Senior Program Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Hands-on technical experience to lead and manage product releases from initial concept to general availability (complete SDLC) using Agile/Scrum or Waterfall. Lead cross functional multi-location teams and drive cross functional deliverables. Drive process improvement and release management initiatives. Mentor and coach new program managers.

Product Releases:
• VMware vCenter Operations Management Solutions (20+ adapters + management packs, SDK)
* VMware vCenter Operations Management Suite (5 products), vCenter Operations Manager, vCenter Chargeback Manager
• VMware vFabric Suite (13 products) - vFabric tc Server, vFabric Web Server, vFabric RabbitMQ, vFabric Elastic Memory for Java, vFabric GemFire, vFabric SQLFire
• VMware Workstation, Fusion, ACE and Player
• Products generate revenue ranging from $50M to $200M.

Process Improvement & Initiative 
• Release Management Master Checklist
• Third Party Software Management (process, tool, training)
• InterOp Tool

Tools Improvement
• New features & releases for Download Maintenance Tool, BOM Tool, InterOp Tool
• Act as Scrum Product Owner for new tool – Central Binary Repository

Accessibility Testing
• Coordinate with external vendor to perform accessibility testing (Section 508 Compliance) for 7 product releases. 
• Work with web marketing team to publish VPATs on vmware.com.

experiences.title: Senior Technical Program Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Managed programs for system certification, pre-release requests, feature request escalations, and product commitments. Led and manage product releases (Agile/Scrum, Iterative Development and Waterfall). Served as product liaison between product operation (product management and engineering) and field (sales, consulting, system engineering, and technical support). Acted as community manager for team and division (discussions, Wiki documents, blogs, databases, tags). Performed market research for current and future supported platforms.
•	Improved customer satisfaction, reduced escalations, and reduced development cost with cross-products system certification requirements (covered 80+ software products; 3 major releases and 13 minor releases over 6 years) and processes (involved 2,000+ business unit workers).
•	Assisted and coordinated globally-located cross-functional teams to close 10 to 20 sale deals per quarter with sizes ranging from $5K to $5M.
•	Increased sales opportunities to government and global 2000 companies by leading and coordinating initiatives to add the support for IPv6, native 64-bit support, and Section 508 compliance.
•	Increased cross-sales opportunities by coordinating improvements and maintaining interoperability with partners’ products and by acquiring and maintaining certification roadmaps; exchanged roadmaps and maintained relationships with 15+ third party partners.
•	Provided sales support for 1000+ field personnel by resolving 100+ product escalation and technical cases per quarter.

experiences.companyName: Documentum, Inc. (Acquired by EMC Corporation in 2003)
experiences.title: Team Lead, Quality Assurance
experiences.jobDescription:

Initiated and created best practice documents to ensure team worked with consistent processes. Volunteered to provide valuable feedback to multiple internal and external usability studies and beta programs.
•	Maximized productivity by originating and implementing a 16x5 team hand off process. 
•	Increased operation effectiveness and improved product quality before release by introducing a “tight continuous integration” process between QA, engineering, technical publication, technical support, and product management.
•	Reduced acceptance test time by 80% by implementing automated test suites.
•	Enhanced product knowledge and technical expertise for product managers and engineers by proactively researching, acquiring, and sharing news, competitive information, and technical materials like books, papers, podcasts, and websites; initiated and maintained technical library used by 200+ product operation users.

• Reviewed & provided feedback to functional requirements and design specifications.

• Worked closely with developers in defect resolution and troubleshooting.

• Acted as mentor to junior team members.

headline: Amplifying brands' stories to Fortune’s influential audience @ FORTUNE
jobLocation: New York, New York, United States
addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
about:
With more than five years of professional experience in the media, technology consulting, and recruiting sectors, I am a dedicated and motivated individual who excels at devising creative solutions, cultivating meaningful connections, and making a positive impact.

Throughout my career I've collaborated with cross-functional teams, external vendors, and senior stakeholders to ensure the alignment of goals, expectations, and deliverables. I leverage my skills in business development, sales, account management, client management, and effective communication to foster a culture of trust, excellence, and innovation. Previously, my recruitment efforts have varied for roles in delivery leadership, strategy and operations, organizational effectiveness, Salesforce, and data & analytics. 

I participate in initiatives and programs that champion diversity and inclusion, promote social change, and contribute to personal growth and development.

experiences.title: Associate Account Executive
experiences.jobDescription: Promoted to Associate Account Executive in May 2025
experiences.jobLocation: New York, New York, United States

experiences.title: Partnerships & Sales, Media
experiences.jobDescription:
I collaborate closely with Fortune 500 partners and emerging companies that have compelling stories and significant achievements to share with the right audience. My focus is on bringing these narratives to life by leveraging Fortune’s platform to engage high-level decision makers and investors.

𝗠𝘆 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗲 𝘀𝗽𝗮𝗻𝘀 𝗮𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀:
· 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: From long-form articles to animated infographics, I craft narratives that resonate with audiences.
· 𝗘𝘃𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗮𝗴𝗲 & 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀: Extending the reach of thought leadership events through tailored recap articles, videos, and Q&A features. I also collaborate on virtual and live conference programming to engage high-value audiences.
· 𝗩𝗶𝗱𝗲𝗼 𝗦𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘆𝘁𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴: Producing dynamic company profiles, interviews, and documentary style storytelling to showcase transformation and innovation.
· 𝗜𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗱 𝗖𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗴𝗻𝘀: Developing multi-platform strategies that align with business goals and deliver measurable outcomes.
· 𝗦𝘆𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 & 𝗔𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻: Ensuring content reaches decision-makers through targeted native and social distribution.

With a focus on collaboration and creativity, I help brands tell their stories in ways that inspire action and foster lasting connections.

For inquiries, feel free to contact me directly at 𝗻𝗼𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗲.𝗳𝗹𝘆𝗻𝗻@𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗲.𝗰𝗼𝗺.

· 𝗕𝗼𝗼𝗸 𝗮 𝗺𝗲𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 ❯ https://calendly.com/noelle-flynn-fortune/30min
· 𝗙𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗠𝗲𝗱𝗶𝗮 𝗞𝗶𝘁 ❯ https://fortunemediakit.com/
· 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗳𝗲𝗿𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀 ❯ https://fortune.com/conferences
· 𝗙𝗼𝗿𝘁𝘂𝗻𝗲 𝗕𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗦𝘁𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗼 ❯ https://brand-studio.fortune.com/fortune-brand-studio/fbs-portfolio/?prx_t=Q4gFAAAAAAovEQA

experiences.title: Talent Acquisition Analyst
experiences.jobDescription:
Slalom is a purpose-led, global business and technology consulting company. Our purpose—to help people and organizations dream bigger, move faster, and build better tomorrows for all—guides everything we do. And our north star is our vision of a world in which each person has the opportunity to love their life and work.

Since our consulting business started in 2001, Slalom has grown rapidly to 13,000+ team members in eight countries and 45 markets. We have close partnerships with over 400 leading technology providers, including AWS, Google, Microsoft, Salesforce, Snowflake, and Tableau.

From strategy to implementation, our approach is fiercely human. We deeply understand our customers—and their customers—to deliver practical, end-to-end solutions that drive meaningful impact.

experiences.jobDescription:
With the 2.5+ years I was at Frank Recruitment Group (Mason Frank) I - 
∘ Successfully business developed and account managed full 360 end-to-end recruitment in the financial services sector to become the sole client manager
∘ Identify key trends and emerging technologies in the financial services industry and provide strategic advice to clients on how to leverage Salesforce skill sets to stay ahead of competition
∘ Efficiently negotiated client contracts, demonstrating a high level of proficiency and expertise in securing favorable terms and agreements that align with the client's needs and objectives
∘ Develop and execute customized sales strategies based on client needs to maximize revenue and exceeded billing expectations
∘ Lead the financial services vertical while developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders in the to identify their pain points and provide solutions through Salesforce hiring
∘ Effectively trained and mentored incoming team members to ensure the success of the team
∘ Become a subject matter expert in a niche CRM market by implementing a regional market map of passive Salesforce talent allowing for punctual candidate delivery
∘ Recipient of the Customer Service Award from Frank Recruitment Group in October 2020
∘ Designed script marketing campaigns in traditional and networking media applications to build relevant candidate and client relations 
∘ Account managed clients that were successfully business developed by tracking vacancies and initiating recruitment as well as interview processes to identify qualified candidates

experiences.title: Salesforce Recruitment Consultant
experiences.jobDescription:
Frank Recruitment Group is a global leader in staffing for IT professionals. We’re backed by TPG Growth, one of the world’s leading private equity firms, who count Uber, Airbnb, Survey Monkey, and Spotify amongst their portfolio. Since 2006, we’ve helped to connect businesses of all sizes with permanent and contract workers; from start-ups in need of a single developer to international enterprise clients building a complete team in a new country.

Mason Frank is one of the nine brands under the Frank Recruitment Group umbrella, and focuses exclusively on Salesforce recruitment. Since 2010, we’ve worked with over 6,000 organizations in 87 countries to deliver the very best talent in the Salesforce ecosystem. We find great people great jobs.

updates.postText:
✨ Fortune's 2025 Most Powerful Rising Executives list is officially here!

Of the 25 executive honorees, 7 are women:
- Halide Alagöz, Chief Product & Merchandising Officer, Ralph Lauren
- Karen S. Carter, Chief Operating Officer, Dow
- Diana Frost, Global Chief Growth Officer, Kraft Heinz
- Kate Gutmann, EVP & President, International Healthcare & Supply Chain Solutions, UPS
- Marianne Lake, CEO, Consumer & Community Banking, JPMorganChase 
- Donna Langley DBE, Chairman, NBCUniversal Entertainment, NBCUniversal
- Anna Marrs, Group President, Global Merchant & Network Services, American Express

These women are leading some of the world’s most complex organizations across consumer, finance, media, logistics, fashion, payments, and global operations by shaping how products are built, how companies grow, and how industries evolve. 

Congratulations to all of this year’s honorees, and thank you to all of the women who continue to pave the way for others. 🌟 

Editor, Fortune NXTL: Ruth Umoh 

Fortune Most Powerful Women
#MostPowerfulRisingExecutives #NextToLead #WomenInLeadership #Fortune

The 71st edition of the #Fortune500 is LIVE, and women now lead 55 of America’s largest companies at a record 11%! 💪 

This year, the Fortune 500 is excited to welcome 9 new female CEOs: 
➖ Kecia Steelman @ Ulta Beauty
➖ Deanna Strable-Soethout @ Principal Financial Group
➖ Shelley Simpson @ J.B. Hunt Transport Services, Inc. 
➖ Gunjan Kedia @ U.S. Bank
➖ Maryann Mannen @ Marathon Petroleum Corporation
➖ Susan Morris @ Albertsons Companies
➖ Jennifer Witz @ SiriusXM
➖ Martina Cheung @ S&P Global
➖ Kathleen Quirk @ Freeport-McMoRan

After remaining unchanged at 52 between 2023 and 2024, the number of female CEOs in the #F500 rose to 55 in 2025.

Read the full story here - https://lnkd.in/eGPnrr8V

recommendationsReceived.name: Iris Chen
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Talent Acquisition Leader | Advocate for Inclusion and Growth
recommendationsReceived.context: Iris was senior to Noelle but didn't manage Noelle directly
recommendationsReceived.description:
I had the pleasure of working closely with Noelle for almost 2 years at Slalom. Throughout our professional journey together, Noelle consistently delivered exceptional results to our hiring teams, establishing herself as a strong recruiting partner. 

I always appreciated Noelle's commitment to fostering meaningful and impactful connections with everyone she crossed paths with. Her ability to have authentic relationships added so much to our team's culture and dynamic. 

I am confident that Noelle's adaptability will take her far. Her ability to successfully pivot from Talent Acquisition, into a role within the Alliance/ Partner space truly shows how versatile she is.  Her dedication, work ethic, positivity, and strong relationship building skills will make her an asset to any organization.

recommendationsReceived.name: Alvine A. A.
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Portfolio and Quality Management | Compassionate Leader | Dream Chaser
recommendationsReceived.context: Alvine A. was Noelle's client
recommendationsReceived.description: Noelle supported my team with the talent acquisition process. She was diligent in ensuring that everyone involved in the process was prepared for the conversations. I appreciated her curiosity during the process by obtaining feedback about the interview experience from all parties. She was a willing partner with me and my team to ensure that we had a consistent interview process. Thank you for your hard work and dedication to making finding the right talent a more seamless process!

recommendationsReceived.name: Grace Zwaan
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Global Partnership Development - Microsoft @ Slalom
recommendationsReceived.context: Grace managed Noelle directly
recommendationsReceived.description: I would personally recommend Noelle for any future professional endeavors. I had the privilege of working closely with Noelle as part of an alliance team, and I can confidently attest to her exceptional qualities as a team member. Noelle was always positive, responsive, and dedicated.

recommendationsReceived.name: Lisa Dubin
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Talent Acquisition Lead
recommendationsReceived.context: Lisa worked with Noelle on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description:
I am delighted to recommend Noelle as a highly skilled and dedicated recruiter. I had the privilege of working closely with Noelle at Slalom, and she has consistently demonstrated expertise in the field of recruitment. She takes a strategic and personalized approach to every search and has an innate understanding of our company's needs and goals. 

Noelle communicates effectively, maintains a positive attitude, and is always open to feedback and collaboration. I have no doubt that Noelle will continue to excel in their career and be a valuable asset to any organization lucky enough to have them on board.

recommendationsReceived.name: Christopher Walrath
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Elevating Potential | Building Belonging | Leading with Intention | 40 Under 40 Honoree 🏅
recommendationsReceived.context: Christopher was senior to Noelle but didn't manage Noelle directly
recommendationsReceived.description:
I am delighted to recommend Noelle Flynn, who has proven to be an invaluable asset to our recruiting team over the past two years. Throughout her tenure, Noelle consistently demonstrated exceptional dedication, meticulous attention to detail, and a profound understanding of the critical criteria that drive our ongoing recruiting initiatives. One particular instance that stands out is our collaboration on the successful launch of the Hiring our Heroes program in the New York market. Noelle approached this new IDE Program with enthusiasm and a radiant smile, showcasing her eagerness to learn.

What truly sets Noelle apart is her unwavering commitment to delivering outstanding results. She consistently goes above and beyond in every aspect of her work, leaving no stone unturned in our pursuit of exceptional talent. Noelle possesses a remarkable ability to connect with candidates on a personal level, extracting valuable insights into their personalities and analytical capabilities. Her seamless collaboration with the team has significantly elevated our hiring process.

Noelle is undeniably an outstanding contributor with a promising future ahead of her, and I wholeheartedly endorse her for her exceptional contributions. If you require any further insights into her qualifications and contributions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

recommendationsReceived.name: Kennedy Watters
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Talent Acquisition | Full Cycle Recruitment | Relationship Building
recommendationsReceived.description: Noelle was always a pleasure to work with. She presented candidates in a timely manner and understood our needs from both a technical and cultural standpoint. I always enjoyed working with her and wish her all the best.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jessica Perone
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior Salesforce Administrator/Senior Applications Administrator
recommendationsReceived.context: Noelle was Jessica's client
recommendationsReceived.description: Noelle has been very helpful and kind in my latest job search. She kept me informed of new opportunities that came up that she felt would be a good match - and she asked plenty of questions about my experience and what exactly I was looking for. My search was pretty specific. I wasn't looking for just any company to join. I had ideals and personal mission goals and was looking for a company that matched those. In a short period of time, Noelle got me in contact with a company that matched my search very well. Thanks to Noelle's help and persistence, I am happy to say I now work there! I highly recommend Noelle to anyone looking for a new opportunity.

recommendationsReceived.name: Brooke Kline
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior Programmer Analyst
recommendationsReceived.context: Brooke was Noelle's client
recommendationsReceived.description: Noelle has been absolutely amazing throughout the whole recruitment process! I have never met such a dedicated recruitment person. I cannot thank you enough for you full support, for believing in me and for helping me start a new chapter of my professional career  Noelle, you are brilliant at what you do!

recommendationsReceived.name: Jake Latchum
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Technical Operations Manager at QTrak, Inc.
recommendationsReceived.context: Jake was Noelle's client
recommendationsReceived.description: I had the pleasure of working with Noelle to find my first job out of college, during covid, and in the Salesforce industry. Throughout my journey, Noelle was the most responsive and professional recruiter I had worked with. I would recommend Noelle to any young professional, interested in Salesforce because of her great customer service skills and desire to find you a job, that’s right for you.

recommendationsReceived.name: Beth Garvey
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Talent Acquisition Consultant
recommendationsReceived.context: Beth was Noelle's client
recommendationsReceived.description: I had the pleasure of working with Noelle on a Salesforce position.  Noelle is very professional, easy to work with and always very positive.  She has great follow through and account management skills.

recommendationsReceived.name: Julia P.
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Salesforce and Marketing Automation Expert
recommendationsReceived.context: Julia was Noelle's client
recommendationsReceived.description: Noelle is an absolute pleasure to work with! She is very engaging and communicative during the recruitment process, and shows that she is dedicated to helping you look for the right opportunity. She is friendly and approachable, yet effective and assertive in advocating for her candidates. She keeps you updated throughout the entire recruitment process, and she ensures that you are set up for success. If you need help looking for your next big opportunity, I would definitely recommend working with Noelle!

recommendationsReceived.name: Jordan Ezell
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Senior Strategist at The Sasha Group
recommendationsReceived.context: Jordan worked with Noelle but on different teams
recommendationsReceived.description: During my time at Frank Recruitment Group, I couldn't have asked for a better colleague and friend than Noelle Flynn. Noelle is extremely knowledgeable about Salesforce and is one of the most thoughtful recruiters that I know. She truly cares about the outcomes for her candidates and clients, which is a rare quality to find in a recruiter. Noelle is hardworking, kind, compassionate, and never backs down from a challenge or stepping outside of her comfort zone. She's truly a valuable team player and is an asset to have on your team.

recommendations.name: Christopher Walrath
recommendations.subtitle: Elevating Potential | Building Belonging | Leading with Intention | 40 Under 40 Honoree 🏅
recommendations.context: Christopher was senior to Noelle but didn't manage Noelle directly
recommendations.description:
Chris has not only been an invaluable colleague but also a mentor and friend who played a significant role in my career growth. He consistently went above and beyond to provide guidance and create opportunities to help me develop and excel in my career. During our time together at Slalom, Chris was a driving force in promoting ID&E within our organization in creating thoughtful initiatives and showcasing his leadership as well as commitment. He not only helped to create a more inclusive workplace but also inspired others to get involved and make a positive impact. 

What sets Chris apart is his unwavering thoughtfulness. Whether it was checking in or simply lending a sympathetic ear, Chris consistently demonstrated empathy and genuine care for the well-being of those around. Chris is not only a wonderful person to have as a colleague but also as a friend.

recommendations.name: Jordan Ezell
recommendations.subtitle: Senior Strategist at The Sasha Group
recommendations.context: Noelle worked with Jordan but on different teams
recommendations.description: I'm thankful to have had the opportunity to work with Jordan. Jordan and I were in the same company in which we both started on the same date. Within the first several weeks of working, she had been unanimously voted as the MVP of our group. She has an impressive skill set and is one of the hardest workers that I have had the pleasure of working with. We immediately recognized how much she brought to the table, even those working on different teams. She is a great asset to any organization, and I hope to someday work together again.

The authority statement about narrative alignment is generic but relevant. The 'Fortune' authority claim is completely wrong, as the person works *at* FORTUNE magazine, not *for* the Fortune 500 list.

headline: Developing products that move the needle & elevating the teams behind them
about:
I'm a Technology Consultant for financial organizations. Translation: I'm the behind-the-scenes person that helps build the right tech tools for bankers and wealth managers to do their jobs better and faster. 

✅Strengths: turning ideas into action + Salesforce + Software product design and management + Clear communication & writing

🏳️Weaknesses: Excel (but I’m working on it!)

💡Ask me about: best & worst apps, travel tips, how to coach people into being more decisive, and why volunteering should be mandatory - I've got thoughts!

👀Dislikes: meetings that could've been emails + wasting time in meetings

🌍Fun fact: Born and raised in South Africa, made the leap to the U.S. at 18 — and yes, that header photo is from the top of Mt. Kilimanjaro (worth every step).

If you’d like to reach out, please be authentic and intentional about why we should become better acquainted. 

Disclaimer: All views and content posted on this account are my own and do not directly represent the organizations I am affiliated with.

updates.postText:
I’m elated to announce that these are the vibes on my Teams status from 12-1pm until further notice! Food is my fuel, and my quality of work is exponentially better when I’m not running on an empty tank. 

Let’s normalize taking care of ourselves on and off the clock :)

#wfh #wellness

There were a lot of good takeaways but my current fav is: better to have an oops, than a what if.

The speakers at the #under30summit were great, but the caliber of attendees? Unreal. It’s been an amazing last few days connecting with such kind & bright souls! Here’s to more spaces that encourage connection & community.

Thank you Forbes 💜

 #forbes #forbes30under30 #detroit

volunteerAndAwards.description: At sixteen years old I volunteered to travel to Lele village in the valleys of Nepal with the hope of re-building a primary school that was destroyed in the devastating 2015 earthquake along with 50 other global student volunteers for a period of 14 days.

I completed 37 hours of volunteering during my Spring 2019 semester by visiting the Samaritan Center each week for 2-3 hours. My responsibilities included dishing up food, washing dishes, sweeping and mopping floors and ensuring that the energy of the Center remained safe and positive during meal-times.

The Samaritan Center is a 501c3, interfaith effort of community members committed to serving the hungry and those in need in order to promote their welfare dignity and self sufficiency.  It is rooted in the belief that sound nutrition is the first step in enabling people to cope and become productive, self-sufficient members of society. Since 1981 Samaritan Center has worked to fight hunger in the greater Syracuse community by providing nutritious hot meals to anyone in need 7 days a week – no questions asked.

Delivered 41% increase in brand awareness, 90% surge in career site traffic, and 25% improvement in pipeline diversity.At Airwallex, improved Glassdoor rating from 3.6 to 3.8 in five months and drove 125% QoQ increase in positive reviews. Employer of the Year (2025 Asia Fintech Awards) and 3× Best Places to Work winner (2026).Previously at Grammarly and Getaround, scaled reach through data-driven strategies—increasing LinkedIn impressions 500%+ and job applications 20%.Created MarCom Platinum Award-winning content (top 15% of 6,000+ entries). Global speaker at Grace Hopper Celebration, Lesbians Who Tech, and PBWC. Author of The Spineless Porcupine on inclusion and belonging.My approach: Combine creative storytelling with rigorous metrics. Super honored to be featured in Lesbians Who Tech & Allies :: Queer. Inclusive. Badass. Follow Them Friday! 
🙏🏳️‍🌈🏳️‍⚧️🙏

#queer #trans #lgbtq #lgbtqia #lgbt #lgbtqiaplus #lgbtqcommunity

On this Trans Day of Visibility and final day of Women’s History Month, I wanted to share the unique perspective I have as a trans man who’s experienced lack of privilege of being identified as a woman and now “gaining” privilege by being acknowledged as a man by society. 

Since that change, I have less pressure from society to stay quiet and small. I’m listened to more and have less body image issues and fear of weight gain.

Women, I want you to know this isn’t your imagination that you feel this pressure to be small and quiet. I validate that feeling.

Men, I’d like to encourage us to please use our place of privilege to uplift, support, and listen to women. Defer to the women in the room and ask them for their opinion. They’re working against an invisible pressure to stay quiet and small. Make room for them to take up space and be heard. Let them know they’re beautiful just as they are.

Feel free to share this public service announcement, thanks. 🦔🏳️‍⚧️
___

publications.title: The Spineless Porcupine
publications.summary:
The Spineless Porcupine is an all-ages fable exploring diversity, inclusion, and belonging based on my journey of self-acceptance. It's about a porcupine born without any spines in a clan full of insular, warrior porcupines set on sticking to their own kind.

Instead of just sticking with those who look and think like us, we need to embrace being “spineless,” and befriend communities that we might view as our enemies. A core message is about how we can move from fear of rejection and “the other” into inclusion and belonging, which isn’t efficient, predictable, and something we can control. It’s especially poignant now given the anti-Asian hate crimes.

For more on the book including a one minute trailer summarizing the story and endorsements from William Paul Young, Ken Fong, and Vivian Wong, please check out: https://www.sayyang.com/

publications.title: Coming Home to Myself: #BlackLivesMatter Taught me Queer Lives Matter
publications.summary: In honor of #pridemonth and #blacklivesmatter, here’s my coming-out story and how my Black workmates embraced me when most of my previous Christian community didn’t. Check out my book, The Spineless Porcupine here: https://www.sayyang.com/

recommendationsReceived.name: Lauryn N. Nwankpa
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: CEO | Board Member | Startup Advisor | Somebody's Auntie
recommendationsReceived.context: Lauryn N. was Aiden's client
recommendationsReceived.description: I had the pleasure of meeting Aiden when he agreed to join a "Beyond Pride Month" LGBTQ+ celebration we hosted at Dave in early July 2020. At Dave, we strive to hold space and be super intentional about having REAL tough conversations about race, gender, identity, systems of inequity - and we are striving to do so in a way that cherishes the lived experiences and perspectives of our team.  We want our team to feel that they can authentically show up each day, that they are valued, and they are heard and so we’re doing a lot of incredible work to assess what we’ve done thus far and continue to build culture in that way moving forward. We decided to host a panel with three industry experts doing incredible work in the DEI space, but who were also just incredibly amazing, smart, funny and insightful humans. We centered the conversation around allyship, being an accomplice, intersectionality and the realities faced by members of the LGTBQ community in tech. A colleague of mine on the panel planning committee introduced me to Aiden to participate and I was BLOWN AWAY. He brought such a wealth of knowledge, expertise, and personal experience to the conversation and truly helped to foster a beautifully authentic yet educational moment for our team. I was personally (as were many others) moved by Aiden’s sharing of how an inclusive culture of belonging at a former company allowed them to show up safely, authentically and fully in their identity and offered practical insights on how we could build a similar culture of compassion, acceptance, inclusion and belonging at Dave. Aiden shared so many important nuggets of wisdom, defined key terms to help build a shared understanding, and challenged the attendees to think of change on both the individual AND systemic level. I so appreciated meeting Aiden, and was so incredibly grateful for his ability to show up so authentically, while also encouraging our team to interrogate how we all can too! Even though the panel was virtual, Aiden’s presence, humor and thoughtfulness shined through immensely! I can't wait to invite him back again!

recommendationsReceived.name: Aprelle Deuell
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Professional Services Leader, Business Operations, Mergers & Acquisitions
recommendationsReceived.context: Aprelle was Aiden's client
recommendationsReceived.description:
Aiden and I met at a very unlikely place – Oracle! I have worked for Oracle for the last 21 years, and Aiden works for Workday… proof we can all get along! Here’s how we met:

I participate in various events sponsored by Oracle Women’s Leadership (OWL.) OWL announced a “Creativity Workshop” back in August, which immediately caught my attention, and I signed up. Aiden was the facilitator of this fantastic session, and I couldn’t have been more hooked. Beyond me, he captured the hearts and minds of the entire group of attendees, I have never seen so much enthusiasm at an OWL event. He shared real life steps we all can take to explore our creative selves, his fascinating life journey, and how we can enrich our lives (and the world!) trying new things. 

Throughout Aiden’s workshop, I kept thinking how meaningful these concepts would be for my 18-year old daughter and her group of friends. They had all just graduated high school, and were spending their last summer together before heading off to their various college journeys. I wanted to do something special for them before they all went separate ways, and felt an inspirational talk from the amazing Aiden - who I knew the kids would magnetically relate to – would be just the thing. 

I talked to Aiden after the workshop, and booked him to facilitate a similar Creativity Workshop, but with a specific spin for the group… emphasizing “embracing failure.” This is a group of over-achievers that can look at mistakes as pure, negative failure. I wanted them to really hear the message that the college experience should include learning how to get up after falling down: to take risks, try new things, dare to be bold.

The workshop and evening was a true hit. The kids had a blast. Aiden included a few improv games they loved, and talked about his “failures,” which really brought the message home on how mistakes are critical to creativity and ultimately, success. His easy, comfortable communication style works magic with a room, there was not a minute he lost the attention of anyone. He is truly a talented, gifted speaker.

I would enthusiastically recommend Aiden for speaking engagements, workshops… in particular, if you want to reach young people with inspirational, life-changing advice, book a Aiden workshop! If you have a group of not-so-young career people, and want to motivate them to break free from behavior limiting creative processes… book a Aiden workshop!

Aiden, thank you again.

headline: People Operations Leader | Turning human data into operating signals for remote and AI-enabled organizations
about:
I help leadership teams turn human data into clarity, confidence, and better decisions as organizations scale.

I partner with AI and technology companies during periods of growth, transition, or complexity, designing People Operations systems that surface risk earlier, reduce reactivity, and support better executive decision making. I work fully remotely in leadership and advisory capacities.

My background includes leading both Talent Acquisition and traditional HR functions, which shapes how I approach People Operations today. Rather than treating hiring as a standalone activity, I design integrated systems where Talent Acquisition, performance, engagement, retention, and compliance operate as a single, connected lifecycle.

This integration matters. Hiring decisions create downstream signals about role design, leadership capability, skills alignment, and long-term retention. When Talent Acquisition is embedded within People Operations, those signals compound. When it is separated, insight is lost.

I work closely with founders, executives, and operators, often in investor-backed or transitional environments, to build People Operations capabilities that are practical, evidence driven, and durable. This includes role clarity and workforce planning, systems design, employee relations and compliance strategy, and leadership decision support.

A core part of my work involves applying human data and responsible AI to real organizational problems. The goal is not automation for its own sake, but clearer signals leaders can trust when making people decisions under pressure.

People Operations is how organizations learn to see earlier and act better.
