headline: Founder at PR73 | Helping Founders, Marketing, PR & Sales Teams Earn Media Coverage That Reaches the Right People and Sparks the Right Action
addressWithCountry: New York City Metropolitan Area, United States
about:
If you’re thinking about using public relations and marketing to unlock new growth opportunities, we should talk.

I’m an award-winning public relations and marketing practitioner and Founder and Lead Strategist of PR73 - formerly Press Record Communications - an integrated communications agency that helps brands to build trust and create opportunities for growth. 

A former member of the New York media scene, I support clients on their journey to develop insight, strategy, and content that fortifies trust across internal and external audiences and paves the way to their greatest potential.

My company, PR73's groundbreaking research on the public relations and marketing industry's challenges and solutions is visible in leading media like AdAge - https://adage.com/article/agency-news/study-house-comms-teams-suffer-trust-gap/2566011 

I drive public relations and marketing campaigns for organizations that include American Bar Association, New York Public Library, AARP, Uber, Clinton Global Initiative, General Motors, U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission, the City of Scranton, Best Buy, Autotrader, and the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs.

I am on the Exceptional Under 35 by the Public Relations Society of America list and my insights are in major media, including Forbes, PRWeek, and AdAge.

Please visit: www.pr73.com or email me at justin@pr73.com to learn more.

experiences.title: Founder & President
experiences.jobDescription:
PR73 was born after years in New York media and at premier public relations and marketing agencies. Those days gave us insight into how to capture an audience’s attention. 

We leverage our expertise across public relations and marketing to humanize brands, help them demonstrate authenticity, and provide value that can be felt and seen. 

Our history in newsrooms and as producers supports our ability to develop compelling content that inspires confidence across internal and external audiences. Creating confidence in the brands that we serve is non-negotiable.

The world is fast, and the culture of communications can make it feel even faster. We’re here to build a connection with our clients and establish trust and camaraderie on a person-to-person level in order to best understand the ideal strategy for them and their teams. 

We put measurement and analysis at the forefront of what we do and combine it with our love of people—what happens as a result is the alchemy that sets PR73 apart.

Here’s a little insight into the different brands that we serve, and a few of our varied approaches to optimizing and elevating the great work that they do:

For individuals:
We become their core team members and work to make their lives easier by streamlining workflows and serving as a support system for both the difficult days and those that are full of celebration.

For smaller organizations:
We work on a person-to-person level to learn the team inside and out, and collaborate to create a communications program that builds towards their stakeholders’ vision of the future.

For large organizations:
It’s essential to gain the kind of trust from audiences that’s more traditionally found in local businesses, or now in individual, influencer-backed businesses that can readily put a face to a name. 

For communications teams:
We prioritize solving in-house and agency team pain points so that their clients, colleagues, leaders, and stakeholders instill greater trust in them.

1300+ People. 3 Continents. 35 Offices. We are a global integrated marketing agency transforming and inspiring the world of communications every day.

A LETTER FROM PETER FINN:

DECEMBER 2011. FINN PARTNERS WAS BORN. After 11 years serving as co-CEO of a historic agency that carried my father’s name— and mine!—and after 30+ years of working at the firm, I wanted to build something different, bold, meaningful and amazing for clients, our colleagues and the community. "Amazing"​ was, and is, for me an important word. I imagined we could be "amazing"​ every day, knowing this is a goal not always achieved but always pursued. A place where talented people could gather and do big things for clients as well as make a difference to the communities important to us.

WE LAUNCHED WITH A GROUP WHO SHARED A VISION. This was to be a "new"​ agency model, driven by a collaborative spirit. We asked, "Can we bind our 60-year legacy to the energy and speed of today’s hi-tech world?"​ We had $24 million in fees at our founding. Today, we have more than $85 million in fees, over 700 colleagues and 18 offices across three continents. Our Founding Managing Partners, highly respected colleagues who took the leap with me from our former agency, have been joined by the principals of other great agencies that became Finn Partner companies. So many other talented individuals are with us, too, intrigued by the idea of doing amazing things in an amazing workplace community.

WE’VE MADE OUR MARK QUICKLY. Finn Partners has been named “Best New Agency,” “Best PR Agency to Work for in North America” and“Best Mid-Sized Agency of the Year” three times. Now, we’re one of the world’s largest agencies.

WE ARE A YOUNG AGENCY. We share the genes of a respected agency that pioneered today’s integrated communications. But we are not them. We are unique. We are ourselves. We are focused on the future, building that future during each amazing day.

updates.postText:
**You’re not annoying reporters by pitching. You’re annoying them by hiding the one thing they actually need.**

Reporters are moving stupid fast right now so when your pitch opens with a company bio, a boilerplate, or some fluffy ‘we’re redefining the future of blah blah blah’ nonsense?'

That's what annoys reporters because they  don’t care about your company first. 

They care about the actual human they’re gonna interview and whether that person makes their job easier, faster, and less chaotic.

Your source is the value and the company is just background noise.

If you want a reporter to actually read your pitch (or even blink in your direction), here’s how to tee up your expert so clearly they instantly get it:

1️⃣ Start with the human. Always.
“Hey, I’ve got X, they know Y,  here’s why they’re perfect for Z.” That’s it. Lead with the person.

2️⃣ Give one line that makes them legit.
Not a novel, just one line.

 “Former ___.”
 “Ran ___ for 10 years.”
 “Built ___ from scratch.”

 Boom. Done.

3️⃣ Tell them why this expert matters right now.
Not in general or in theory but in the actual moment we’re living in. Tie it to the trend, the news cycle, the mess happening today.

4️⃣ Drop something quotable.
A spicy stat, a punchy POV, or a line that actually sounds like a human. (This is reporter catnip.)

5️⃣ Make availability idiot-proof.
“Can talk today or tomorrow. Quick call or email Q&A.”

Reporters love clarity and hate guessing games. Do this and suddenly you’re not the annoying PR person. You’re the one who makes their job faster and easier. And reporters live for that.

TL;DR:

Pitch less company.

Pitch more human.

Everything gets better.

People aren’t just buying products anymore. They’re buying what those products represent.

Loved chatting with FOX 5 DC about the launch of Trump Mobile and what it says about the future of consumer behavior.

Spoiler alert!

It's not about phones. It's about belief-based buying, when loyalty, identity, and values drive the purchase, not price.

This is a major shift for brands and consumers alike.

If the press isn’t talking about you, AI isn’t either.

We’re entering a new phase of visibility where showing up in search no longer means just Google, but also the AI assistants your audience is increasingly relying on. 

Think ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Grok.

And unlike paid ads or social posts, earned media is one of the strongest signals AI uses to decide who’s credible, relevant, and worth surfacing.

Why? 

Because media placements are indexed by search engines, cited by language models, and often used as foundational training data. 

They’re digital receipts of trust. 

And they compound over time.

If your name isn't in articles, quotes, interviews, or analysis from authoritative outlets, AI-powered tools won’t see you as a source of expertise. 

That means fewer mentions, fewer citations, and fewer opportunities to generate new leads, especially as search behavior changes fast.

Earned media isn't just good PR anymore. It's strategic infrastructure.

It’s how you feed the machines and influence the humans.

If you’re not building that foundation now, you’re setting yourself up to disappear from the future of discovery.

Are your media efforts future-proof?
Public Relations firm that helps entrepreneurs, small businesses, and Fortune 500s.

jobTitle: Founder and CEO at Aegis Vitals Inc
about:
Introducing AegisVitals.ai. Protecting Life Through Intelligent, Continuous Care. We’re building the future of healthcare — one heartbeat at a time. 

💡At AegisVitals.ai, our mission is simple but powerful:→ To make healthcare proactive, intelligent, and affordable for everyone. From continuous monitoring to predictive intervention, we’re redefining how the world understands and manages chronic disease.

🌍 Our Vision: To become the global intelligence layer for chronic-care management, bridging real-world data, clinical decision support, and scientific discovery to improve outcomes and extend healthy life expectancy.

💠 What We Do: We connect wearable sensors, home devices, and clinical dashboards into one intelligent ecosystem — empowering patients, providers, and researchers through real-time data and actionable insights:

1️⃣ AI-Driven Monitoring → Predict risks before they escalate

2️⃣ Connected Ecosystem → Integrate telehealth, EHRs, and wearables for 360° visibility.

3️⃣ Patient Empowerment → Keep patients engaged, informed, and in control.

4️⃣ Research & Discovery → Use anonymized data to accelerate medical breakthroughs.💬 Why It MattersChronic diseases account for nearly 75% of global healthcare costs, yet most care today remains reactive.AegisVitals.ai is leading the shift toward proactive, continuous, and intelligent care — ensuring every life we touch is protected through innovation and insight.

🔗 Join Us on This JourneyWe’re partnering across healthcare, research, and technology to make this vision a reality.

Visit 🌐 www.AegisVitals.ai to learn more.

#AegisVitals #HealthcareInnovation #AIinHealthcare #RemotePatientMonitoring #DigitalHealth #ChronicCare #HealthTech #PreventiveCare #MachineLearning #HealthcareTransformation

updates.postText:
🛡️⚕️ Most health apps track what you did.

Aegis Vitals helps you become who you’re trying to be.

We’re building an Intelligent Mesh of AI agents inside the Aegis Vitals patient app — a coordinated team that turns health data into daily progress.
How it works

→ Goal Agent: turns “lower BP / stabilize glucose / lose weight / sleep better” into a realistic weekly plan

→ Adherence Agent: keeps you consistent when life gets busy

→ Insight Agent: explains trends clearly (without alarm fatigue)

→ Motivation Agent: keeps momentum going

→ Clinician Alignment Agent: aligns “what your clinician wants” with “what you want” — like two paths converging (a major trust builder)

And yes — we’re gamifying the loop

→ micro-wins, streaks, adaptive challenges, and progress you can feel daily
This is how healthcare moves from reactive to proactive:
detect earlier → coach smarter → intervene sooner.

If you believe the next breakout health platform will win on trust + engagement + measurable outcomes, let’s talk.

🛡️⚕️ #AegisVitals
#HealthTech #AIAgents #DigitalHealth #RemotePatientMonitoring #BehaviorChange #PatientEngagement #VentureCapital

Most people don’t realize this:

The majority of deterioration in chronic diseases is not caused by the disease itself…

 …it’s caused by poor monitoring, irregular follow-up, and silent deterioration that goes unnoticed until it’s too late.

And the data is overwhelming:

1️⃣ Large cohort and landmark trials show that intensive, closely monitored diabetes care reduces complications by 33%–75% compared to typical, loosely monitored care.

2️⃣ In real-world populations (especially in LMICs), 60–80% of diabetics remain poorly controlled.

3️⃣ And here’s the part most people never hear about:

Irregular follow-up multiplies the odds of poor control by more than 7×.

That means deterioration is not inevitable — it’s predictable, preventable, and directly tied to how well a patient is monitored between clinic visits.

💡 This is the gap Aegis Vitals was built to close.

We’re building a platform that doesn’t just track data — it changes the trajectory of chronic disease.

→ Device-agnostic monitoring
→ Personalized baselines + early-warning AI
→ Continuous risk scoring
→ Clinician-in-the-loop workflows
→ Intelligent alerts before deterioration happens
→ Population-level analytics for proactive care
→ Patient engagement that actually works

Our mission is simple:
Turn poorly monitored, high-risk patients into tightly monitored, stable, time-in-range patients — at scale.

This is one of the most preventable drivers of suffering, hospitalization, and long-term complications. And yet, globally, it remains one of the least addressed.

People will subscribe to Aegis Vitals because:

→ They want to avoid the blindness, kidney failure, amputations, hospitalizations, and heart complications that come from poor control.

→ They want visibility between visits — the very thing the system does not provide today.

→ They want to feel safe, supported, and in control of their health.

→ And families want the peace of mind of knowing deterioration won’t happen silently.

The chronic-disease crisis is massive, growing, and fundamentally unsolved.

Every country. Every demographic. Every health system.

But the biggest unaddressed problem isn’t treatment — it’s monitoring.

Whoever solves real-time monitoring + early detection at scale becomes a category-defining company.

That’s what Aegis Vitals is building.

We’re not reacting to disease.

We’re redesigning how it’s managed.

→ From reactive to proactive

→ From late detection to early warning

→ From silent deterioration to continuous visibility

The world is finally ready for that shift.

And we’re building the infrastructure to deliver it globally.

📣 Investors – If you want to be part of this transformation

→ We’re opening our pre-seed SAFE round.

→ We’re speaking with MD investors, healthtech angels, and mission-aligned early believers.

→ If you want to back a platform solving one of the biggest preventable drivers of chronic disease deterioration, let’s talk.

DM me or comment “Aegis” and I’ll reach out.

🌡️ Preventing the Preventable: Why Early Detection Matters More Than Ever

Most people don’t realize this — but the majority of chronic-care complications don’t happen “out of nowhere.”

The body drifts. Patterns shift. Warning signs appear days or even weeks before a crisis.

The problem?

No one is watching.

That’s exactly what we’re solving with Aegis Vitals.

This slide highlights just a few outcomes we can detect before they become life-changing emergencies:

→ Kidney failure from uncontrolled hypertension or diabetes

→ Heart failure exacerbations

→ Hypertensive crisis that could lead to stroke

→ Medication side-effect deterioration

→ Diabetic ketoacidosis

These are not small problems. These are the complications that break families, drive admissions, overwhelm emergency systems, and lead to avoidable loss.

With continuous monitoring + predictive analytics + intelligent alerting, Aegis Vitals identifies physiological drift long before symptoms appear — giving clinicians and families a chance to intervene early, not react late.

This is the future of healthcare: proactive, precise, and deeply human.

We’re building a world where no one deteriorates in silence.

If you’re an investor, clinician, or strategic partner passionate about advancing predictive care globally, let’s connect. The opportunity to transform outcomes — especially in underserved markets — is enormous.

#AegisVitals #PredictiveHealth #RPM #DigitalHealth #AIinHealthcare #ChronicCare #HealthTechInnovation #GlobalHealth #Founders #Startups

🧠 Why LLMs Struggle With Breakthrough Ideas — and How We Might Fix It

Large Language Models are trained to do one thing exceptionally well:

→ predict the most statistically likely next token based on patterns they’ve seen.

That makes them brilliant at:

→ recombining known ideas

→ summarizing consensus viewpoints

→ mimicking human writing styles

But it also builds in a blind spot:

When the map runs out — when there are sparse or zero prior examples:

→ they default to “safe,” high-probability outputs.

→ They interpolate, not extrapolate.

→ They summarize, not explore.

→ They echo consensus, not outliers.

And yet it’s the rare, unconventional ideas — the “outliers” — that often spark breakthroughs.

So what could change this?

A few possibilities worth exploring:

1️⃣ Objective-driven search loops

Give LLMs goals and feedback so they can search, test, and adapt like scientists — not just predict the next word.

2️⃣ Hybrid architectures

Combine LLMs with symbolic reasoning engines, planning modules, or reinforcement learning agents that can explore unknown solution spaces.

3️⃣ Adversarial ideation networks

Use ensembles of models that intentionally generate “weird” hypotheses and challenge each other, surfacing low-probability but high-potential ideas.

4️⃣ Memory and evolution

Allow models to build long-term, evolving knowledge bases that retain and refine past experiments — like a human’s lifetime of trial-and-error.

If we can push beyond mere pattern prediction and build systems that search, experiment, and self-refine, we might unlock not just useful assistants — but genuine innovators.

What other approaches could help AI move from consensus to creativity?

I’d love to hear your thoughts.

#AI #Innovation #LLMs #ArtificialIntelligence #FutureOfWork
Visit www.fillytutor.com today to sign up!

recommendationsReceived.description: I have known Bernard Baah over the past two years. Bernard worked as a TA for my business statistics class. Over these two years, I have come know Bernard as a smart, hardworking, and humble young man who is ever willing to help students overcome the difficulties that they encounter in the course of their studies. Students described him as very knowledgeable and excellent at explaining difficult concepts in a way that was accessible even to people with no background knowledge of the subject. Bernard has always been willing to do more than is required of him, and on several occasions offered to teach recitations, proctor individual exams, or hold extra office hours for the benefit of students. Bernard is a very likeable person who takes his work seriously and strives to be the best he can be. I would therefore highly recommend him for any position in his field of interest.

headline: Strategic Marketing & Communications Director | Brand, Digital Engagement & Cross‑Functional Leadership | S&P 500 Experience
jobTitle: Director of Marketing, Communications & Public Affairs– Crux Subsurface (Quanta Services, NYSE: PWR)
about:
I’m a strategic marketing and communications leader with a career built around shaping narratives, strengthening stakeholder trust, and advancing organizational priorities through clear, audience‑focused communication. My work spans integrated marketing, digital ecosystem management, public‑facing communications, and high‑stakes engagement with government, regulatory, and community partners.

Across roles in marketing, business development, and strategic leadership, I’ve led initiatives that translate complex, technical information into compelling stories for diverse audiences. I’ve directed national campaigns, supported executive communications, and partnered with senior leaders to align brand, messaging, and mission across channels.

My background includes managing multimillion‑dollar programs for Fortune 500 organizations, advising executives, and leading cross‑functional teams through issues management, public engagement, and high‑visibility initiatives. I’ve worked extensively with federal agencies, state and local governments, and regulated industries — experience that has strengthened my commitment to transparency, accountability, and mission‑driven communication.

Most recently, as Director of Marketing, Communications & Public Affairs at Crux Subsurface (Quanta Services, NYSE: PWR), I partnered with executive leadership to develop integrated messaging, strengthen client and community engagement, and support communications for one of the company’s largest infrastructure programs. My focus has consistently been on building credibility, shaping public understanding, and ensuring complex information is communicated clearly and responsibly.

I bring a strategic, collaborative, and mission‑aligned approach to marketing and communications — grounded in the belief that effective storytelling strengthens trust, informs communities, and drives meaningful impact.

recommendationsReceived.name: Kristin Junia
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: University Relations | Campus Recruiting Manager | Relationship Builder | Program Development | Connecting emerging talent with meaningful career opportunities
recommendationsReceived.description:
Steven competently filled the role of Sales Associate during a year of intensive training in our Sales Development Program before being promoted to a Sales Executive role within the company.
Steven came into the instructional and hands-on program already having professional sales and marketing experiences. He was looking for a challenge and desired a successful technical sales career with a global market leader during his pursuit for new opportunities. Steven had proven his resourcefulness and problem-solving abilities during his job interviews and showed a willingness for learning the construction industry in more depth, partly due to his experience with his family’s small contracting business in Alaska.

Steven successfully met and exceeded the program requirements and gained knowledge of Siemens’ products, technology and culture. Steven is a true, stand-out talent and a testament that professionals with business backgrounds are fully capable of advancing their careers in a technical engineering and science workplace.
From my experience mentoring Steven through the Sales Development Program, I would highly recommend him to those who want to be surrounded by someone who challenges themselves to find the most effective and efficient solutions to complex challenges. His excellent presentation and communication skills, technical aptitude, ingenuity and humility will support a variety of results driven positions within Siemens and any other future opportunities he pursues.

recommendationsReceived.name: Michelle Treser
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Sr. Director of Sales & Client Services at Advantage Solutions
recommendationsReceived.context: Michelle worked with Steven on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description: Steven proficiently filled the role of Leadership Development Associate for our company’s Accelerated Career Experience training program before being promoted into his next role with the company. During this time, Steven and I worked together on a team project where we successfully met and exceeded the assignment we were tasked with, resulting in a go-to-market presentation at a national conference attended by the CEO and executive leadership team. From my experience working with Steven, I would highly recommend him to those who want to be surrounded by someone who is passionate about helping others strive to their highest potential. Steven would be a true asset for any positions requiring retail sales knowledge, project management, teamwork, retail intelligence and collaborative communication skills.

recommendationsReceived.name: Thomas Williamson
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Regional Merchandising Analytics Manager - East US at Circle K
recommendationsReceived.context: Thomas worked with Steven on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description:
Steven is a consistent, high-energy sales and marketing specialist who brings many skills to the table. He always has a creative, positive outlook no matter what task he is tackling. He's good at organizing and bringing people together towards a common goal and his presentation style is open, inviting to questions, engaging, and thorough. Steven competently filled the role of Retail Planning & Reporting Specialist for our company’s Novartis National client team for just over a year before being promoted onto his next role with the company. 
Steven and I were accountable for planning Novartis’ 6,500 U.S. grocery retail activation accounts for nearly 100 stock keeping units. Steven analyzed key performance indicators, sales trends, and business opportunities using Microsoft Excel. He helped develop reports, scorecards and extract data through Microsoft Access. He designed retail distribution Excel summary reports, monitored issues throughout monthly projects and provided feedback to Novartis’s retail management team each week. It has been a privilege and a pleasure to work with him and he has received my respect. Steven would make a quality addition to any team.

recommendationsReceived.name: Sarah Lutiger, SHRM-CP
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Director of Operations
recommendationsReceived.context: Sarah managed Steven directly
recommendationsReceived.description:
I have known Steven for three years, as a camp counselor for the YMCA of Twin Cities, Camp St. Croix when he was working his second season in 2011. 
While working at Camp St. Croix, an organization providing exceptional outdoor programs, I had the chance to see Steven display his leadership skills in a variety of ways. Two of these instances relate well to his Strengths Finder results, specifically Communication and Achiever. 
Every morning, counselors led groups of campers down to an orientation stage to sing songs and get started for the day where I would find Steven taking action by leading a good morning song, an animated skit, a camp spirited game or communicating any major week announcement. In his outgoing demeanor, Steven recognized that using his great inter-personal traits was a very successful way to encourage the new and more reserved counselors to follow his example and learn new skills; an example of his Communication result. 
He also demonstrated his Activator strength in acknowledging that putting himself out there can be one of the most significant ways to grow as a leader. With this in mind, Steven was open-minded and incredibly hard-working on the larger, more difficult camp groups and specialty camps. This dedication to pushing himself out of his comfort zone and trying his hardest also speaks to his Achiever strength. 
Steven is a strong leader, encouraging others and welcoming teamwork, while  staying committed to achieving the best camp experience for his campers, coworkers and community. I would highly recommend Steven to anyone who wants to be surrounded by an energetic hard worker who has the traits of a responsible leader that takes action through superior communication skills

recommendationsReceived.name: Will Defiel
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: President at Simple Sourcing LLC
recommendationsReceived.context: Will worked with Steven but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: Steven is one of the most professional, down to Earth Carlson (University of MN - Carlson School of Management) students that I have had the pleasure of knowing. He is smart, hard working, and a quick learner, but what really sets him apart from other Carlson students is his ability to connect with people.  I have yet to meet someone who does not speak highly of him. Those interpersonal communication skills, combined with his degree and hard work ethic, will make him a valued member of any company he works for.

recommendationsReceived.name: Ellie Thorstad
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: OD Enthusiast | MPA | People person
recommendationsReceived.description:
I have known Steven for just over a year, as a teammate in the LeaderShape Retreat in January of 2010, and as a leader of the Pay It Forward Tour that Steven was a participant on in March of 2010. On the Pay It Forward Tour, a service and leadership development trip, I had the chance to see Steven display his leadership skills in a variety of ways. Two of these instances relate well to his StrengthsFinder results, especially Activator and Achiever. 
When trying to decide whether or not to participate in this trip, offered by Students Today Leaders Forever, Steven recognized that taking action is an amazing way to learn new things, an example of his Activator result. He also demonstrated this strength in acknowledging that putting himself out there can be one of the most significant ways to grow as a leader. With this in mind, Steven was open-minded and incredibly hard-working on the service trip, and encouraged the more reserved students to follow his example. This dedication to pushing himself out of his comfort zone and trying his hardest also demonstrates the Achiever theme. 
Steven has been an irreplaceable asset to the teams I have worked with him on. He is a strong leader, encouraging others and welcoming teamwork, while also staying committed to achieving the best results possible.

headline: IDEA Generator/ Community Engagement /Business Development/ Strategic Partnerships/ Projects & Events Planning & Management/Fundraising/Volunteer Recruitment & Community Organizing. Waterless Beauty Pioneer.
about:
The ability to inspire people to embrace a common vision & accomplish lofty goals is one of Mindy's greatest strengths. While working with a small team to grow a boutique financial services firm, her intense passion to make a difference enabled Mindy to take on challenging volunteer leadership roles to recruit & lead teams which accomplished many firsts. Despite limited resources, these teams have achieved unprecedented goals to positively impact communities in metro Atlanta, Birmingham, AL and Jackson, MS. 

Mindy is seasoned in the ability to build, monitor & communicate project plans in partnership with a dynamic team of professionals.               
       
Partial list of accomplishments: 
2025: As Chair of DPG's 1st Annual Women's History Month Brunch exceeded attendance and fundraising goals in 46 days. Developed Program, recruited Moderator, 6 Panelists, Authors and Vendors at no cost to budget.
2022-Present: IMPACT100: www.impact100atlanta.org for impactful grant awards in metro ATL
2023 CHAIR: Environmental, Preservation & Recreation Grant Review Committee.
2022: Arts & Culture Grant Review Committee.  

2021: Nat'l Breast Cancer Foundation. Conceptualized, launched & sustained 6-wk digital marketing campaign to inspire and motivate others to vote for her & donate to NBCF. Efforts netted $40k+.  

2020: Greater Atlanta Community Event: Conceptualized, organized & implemented 1st major VIRTUAL Awards Event & Fundraiser to honor 5 "Sheroes." Directed all-volunteer team & commissioned political cartoonist Mike Luckovich for promotional purposes. Co-produced celebrity cameos. 

2019: Greater Atlanta Community Event: Served on diverse committee to organize and implement Atlanta's INAUGURAL annual "Day of Religious Pluralism". One of three co-curators for the ART exhibit & served as volunteer "Inclusivv, LLC" facilitator for the multi-activity event. 

2019- 2021: Organized & served as founding President of new chapter of the GA Federation of Democratic Women that grew 200+(largest chapter in GA during her term.) Raised $50k+ during record elections.

2015: Initiated 1st successful effort to bring full Alabama Symphony to the Greystone community to perform a FREE outdoor POPS Concert. Directed all-volunteer team that secured $50k+ sponsorships within 3 months. Assigned & directed multiple tasks to raise capital & execute event logistics.

updates.postText:
SO GRATEFUL to the FutureVerse Supporters who used the Peach Education Tax Credit to help transform Clayton Co. School classrooms into hi- tech learning labs.

For all those who pledged and funded $1k or more, your name will be enshrined on the Donor Wall when FutureVerse is a brick and mortar. What an exciting opportunity for those who pledged by Dec. 31, 2025.

With ongoing support from the Atlanta community with Sponsorships and tax-deductible gifts, together we will build America’s first future museum and Georgia’s Center for Innovation & Discovery in the heart of Atlanta! 
For those Futurists who have not yet learned about this major project, please contact me for more information. Visit us at www.thefutureverse.org

Dec. 31st FINAL DAY! Secure Your Permanent Legacy at FutureVerse and Transform Public Education in GA. 
Your name will be included on a permanent donor wall as an early supporter of FutureVerse if you 1) Pledge a minimum of $1k of your 2025 state income tax dollars via the Peach Education Tax Credit on the Georgia Foundation for Public Education site here: https://lnkd.in/eDtimCVw 
OR 2) Make a tax-deductible gift of $1k or more on our secure website: www.thefutureverse.org  Please contact me with questions, or for more details at mindy@mindyboggs.com

This level of permanent recognition is typically reserved for significantly larger gifts. Through Dec. 31, 2025, we are inviting early supporters who believe in our mission, to be enshrined at FutureVerse forever.
Join us as we build America's 1st Future Museum & Innovation Center in downtown Atlanta-Georgia's next great educational landmark. Ask me for details!

Please join me in support of the important work of the Georgia Center for Child Advocacy. They need the support from the business community and individuals more than ever before to continue services, as they are one of the hardest hit non- profits since Trump/DOGE cut their federal funding. 

Thank you for your leadership role Sarah Benton Walker, CRPC® and to CPC Advisors for your Sponsorship.

Please join me and my daughter, Sarah Walker, GCCA Board Member for their annual fundraiser Sept 20. This non-profit is among those hardest hit by DOGE cuts. One of the key services they provide is for highly trained professionals to tape interviews with children and youth who are victims of sexual and physical abuse.  This is admitted as evidence in court so the victims do not have to endure repeated trauma by repeating their accounts. This agency is facing severe cutbacks. Will you help with your attendance, or a donation of any amount?
Evia Golde Kate Badey Sophie Gibson Dr. April Spencer, M. D. Sonia Booker Ken Kirk Amanda Brown-Olmstead Laura Heery, AIA deborah cooper Ray Uttenhove Christian Mitchell Murphy, CFRE (she/her/hers)

volunteerAndAwards.description: In conjunction with the City of Atlanta and Host Committee of diverse faith & civic leaders, it was my distinct honor to co-curate the ART Exhibit for this historic event, including 8 paintings and 4 sculptures. The curatorial team included myself, Nobel Prize Museum Curator Ashley Woods & Emory University's Ethics in Arts Professor Carlton Mackey.  We scouted the greater ATL area for the most impactful pieces to fit our theme of Beauty in Harmony, relative to the artist's personal spiritual journey, and as a whole, representative of diverse religious influences. This first-ever historic Exhibit & Event took place in the atrium of City Hall on April 4, 2019, to include the Official Proclamation, performing artists of different religious backgrounds, and a facilitated dinner discussion to spark curiosity, understanding, respect and friendship among people of many different faiths and beliefs.

headline: Globally Recognized Leader in Strategic Volunteer Engagement
about: Passionate advocate for people giving their time and talent! I work with my clients to design and implement volunteer engagement with cultural and strategic impact across the organization, in alignment with the mission and values. I host and produce the premiere web series "Priceless Advice for Leaders of Volunteers", and am a frequent guest-expert for many other shows, podcasts, and conferences.

experiences.title: Featured Expert
experiences.jobDescription: Regular featured expert for The Nonprofit Enthusiast weekly live broadcast hosted by Lasheena Williams,MNM,CNP.

experiences.title: Organizational Consultant
experiences.jobDescription:
www.danalitwinconsulting.com

• Clients include: Safe & Sound, Bespoke Software, Bloomerang, Greater Los Angeles Zoo Association (GLAZA), Young Hearts Foundation (Los Angeles), United Jewish Council East Side (NYC), San Diego Humane Society, LandPaths (Santa Rosa), South Dakota National Guard Family Services, Pine Ridge Association (Henry Coe CA State Park), Telegraph Hill Neighborhood Center (SF), Un-Scripted Theater Company (SF), Leela Theater Company (SF), City of Morgan Hill.

• Featured keynote speaker: MAVA 2021 Virtual Volunteer Engagement Leadership Conference, SAVMA (2020), California Hospital Volunteers Association Conference (2019), Wisconsin Volunteer Coordinators Conference (2018), Points of Light National Conference on Volunteering and Service (2016), Morgan Hill Leadership Program (2015-2018), California Museum Associations Conference (2015), San Jose State University (2011-2018).

•  Webinars (original material): ASC Virtual Conference 2023, Points of Light 2020-21, 21-23NTC, MAVA Virtual Volunteer Engagement Leadership Conference 2021-22, Texas Volunteer Management Conference 2021, RISE Online Conference 2020, Pause for Change 2020, Nonprofit Learning Lab, Kansas Volunteer Commission(KVC), Volunteer Management Professionals of Canada, Association of Leaders in Volunteer Engagement(AL!VE), Council for Certification in Volunteer Administration, Volunteer Management Association of Western Michigan.

• Workshops (original material): Points of Light National Conference(2017, 2019,), SAVMA (2020), Ohio Parks & Recreation Association (2019), KVC Conference (2019), Nonprofit Learning Lab (2017-2019), California Hospital Volunteers Association Conference (2019), Wisconsin Volunteer Coordinators Conference (2018), NOVAA (2018), South Dakota National Guard Family Services (2018), San Diego Humane Society (2017, 2020).

•  Host annual 2-day live online Better Impact broadcast learning event for leaders of volunteers (2017-2019).

experiences.companyName: Association of Leaders In Volunteer Engagement
experiences.title: President Of The Board Of Directors
experiences.jobDescription:
AL!VE serves to enhance and sustain the spirit of volunteering by fostering collaboration and networking, promoting professional development, and providing advocacy for leaders in community engagement. AL!VE is the essential national professional resource and advocate for those who engage, motivate, and celebrate volunteers and their vital contributions to our society.

We are professionals in volunteer management and engagement, advocates for the recognition and appreciation of volunteer management, the resource for and the link to tools, research, and best practices educators of decision makers in all volunteer management arenas, We are influencers for redefining job descriptions, compensation, and the position of volunteer manager in our organizations. AL!VE is diverse, inclusive and member driven. 

Duties as AL!VE Board President: 

Strategize growth of brand awareness and membership for AL!VE, Board and committee development, cultivate sponsors and partnerships, recruitment, staffing, succession planning. Lead Special Projects, form task working groups as needed.

www.volunteeralive.org

experiences.companyName: Open Space Authority of Santa Clara Valley
experiences.title: Volunteer Programs Administrator
experiences.jobDescription:
Managed Volunteer and Community Outreach programs and Events for special district land conservation agency.

Produce large-scale public events including preserve/trail openings, anniversary galas (20th and 25th) and the annual Coyote Valley Family Harvest Feast (avg 1500-2500 attendees). The Family Harvest Feast features locally grown multi-cultural food, live music, with conservation/agricultural themed kids' activities and educational booths.

Redesigned volunteer/outreach program policies and procedures, resulting in avg. of 35% program growth per year. 

Train Board/staff/volunteers in public speaking and agency messaging.

Primary staff liaison to Citizens' Advisory Committee; develop work plans, special projects, facilitate workshops.

Speak on behalf of the Open Space Authority at conferences, universities and partner events.

Build relationships with corporate and NGO partners for event sponsorship, employee engagement, and high-skill Special Project volunteer opportunities.

Community engagement leadership and messaging training crucial to passage and implementation of funding measure ("Q"), bringing new revenue totaling $120mil over 30 years to Santa Clara Valley Greenprint projects. http://www.openspaceauthority.org/about/strategicplan.html

Wrote and produced 25th Anniversary promotional video, "The Open Space Authority at 25 and Beyond".

experiences.title: Manager of Volunteer Program
experiences.jobDescription:
Revitalized  Volunteer Program for multi-discipline service organization providing for 600 participants per day from culturally and economically diverse backgrounds. 

Tel-Hi programs include a full-day preschool, after-school tutoring and enrichment for K-8th grade children, Teen Leadership & Employment, free ESL, Computer, Fine Arts, and Fitness/Health classes for adults, a Senior Lunch Program, and free community events such as Thanksgiving Dinner and Chinese New Year Luncheon. 

Responsible for creation of protocols and procedures, program planning, and program evaluation including volunteer intake, screening and training procedures, recruitment of volunteers, interns, potential donors and board members. 

Collaborated with Executive Director and Director of Development on Board recruitment and succession planning. 

Planned and supervised events including "A Taste of Tel-Hi" Annual Gala, free community Thanksgiving Dinner (over 500 attendees). 

Implemented and marketed a diverse range of activities, recorded and analyzed program metrics for internal and external stakeholders, and offered new opportunities for corporate sponsors and individuals to support agency.

experiences.title: Volunteer/Docent Manager
experiences.jobDescription:
Supervised all aspects of in-kind donations for diverse population of 400 Docent Zoo Guides and volunteers essential to the execution of the zoo’s mission to connect people with wildlife, inspire caring, and advance conservation action. Consistently produced successful volunteer recognition events under budget. Updated material for and taught 15-week (90 hours) Docent Training Course.

Worked cooperatively with Board of Directors, donors, and Docent Council on events and community engagement strategies, program reports, proposals, and budgets. 

Partnered with Public Relations, Development, and Website staff to enhance the role of both print and electronic media in communicating effectively about the organization's programs and volunteer successes. Created content for Volunteer and Zoo Membership newsletters and
websites. Collaborated with Education Department peers to develop community programs and responses on current events and community issues including: lectures, readings, town hall meetings. 

Initiated strategic partnership with Salesforce.com resulting in free licensing of database, hundreds of additional volunteer hours and continual flow of grant money from Salesforce employees for "Greenie's Conservation Corner" and "Heritage Heart Restoration" projects. 

Introduced latest technology (at no cost to the zoo) to improve efficiency of recruiting, screening, scheduling and communicating with volunteers including implementation of Salesforce CRM database, Google online calendar, Docent website & blog, and digital volunteer and Docent newsletter.

Evaluated risks associated with Docent, Animal Care, and Special Event volunteer positions and took appropriate action to control risks.  Instructed safety and emergency response training for volunteers/docents; earthquake, tsunami, fire, and animal escape.

Worked as Production Assistant on short “Point of Boxes” 2005 (Sacramento Film Festival), and Consulting Producer on “Star Squire vs. The Destructo Ray” (2008) comedy/sci-fi short; perform great variety of tasks including financial strategizing, make-up and costumes, quick problem-solving, script supervision, camera, lighting and sound assistance, and coordinating crew, locations, and transportation.

Trained staff to work effectively and cooperatively with volunteers. Resolved issues between volunteers, clients, and staff. Maintained accuracy and confidentiality of volunteer database.

Interviewed subjects for POH 20th Anniversary Archive Oral History Project. Independently wrote, produced, and directed 3-minute agency promo for Project Open Hand at no cost to the agency, and at half the typical budget for a 16mm film of the same length via relationships with local independent film-makers and crew. 

Planned and hosted volunteer recognition events. Essential to Pride month community engagement activities including safety training, parade contingent, and booth.

Drove creation of ATS website and new media marketing.Initiated development of proprietary software resulting in 300 percent improvement of company efficiency.

Hired and supervised staff and consultants.

Physical environmental conservation work including but not limited to: removal of exotic plants, clearing waterways, wildfire fuel reduction, construction of trails, and establishing community recycling projects.

updates.postText: I enjoyed presenting a new webinar to the orgs of the SF Tech Council, and fabulous hosts Karla Suomala and Andrew Broderick. Check out this 3-minute clip for my core philosophy on volunteer engagement!

NEW #TuesdayTips! This week, a hot topic for USA nonprofit professionals; the new mandatory work requirement of 80 hours per month for SNAP (food stamps) recipients, and a similar law for Medicaid(basic health care) coming at the end of 2026 and into 2027. Links in the video description to USDA requirements and a legal article about the impact of mandatory volunteering on nonprofits. These 10-minute tips and ideas to actions are also useful outside the USA, whenever government policies are negatively impacting NGOs and the social safety net. 

Tell me in the comments how your org is preparing for the new SNAP and Medicaid "Voluntolds"  - have you already received inquiries about it? How are you adapting and communicating these new requirements and processes to staff and current volunteers?

NEW #TuesdayTips! This week, how to recruit volunteers with specific language skills while building community partnerships.

A few highlights:

Why are you seeking bilingual or multilingual talent? Have clear goals and define how success will be measured.

What level of language skill? Basic conversational, like for boothing and outreach, or fluency for translating policies and published content? 

Where can you find potential multilingual volunteers and recruitment partners?

Trust: cultivate intentional and long-term relationships with native-speaking community groups and partners to be mutually beneficial.

Tell me in the comments if you have used any of these techniques, or share other ways you have recruited bilingual or multilingual talent!
Dana's chapter on "Gamification in Volunteer Engagement" is a favorite topic in this collection of thought leadership, training and free tools for leaders of volunteers!

recommendationsReceived.description: Dana was a presenter at the 2021 virtual Texas Volunteer Management Conference. We sold out with 500+ tickets because of our dynamic list of speakers. Dana’s session, “Hold ‘Em or Fold ‘Em: How to Inspire, Move, or Fire Challenging Volunteers” was a highlight during our two days of learning. Her presence brought new faces to our audience and she was highly rated in our survey. Thank you Dana!

recommendationsReceived.name: Amira K.S. Barger, MBA,CVA,CFRE
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: 📚Author, The Price of Nice | Global Communications Executive | Professor | Board Director | All expressed views are my own
recommendationsReceived.context: Amira K.S. worked with Dana on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description: I met Dana in 2015 at a Points of Light conference for volunteer managers; as an AL!VE board member she was hosting a networking event for conference attendees. I had long heard of her and was glad to finally know her personally. We have stayed connected over the years, and I always think of Dana when it comes to strategic community engagement, masterful facilitation, exemplary civic engagement and conscientious leadership. Her energy and innovation are infectious! And because of her willingness to raise her hand and lead, many in communities across the world get to experience the joy of knowing Dana.

recommendationsReceived.name: Ruth Masterson, MPP
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: inspired results for funders & nonprofits
recommendationsReceived.context: Ruth was Dana's client
recommendationsReceived.description: We're lucky to have worked with Dana. Her knowledge of great practices in working with volunteers is comprehensive and her advice is practical and tailored.  Her recommendations were invaluable as I settled into my then-new role as ED of a Meals on Wheels program. She helped me ID what was working well, what wasn't, and what do do about it. And her recommendations have played out well. I'm so glad I reached out to her. Thank you, Dana!

recommendationsReceived.name: Jenn Forristal, CVA
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Volunteer Engagement Specialist
recommendationsReceived.context: Jenn worked with Dana but on different teams
recommendationsReceived.description: Dana is an exceptionally talented trainer. I help organize professional development workshops for the Northwest Oregon Volunteer Administrators Association (NOVAA). One of our members attended a workshop that Dana presented at the National Summit on Volunteer Engagement Leadership, and suggested we invite her to present at a NOVAA workshop. We’re so happy she did! Dana was a pleasure to work with. She was very responsive to all of our questions, and very organized in the planning process. She proposed several content options from which to choose to create a workshop that met our needs. The workshop was well attended, and very successful. Dana is a dynamic and engaging presenter. She is highly knowledgeable about the nonprofit world, and volunteer engagement in particular. We received outstanding feedback from attendees who appreciated Dana’s personality, as well as her expertise. Overall, our experience working with Dana was excellent, and we hope to invite her back for a future event.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jason Frenzel
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Director of Community Engagement at Huron River Watershed Council
recommendationsReceived.context: Jason worked with Dana on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description: Dana has been an exceptionally productive and positive influence on the AL!VE board of directors. She has spearheaded a number of forward thinking initiatives, is very conscientious of others' time, and follows through on her commitments. It has been a delight working with Dana.

recommendationsReceived.name: Darlene Amidon, M.A., AMFT
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Psychotherapist, AMFT #150285 LGTC Group, ED Program
recommendationsReceived.context: Darlene worked with Dana on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description: Dana is one of those rare-breed people who effortlessly balance left- and right-brain functions: exceptionally well organized and disciplined but also incredibly flexible and creative. She is a powerhouse "people person," establishing rapport with everyone she meets and cultivating positive relationships with colleagues, volunteers, vendors, and more. She is an expert speaker who engages and entertains her audience...and is particularly adept at training and leading, both one-on-one and groups of all sizes. Her training sessions always left me informed and inspired. Dana is also an impressive event manager. Seeing her manage all the little details of an event while deftly juggling the inevitable last-minute crises and never once losing the big-picture perspective...and then having it all go off without a hitch? That's not something you see everyday and is quite a testament to her experience and skill. I recommend Dana wholeheartedly and hope to work with her again in the future.

headline: Researcher, hacker, advisor, WWT field CTO, recovering CISO, AI & quantum architect, etc.
about:
Strategist, Researcher, Hacker, Speaker, CISO, Advisor, PITA, and now hunkered down as a Principal Architect and Field CTO at World Wide Technology.

Approach CAREFULLY with tea, biscuits, or Islay Whisky, do NOT connect to try and sell me something, I WILL flambé you.

Currently working as a strategist within the AI, Quantum, and Deepfake realms at World Wide Technology, and doing some advisory work for a couple of companies, having previously served as a CISO/vCISO/Advisor for a number of entities and organizations around the globe. Some of the more recent projects are focused within the Artificial Intelligence, Threat Intelligence, Identity, GRC, Cryptography, and Aviation/Transportation spaces.

I’ve been fortunate to be elbow deep in technology for more years than I care to remember, and these days am involved in both tactical and strategic discussions with clients across the spectrum of industries talking maturity, risk, and how to effect change.

Oh, and I've been called a Scottish Security Warlock....I’m kinda digging it.

Happy to connect, to talk and discuss what we can ALL do to effect change in this world, to collaborate and to communicate in a way that benefits all….I’d prefer folks didn’t use this forum to sell me certs, software or anything that has a hooded matrix theme (I DO come with a warning label...)

PS:  Please remember rule No. 1 “Do not act incautiously when confronting small bald wrinkly smiling men.

experiences.title: Field CTO
experiences.jobDescription:
What does this mean in the real world we’re facing?
- Primarily external facing with a depth and breadth of knowledge to walk into any situation and leave it in a better state than it was found.
- To watch, listen, engage, and help drive change in a manner that provides a competitive edge wherever necessary.
- Not only to throw the crystal ball out to see what the future holds, but have presence IN the industry to drive those changes.
- To listen. All the above can’t happen in a vacuum, be it internal teams, leadership conversations, folks across the industry, groups influencing change, and/or simply being engaged in various forums the art of listening is key.
- Engage with, and build out proof-of-concepts within areas of research and development to better benefit those around you.
- No one organization can solve everything, knowing, understanding, and accepting this means this role will spend time asking questions, challenging assumptions, and also working with key partners, suppliers, and other strategic resources on how TO better integrate anything focused on into the people/process/technology ecosphere successfully.
- There’s a LOT more, there always is, but those filling this role should be fluid enough to engage in situations across the globe, in any arena and quickly grasp what is happening, provide insights and situational awareness, and ensure anyone engaged not only knows the potential outcomes, but also the imminent pitfalls and how to avoid them.

Onyxia's real-time security assessment and benchmarking, full visibility into program performance, and streamlined board reporting give CISOs a simplified way to convey the value of the security programs and align their security initiatives with their organizational goals.

We also moonlight as the technology evaluation arm of the Illuminati

Some have also said we're working on a project to ascertain IF this is all an illusion, and if so, where's the bloody off switch.

It's a business, so let’s face it, revenue HAS to be in here somewhere, driving revenue, driving existing, and new streams of revenue, looking at market trends and advising on what/where to focus based on internal factors and the market pulse itself.

Customer focused, let's talk about building brand awareness, recognition, and how TO help. Working with marketing, brand, sales, and other folks to help refine/define, and provide some checks and balances.

Conferences, help spread the word through thought leadership, in conjunction WITH the company. Internal conversations on what the team is seeing (threat intelligence etc.), leveraging their experience and then ALL of us taking that to the world/marker and making it digestible and accessible. 

Internal checks/balances, what tech to look at, why to look at it, what's the focus, how well does it integrate, blend, what other points to work on, how to market it, sell it, use it, brand etc.

vCISO and advisor. Help/walk/talk/aid/guide/etc. From running training sessions on how TO present to the board, what TO talk with them about to NIST CSF in 30 mins sessions etc. Being able to bring that knowledge of what works/does not work when communication with the board. 

Bringing knowledge, tools, tech, and processes and policies along to help client with GRC focused efforts.

Future... where IS the future of an MSSP, what tactical and strategic moves, things, focuses etc are needed to ensure that Nuspire maintains an edge, what/where to focus.

Listening to, working with, and helping clients work through what they want, where they are, talking with them about roadmaps, presenting to leadership, helping them with frameworks, and generally being there to help.

Sounding board for the tech team. Be a closet geek.

experiences.title: CISO
experiences.jobDescription:
Senior Director and CISO for Boom Supersonic...
Digital and physical side of security for both the corporation and aviation aspects of Boom. In addition, I’m developing a series of Artificial Intelligence platforms combining Narrow, General, and Predictive reasoning to support numerous aspects of our aviation goals (and the transportation field as a whole) Started in Rust, and now moving it over to Python and others to expand/build in human and technical facets.  
I also get to make sure the right folks are in the right place at the right time (physical security) and that everyone remains as safe and secure as we can manage. 
For reference incase folks need a primer on some CISO things:
 • Develop Security team responsible for policies, procedures, compliance, and Operations
 • Champion and Lead on our Cybersecurity Program, including reporting to the Advisory Board
 • Responsible for developing and executing IT Security Program strategic vision and roadmap
 • Ensure compliance and adherence to NIST 800-171, CSF, CMMC, SOX and other best practices
 • Build excellent relationships through strong interpersonal skills and education
 • Prioritize and implement security initiatives to protect the organization
 • Responsible for IT Security Projects while meeting project timelines and staying on budget
 • Provide security oversight of 3rd parties, supply chain, and contractors
 • Oversee and maintain incident response plan, security training and awareness strategy
 • Collaborate with Internal Audit, Compliance General Counsel
 • Work with business leaders and staff on data classification, security requirements, etc.
 • Develop and maintain a risk matrix of potential threats to our existing platform and data.
 • Maintain expertise on security trends through training, research and development
 • Provide Security updates to Executive Team on an as needed basis.

experiences.title: Strategic Advisor
experiences.jobDescription:
Here at Ethopass, we believe that everything can and will be breached, it is not if, but when. To that end, we believe in building systems where the rewards associated with a successful attack are not worth the effort involved. We believe in building systems that are distributed in nature, where the individual's privacy is protected. As a user, your privacy is a core aspect to your security. Further, we believe that the use of analytics, and monitoring tools can be exploited to reduce the security of individual systems. The most secure option is to leave them out. Finally, we believe that each Cryptex needs to be owned by the individual user and not the organization. Welcome to the future of authentication.
- vCISO and advisory work relating to compliance (NIST and others)
- General consulting and discusions on cryptography, assessments, etc.

updates.postText:
Quantum Untangled Part1:

I know I promised things a while back, but finally getting to drop some initial explanations here/now.

This is an opening format where I’m taking some of the more “WTF” terms/mis-uses of logic and trying to make some sense out of it for folks.

Hope it help, feedback is always appreciated 
(although will be met with a cattle prod if you’re an ass about it)

AS the last page says, “more coming” will flesh out some of the other terms mentioned, will add more, and will likely make it a little more usable etc.

‘all for now

Chris
#quantum #encryption #entanglement #ai #future #technology #PQE #QKD #WWTLife

Quantum Untangled:

Let me start with the whole disclaimer: “This stuff’s still theoretical” 
BUT, let me add “However, we’re working on changing that…”

Entanglement isn’t just something spooky, odd, strange, and a mystery anymore. It’s getting the full working over by a whole heap of amazing folks whom have more letters after their name than I have IN mine… Some of whom I have the privilege of hanging out with during my nights and research time.

Here’s where we look at entanglement as a resource, and something that isn’t finite, or fragile (that whole look at it and it falls apart etc.)

There’s a new set of ways to look at this whole field (I say new, but it’s been a while in the making) 

We all know that entanglement and the whole quantum realm is a little finicky and has stability issues, especially when it comes to maintaining state for a while… SO like any good engineers we chuck a battery at it to make it a little more stable, reliable, and (hopefully) enable us to explore a little more without the whole thing collapsing around us.

With me so far?

HOWEVER one does not “rock up hillbilly style” with a heavy duty Interstate battery and hook it to the mess of gold and niobium pipework. One utilizes an entanglement battery.

What is it? It’s an auxiliary system that stores and supplies entanglement without net loss, allowing any transformation between mixed quantum states to be made reversible. (The efficiency of converting one entangled state into another is determined by the ratio of their entanglement, long story short to do it properly that number needs to be a whole one, read up on 2nd law of entanglement, and/or check into the 2nd law of thermodynamics for some good baselines.)

That KEY word is reversible…

With me still? (Think of it as a power conditioner and UPS for your audio gear)

So, for ALL of you looking at PQE (Post Quantum Encryption) and QKD (Quantum Key Distribution) for that whole “it’s immutable and nobody can tamper with it because “Quantum” THINK again…

(Because this whole quantum entanglement battery thing isn’t going away anytime soon)

REALLY think again, because theoretically I can sit there and read your stuff just as if I was sitting next to you on the train or plane.

‘all for now

Chris
#quantum #encryption #entanglement #ai #future #technology #PQE #QKD #WWTLife

recommendationsReceived.name: Ken  U.
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Cyber Security | Bestselling Author | Cloud Security | Risk Management | Newsletter Writer
recommendationsReceived.context: Ken  worked with Chris but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: Chris is a remarkable security leader and visionary.  He has excellent integrity and always has a kind word at hand if you meet him in person at a conference.  Chris has directly and indirectly mentored thousands of people around the world in cybersecurity and IT careers and has left a positive impact on the industry as a whole.  Chris is one of the most intelligent people I have ever met and I would not hesitate to endorse Chris for any executive leadership role.

recommendationsReceived.name: Aaron Birnbaum
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Security Savvy Speaker & Practitioner | vCISO | TRaViS ASM | Seron Security | CISSP | MBA | Thoughts, opinions, rants, etc. are my own and not affiliated with any employer/partner/contractor/babysitter/relative.
recommendationsReceived.context: Aaron worked with Chris on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description:
As if anyone wasn’t sure who this guy was, or if he needed another recommendation…if you’ve been to a security conference in the last 20 years, spent any time on LinkedIn (and Peerlyst RIP), or know anyone in security, they’ve no doubt mentioned him, referred to him, or had a drink (or 9 with him).

Chris is Gandalf (from The Lord of The Rings Book.  If you don’t know who Chris is I’m assuming you don’t know who Gandalf is)to the security industry. He’s seasoned, mature, cranky, knowledgeable, ungodly skilled and powerful. On an ongoing mission to save us from ourselves-in spite of ourselves. 

But Chris is more than a colorful, long bearded, speaker of truths, no punches pulled, get to the root of the problem and fix it, kilted Scotsman. He is a genuinely nice human being. 

He volunteers more than most people work, sharing knowledge and expertise that is dead on, but also entertaining and engaging.

If you want assistance from one of the ‘kings’ of cybersecurity, he must be in your list-preferably near the top.

recommendationsReceived.name: Jordan Hawkins
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: Make the best choice for your new phone system or contact center with free assessments that help you prioritize feature sets, sort through industry noise and secure the most competitive price point.
recommendationsReceived.context: Jordan worked with Chris but they were at different companies
recommendationsReceived.description: Chris is incredibly knowledgeable as it relates to all things IT and Security. His candor and communication style is authentic, well informed and highly entertaining.  I had the opportunity work with him as part of a Security Webinar Series in the fall and his contributions made the event an absolute blast and our customers came away with quality content and insights. I can't recommend him enough.

recommendationsReceived.name: James Guthrie, CISSP
recommendationsReceived.subtitle: ZeroInfoSec | Cyber and Fraud Centre | Professional Services | Breaking your stuff then showing you how to fix it
recommendationsReceived.context: James worked with Chris on the same team
recommendationsReceived.description:
Chris and I worked together on a gig where we were putting together a mobile application in the cryptocurrency space. His extensive experience in security and project management was eye-opening, and it really put the project on the path to success.
His personality is lovable and everybody he met in our time working together continues to speak about him with admiration.
Would work with you again in a heartbeat, brother.

recommendationsReceived.description: Chris was my primary client when I was engaged to run several projects for Sports Authority. Chris was a challenge and a delight to work with; he brought extensive knowledge and expertise combined with an extremely high energy level to the work, and was always willing to go above and beyond what was required. However, he also was able to balance his dedication to the work with the ability to care about his team, and to provide resources and support as necessary. I would be happy to work with him again.

Given what was achieved (both a huge increase in our capability to adhere to the various regulatory and compliance initiatives, AND a decrease in the cost of our insurance) and what impact she had (huge is an understatement) I would, given any opportunity, be more than happy to work with, recommend, or simply have the time to hang out with Terra at any time. She is truly a fantastic person both professionally and personally. ‘Nuff said. :)

recommendations.context: Chris worked with Richard on the same team
recommendations.description: Richard and I have collaborated, coordinated, conspired, and completed a heap of both formal and informal projects together over the years. Primarily around the .Mil and .Gov space, and often involving juggling multiple teams, folks, functions, and objectives all the while planning exercises for Guard teams across the US. Welcome to the world of Shield and Yankee training. His guidance, counsel, knowledge, and leadership have shone through time and time again and have enabled all those around him to be as efficient and effective as they possibly could be. Richard’s knowledge of all IT, InfoSec, and Digital/Physical domains enables him to hand out advice, knowledge, and guidance at the drop of a hat, and for that AND the simple fact he is both a friend AND family I thank him for everything… oh, that and he’s rather damm good at knowing which bottle of Whisky or Bourbon would be relevant to situational awareness too!

recommendations.name: Christopher G. Johnson
recommendations.subtitle: Story-Driven Virtual Event Producer | Zoom Expert | 🎤 Public Radio Host | Helping Mission-Driven Teams Communicate with Clarity
recommendations.context: Chris worked with Christopher G. on the same team
recommendations.description:
I’ve had the pleasure of listening to, and interacting with Christopher a number of times now. Each time, each instance has been a pleasure to be a part of the experience. He has one of those voices and mannerisms that simply puts you at ease, reduces any tensions in a topic and takes command of a room or situation in a well meaning, encompassing manner that is both kind and collaborative in nature. 

His ability to talk on a number of topics from a position of knowledge, and his readiness to share that information without hesitation also, especially in today’s world is rather unique and well appreciated by his audience.

Christopher is one of those rare breed of speakers that I’d happily sit back and listen to AND know that time has been VERY well spent.

recommendations.name: Rachel Arnold
recommendations.subtitle: The Human API | Vendor Management | BSides NOLA | ISACA Board Member
recommendations.context: Chris worked with Rachel but they were at different companies
recommendations.description:
So where do we start here? How about with the fact that Rachel is an amazing communicator, collaborator, coordinator and contributor. So, soft skills covered. Then we get to being able to hold folks accountable through knowing the technology well enough to distinguish between what’s real and what’s likely been sprinkled with pixie dust and marketing BS…. So be warned, go into conversations with integrity and honesty and you’ll be fine… anything less than that and expect to be called out (rightly so)
Work ethics, check. (And double checked as she’s always taken time to ensure things are doing what’s necessary/when necessary etc.)
Contributing to the community? Heaps and heaps here…. From online presence to in person (when the world allows) a ton of mission before money examples.
Overall, would happily hang out, work with and be part of any project Rachel’s a part of.

recommendations.name: David H.
recommendations.subtitle: Information Security Professional | CISSP | CRISC
recommendations.context: Chris worked with David on the same team
recommendations.description: Dave and I first met MANY years ago, and the conversation started as so many have "hey, what do you do...." to which the response was "I break into banks and other things" From that moment we've worked together, crossed paths at different companies, hung out at more conferences than I care to try and document and have spent the last 10 year or more working to try and bring some order to the chaos of InfoSec/Technology etc. Dave's bloody fantastic AND is one of those rare breeds of technology folks who actually knows, understands AND can deal with paperwork... Long may this continue!

headline: Strategic Communications Leader | Performance, Wellness & Culture | Brand Builder Across Travel, Tech & Consumer
jobLocation: New York, New York, United States
addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
about:
Communications leader with a storyteller’s soul and a strategist’s mind. I’ve spent my career shaping narratives for global brands across luxury, lifestyle, tech, and aviation—crafting bold positioning, building executive visibility, and navigating high-stakes moments with clarity and calm.

Known for blending emotional intelligence with sharp business acumen, I lead with empathy, think fast in complex situations, and bring a rare ability to distill noise into narrative. Whether launching a new category, managing a brand through crisis, or architecting a founder’s voice, I thrive at the intersection of culture, media, and momentum.

Also, deeply human, unafraid to evolve, and always chasing the next big idea—with a good espresso.

Core Expertise:
- Executive Thought Leadership – Positioning C-suite leaders as industry visionaries in sustainability, innovation, and wellness.
- Marketing Strategy & Brand Storytelling – Developing integrated campaigns that drive visibility, engagement, and brand loyalty across luxury, travel, and lifestyle sectors.
- Crisis & Reputation Management – Designing proactive frameworks that protect brands during leadership transitions, market expansions, and high-impact moments.
- Customer Experience & Retention – Enhancing customer journeys through strategic engagement, fostering long-term loyalty and high-value relationships.
- Event Leadership – Spearheading high-profile activations, including press trips, influencer campaigns, and immersive brand experiences.

Proven Impact:
- Increased brand awareness by 15% and boosted social engagement by 30% through targeted, data-driven campaigns.
- Directed strategic partnerships with luxury hospitality icons like Ritz Paris, Pulitzer Amsterdam, and Conservatorium Hotel.
- Achieved 85% internal engagement rates via comprehensive employee communications frameworks.
- Led major industry events, including Met Gala, CFDA Awards, and New York Fashion Week.

Passion for Wellness & Travel:
As someone who has collaborated extensively with wellness, fitness, and lifestyle brands, I understand the power of storytelling to create transformative experiences. I am passionate about designing campaigns that inspire people to embrace fulfilling, balanced lifestyles through travel, fitness, and wellness.

headline: I help thought leaders, consultants, and coaches amplify their impact through books that grow authority and leave a legacy.
about:
Through my agency, Audience Granted Ghostwriters, I help coaches, consultants, and therapists turn their expertise into books that grow their authority, expand their brand, and leave a lasting impact.

For many of my clients, their book becomes the ultimate credibility marker—something they can point to when booking speaking gigs, attracting new clients, or sharing their proven framework with the world.

WHO I HELP
* Coaches & Consultants: Business, leadership, and mindset experts who want a book that builds authority, expands their reach, and opens doors for speaking engagements, collaborations, and other opportunities to showcase their expertise.

* Therapists & Mental Health Pros: Professionals ready to amplify their impact beyond one-on-one sessions and build a recognizable brand that attracts clients and opportunities.

(I also work with other genres and clients—if you’re looking to write a memoir/fiction, or if you're an ESL author with a story to share, please reach out!)

HOW I HELP

* Ghostwriting & Book Coaching: Transforming your ideas into a compelling, publish-ready manuscript—done with you or for you.
* Editing & Development: Guiding you through revisions so your book shines in your authentic voice.
* Strategic Support: Connecting you with trusted editors, cover designers, and publishers so your book reaches the world professionally.

WHY WORK WITH ME?
Clients often tell me, “You sound like me!”—the highest compliment I could get. My gift is capturing your voice, your vision, and your expertise so your book connects with the people who need it most.

With decades of writing experience and a deep passion for storytelling, I’ve helped entrepreneurs, professionals, and storytellers craft books that inspire, teach, and transform.

ABOUT ME:
I’ve been writing in some form all my life—from a 200-page thesis as a non-traditional student, to PR for a nonprofit, to ghostwriting books that change lives. I founded Audience Granted Ghostwriters in 2021 to blend my love of writing with my mission: helping people who help others.

LET'S CONNECT!
If you’ve been saying, “Someday I’ll write a book,” maybe today’s the day to start. Visit www.audiencegranted.com or message me—I’d love to hear about your vision.

Whether you're 
     *     a subject matter expert wanting to establish your authority, 
     *     a counseling practice trying to keep your website fresh, or 
     *     just wanting to cross "write a book" off your bucket list,
Audience Granted welcomes the chance to serve you. Schedule your 30-minute vision consultation today. Your message deserves it.

Writers and aspiring authors - don't miss this!

I'm interviewing writing coach and former English professor Emily Anderson of The Red Pen Writing Support.

What we'll look at:
     1. What makes storytelling such a powerful teaching tool
     2. The concept of "show not tell" in fiction and how to apply it in non-fiction
     3. Ways to incorporate storytelling in your non-fiction writing
     4. How to improve your storytelling skills

We'll end with a 10-minute Q & A. I'll post the Zoom link a day or two ahead of time!
Letter of recommendation
