updates.postText:
Want to have more impact with your online writing and email newsletters? Check out these tips in my latest article.
#writing #email #howtowriteonlinecontent

WEBSITE LAUNCH! 
Yes! The day is finally here. My online storefront is ready for the public! 
Please SHARE or COMMENT - and of course, visit the site! (LinkedIn works better for shares and comments than for likes.)
My business is Audience Granted Ghostwriters. 
What does AGG do?
We write books, blogs, articles, and more for people who need content or want to be an author but don't have the time, "brain space," skills, or confidence.
Wanna find out more? Check out my website . . . 
(Yay! I can actually say that now!)
www.audiencegranted.com

A few months ago, I felt on the verge of collapse. My thesis deadline was approaching, I was out of a job, and I was DIYing my wedding. Minor frustrations left me in tears every other day. Sleep eluded me, and no matter how hard I pushed, I couldn't manage even a flexible timeline. That's when I learned something about myself: I am Not Lazy, but I can be Lazy about being Not Lazy. Confused? Let me explain: I stink at resting. Don't Stop Now! My therapist reminded me that I have a deep-seated fear of Being Lazy. I'm not lazy, as she pointed out, but this fear can drive me. In fact, I can hyperfocus on tasks so much that I don't eat, drink, or take bathroom breaks! I work hard to accomplish everything on my plate on time. But I have a tendency not to give my mind, body, and soul adequate time off to refresh and restore. And if I do, I feel guilty or pressured by deadlines: "I could be doing X right now!" Sound familiar? Even if you drive yourself in different ways than I do, you may identify with the pressure or guilt. Let me introduce you to its source. "The Madwoman in the Attic" I recently read the book Burnout: The Secret to Unlocking the Stress Cycle. In it, sisters Emily Nagoski and Amelia Nagoski reference the secret, insane wife of Mr. Rochester from Jane Eyre. Like Mr. Rochester, they say, many people have a "madwoman in the attic" who influences their behavior. Our inner critic can evolve from different sources. It may come from things people said or did to us as children. We may be listening to the entertainment world, church, or society telling us what we should be. Wherever it comes from, though, the voice can become a constant whisper in our subconscious. Well, just get rid of that "madwoman," right? Believe it or not, the Nagoski sisters state that people often resist silencing her. The reason? Many people believe that they owe their successes to their inner critic. In other words, the Nagoski sisters are saying that we think we need that crazy lady. If we don't drive ourselves, how can we succeed? Reframe/Re-name Success is possible without the crazy lady, I learned. But, it requires a paradigm shift. Reframing can help us manage the madwoman without upsetting her. For me, I had to change some labels. "Lazy" days or afternoons are now "rest" days or afternoons. Perpetual motion? That is not the opposite of laziness. In fact, it could mean I am too lazy to make the effort to rest! And, if I have a few minutes of downtime, I now remind myself that if I spend them taking it easy, that is "productive," too. Grow Flowers, not Weeds At a recent webinar, the topic of gardens came up. It went like this: imagine a patch of ground you want to turn into a garden. You remove all the weeds and prepare the soil. But, if you don't put something you want in the ground, guess what? The weeds will come back! From a scientific perspective, we need to find ways to change the neural pathways in our brains. Let's say it another way: replace bad habits with good habits, bad thoughts with good ones. I had to be deliberate about replacing both. Now, I schedule times to read or watch movies. I also schedule breaks each workday to walk around the block, meditate, or do stretches. That's not all, though. During at least one break, I read positive affirmations. After all, it isn't enough to tell my madwoman that she's lying; I have to replace her lies with truth! Conclusion: Self-Love If you're like me, buzz words like "self-love" or "self-compassion," may get on your nerves. Stick with me a moment, though. Love does not equal indulgence. Indulgence focuses on what its object wants at the moment, but love works for its object's ultimate best interests. What feels right at the moment to move towards your goal may not be what's best for you. Take a step back and evaluate: is it worth it to "gain the world but lose your soul?" Remember, your madwoman may get you what you think you want. She may carry you to "success." Problem is, she will destroy you in the process. What is the key, then? Love your madwoman; love yourself. Learn from my mistake: don't be lazy about resting! #self-love #self-compassion #burnout #stressed

recommendations.description: I cannot say enough about Ryan as a business coach. I interviewed no fewer than seven coaches,and all had something of value to offer, but from the moment I talked to Ryan, there was never any question: she worked one-on-one with me (rather than in a group), first doing an in-depth skills and personality assessment to ensure he coaching was tailored to who I am as a business owner. The confidence and understanding I gained through working with her were incredible, and I doubled my revenue during the time we worked together from the year before! The was always a listening and understanding ear, not pushing when I didn't need it, but nudging me along when I did. If you're looking to significantly up your game in business with someone who will work with your unique personality as a business owner, Ryan's your girl!

headline: Corporate and Financial Communications | Tech | Business Insider Rising Star in PR
jobLocation: New York, New York, United States
addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
about:
I have 15 years of experience in public relations, marketing, brand management, and communications, with a particular focus on all things tech. My work spans corporate, financial, and change management communications. Over the course of my career, I’ve advised all sizes of companies - startups to Fortune 100 - on everything from media relations and thought leadership to executive visibility and crisis management. I’ve also helped businesses navigate major events like mergers and acquisitions, SPACs, and IPOs. My expertise covers both public and private markets, with a focus on areas like enterprise tech, cloud, AI/VR, payments, e-commerce, and MarTech/AdTech.

I’ve had the privilege of securing top-tier media coverage for big announcements across outlets like CNBC, Fox Business, CNN, Bloomberg, and The Wall Street Journal. Before joining TRI, I worked at Hotwire, a global tech consultancy, helping lead some of the agencies largest clients, eBay and PANW, for corporate and financial comms. Prior to Hotwire, I worked at ICR, where I guided companies through communications strategies at various stages, including public market debuts for brands like UiPath, Braze, Procore, and Couchbase.

In 2023, I was honored to be named a 'Rising Star in PR' by Business Insider. I also led the communications strategy for Forge Global’s public listing, which earned Hotwire a mention as a finalist for 'Campaign of the Year' in PRNews' Platinum Awards for Finance/Fintech. Outside of work, I have mentored students through the Twin Cities PR BIPOC Career Explorer Program and was involved with Hotwire’s Allies in Action Committee. 

I live in Connecticut with my husband and our 6-year-old Australian Labradoodle, Lenox. In my spare time, I enjoy competing on the Peloton leaderboard, snowboarding, traveling the world, spending time at the beach, and exploring local breweries.

updates.postText:
What a pleasant surprise this morning receiving this news! Honored to be named a rising star by Insider Business 👏 Congratulations to all of the other recipients this year! 

Financial comms was newer to me a few years ago, and it has been a RIDE (c'mon, markets!), but I LOVE every single second of it - from strategy, messaging, monitoring sentiment, and execution 🔥 

Thank you to my colleague, Charlene Gage, for her thoughtfulness in the submission and to Hotwire for the trust and encouragement to build a program and run with it. Special shoutout to all those who have mentored or helped along the way - I appreciate each and every single one of you!

volunteerAndAwards.organization: Twin Cities PR BIPOC Career Explorer
volunteerAndAwards.description:
The Twin Cities PR BIPOC Career Exploration program was established in 2021 by six leading public relations agencies in the Twin Cities area. Created with the aim of cultivating diversity and inclusivity within the local industry, the program offers an externship opportunity tailored for college students with an interest in marketing and communications. By providing a platform for students from diverse backgrounds to explore and engage with the field, the program endeavors to foster a dynamic workforce reflective of a wide range of interests, perspectives, and lived experiences.

My role as a mentor:
- Provide personalized mentorship to college students enrolled in the Inclusive Communications Career Exploration externship program.
- Establish clear objectives and goals for mentorship sessions, aligning with student's career aspirations and program objectives.
- Conduct regular check-in meetings with mentees to assess progress, address challenges, and explore opportunities for growth.
- Offer tailored guidance and support to help students navigate their career exploration journey effectively, including resources, advice, and networking opportunities.
- Identify skill gaps and coach or recommend additional workshops, online courses, and practical exercises.
- Provide constructive feedback on students' work, presentations, and projects to aid in their professional development.
- Assist in creating career roadmaps, including resume building, job search strategies, and interview preparation.

headline: Global Communications Executive | Helping Leaders and Brands Build Trust and Reputation Through Strategic Communication
about: I’m a communications and public relations executive with 15 years of experience helping brands and leaders tell stories that connect, inspire, and build trust. My work sits at the intersection of strategy and storytelling translating complex ideas into narratives that resonate.Over the years, I’ve led communications in-house and at agencies working with organizations through transformation and growth, while guiding  executives on positioning, visibility, and reputation. I’ve built PR functions from the ground up, developed global storytelling strategies, and led high-performing teams that deliver results.I believe in the new communications engine: one that integrates traditional and modern media, where owned, earned, internal, and external storytelling all work together. I’m passionate about the future of communications and how technology and culture will shape what comes next.

experiences.title: Public Relations Communications Consultant
experiences.jobDescription:
Partnering with founders, executives and brands to design and execute strategic communications that build long-term trust and reputation.

Advising on messaging architecture, narrative development and storytelling that aligns with business objectives and stakeholder expectations.

Leading media and PR strategy: from positioning and thought leadership to launch plans, press materials, and journalist relationships across key markets.

experiences.title: Deputy Managing Director and Head of Communications
experiences.jobDescription:
Global Communications Strategy | Executive Thought Leadership | Agency Operations

Lead client services and strategic communications for 4–6 high-profile clients across technology, media, and consumer sectors. Client highlights: Gary Vaynerchuk, Jim Kwik, Kass & Mike Lazerow, VeeFriends, Vayner3, Coca-Cola, JP Morgan Chase, Tracer, Arabic AI, and NBPA.

Strategic Leadership: Direct and execute comprehensive communication strategies, acting as the senior point of contact for all clients while aligning storytelling, media strategy, and reputation objectives with business goals.

Narrative Development: Craft all messaging, key stories, and written materials for both internal and external communications.

Executive Positioning: Drive visibility for executive leadership through curated media opportunities, podcasts, speaking engagements, and thought-leadership placements to elevate their public profiles and credibility.

Media Relations: Build and sustain strong relationships with top-tier journalists, editors, and producers to secure coverage across leading outlets and seed stories that shape public perception.

Collaborative Partnerships: Work cross-functionally with brand partners, marketing teams, and other PR agencies to align messaging and mamimize impact across integrated campaigns and launches.

Operational Excellence: Designed and implemented core agency processes and systems, including client onboarding frameworks, reporting structures, media databases, and team workflows; creating scalable infrastructure to support growth and efficiency.

Executive Readiness: Prepare key talking points, media briefs, and event messaging for interviews, public appearances, and live events, ensuring consistent narrative alignment and strategic storytelling.

headline: Chief Operating Officer + Senior Partner at Global Gateway Advisors | Communications Strategist + Executive Leader — Corporate, C-suite, Media + Events, Crisis + Issues
jobTitle: Chief Operating Officer + Sr. Partner | AOR Lead for Indeed, Glassdoor, Recruit Holdings, Qualtrics
addressWithCountry: New York, New York, United States
about:
For more than 10 years at Global Gateway Advisors, I’ve worked with C-suite executives at a wide range of Fortune 1000 companies. I’m trusted as a strategist and advisor, navigating senior leaders around the world through transformations, crises, and complex changes.

My expertise includes: Strategic Communications | Corporate Communications | Executive Visibility | Thought Leadership | Global and Industry Events | Crisis Management | Reputation Management | Media Relations

I focus on elevating C-suite thought leadership, visibility, and stakeholder engagement by cultivating relationships with world’s leading media organizations and orchestrating high-profile, industry-leading global events.

I help tackle challenges and deliver solutions that protect corporations from reputational risk. I have deep experience working across corporate functions including communications, marketing, government affairs, economic research, product, operations, HR, and Legal. 

As the communications and AI landscape rapidly changes, I create narratives that enable organizations to shift and adopt new practices to drive their visibility and preference. My leadership at Global Gateway Advisors has led to firmwide GenAI adoption and integration with a dedicated policy, tools, and training that is enabling us to maximize the technology’s capabilities both internally and externally for our clients.

I’ve built a unique perspective on corporate communications and strategies due to extensive experience with our diverse client portfolio across industry sectors, market segments, and global geographies. I leverage these experiences to inform our future client engagements and communications programs.

experiences.title: Chief Operating Officer + Sr. Partner | AOR Lead for Indeed, Glassdoor, Recruit Holdings, Qualtrics
experiences.jobDescription:
As one of Global Gateway Advisors' first hires and the first employee to become partner, I’ve grown with the firm. Today I work with Fortune 1000 CEOs, CCOs, and other C-suite executives to provide communications strategies and programs that create thought leadership, capture mission-critical opportunities, and enable effective, timely corporate response to complex challenges ranging from AI adoption and implementation to crises, issues, and special situations. 

I lead the firm's Leadership Engagement Opportunity (LEO) offering, which positions executives and companies at the world's leading events and convenings, including the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting, APEC CEO Summit, Fortune Global Forum, Fortune Brainstorm Tech and AI, Semafor World Economy Summit, and Wall Street Journal CEO Council and Tech Council Summits.

In my role as COO, I provide strategic direction and oversight for a range of agency operations, including finance, marketing, business development, and IT and security. I share P&L responsibility with the rest of the C-suite and lead a team of Managing Directors and Directors.

experiences.title: Vice President | Led Corporate Communications for Teva Pharmaceuticals
Vice President, Reputation Management
experiences.jobDescription: Promoted through five progressive roles, I led reputation management and crisis and issues response programs for a wide range of global clients, including AT&T, Carnival, McNeil Consumer Healthcare (Tylenol), Hyatt Hotels, General Motors, Chobani and The Local Search Association.

experiences.title: Senior Account Executive, Corporate + Public Affairs

updates.postText:
🎉 Congratulations to SEMAFOR on its three-year anniversary and another successful World Economy Summit in Washington, DC!

#Client highlights from the stage:

💭 In a 1:1 session on Being an AI-First Company, Qualtrics CEO Zig Serafin emphasized that "the magic of AI comes to life when you actually focus on contextually applying it to pragmatic problems on a daily level. Not chasing revolutionizing the world... but being able to do things more efficiently, but also the right way that your brand wants to express itself those moments of delight, or moments of fixing things."

💭 During a panel on the Global AI Workforce, Indeed Chief Economist Svenja Gudell noted that while AI adoption in the workplace remains low, worker anxiety is rising.  Looking ahead, she shared: "It's not about, 'is AI going to take my job?' It's about the person who knows how to use AI really well that's going to take your job." 

Looking forward to Spring Edition of the Summit, where 400 global CEOs are expected to attend over five days - rivaling Davos in leadership presence.

Reflecting on an amazing week at the APEC CEO Summit Korea 2025 in Gyeongju – featuring President Trump and 10 other world leaders, the CEOs of NVIDIA, Citi and Johnson & Johnson, and more.

Congratulations to the Korea Chamber of Commerce and Industry and our Global Gateway Advisors team for delivering world-class media engagement and coverage — supported by 10 top-tier international media partners, including Bloomberg, Caixin Global, CGTN, CNBC, Economist Impact, Fortune, Financial Times, Foreign Affairs, Time Inc., and The Wall Street Journal.

Big thank you to our moderators Shery Ahn, Nicholas Gordon, Tian Wei and Wang Shou for steering insightful sessions with government and business leaders on critical topics – from the future of international trade and AI deployment to energy security and sustainability.

Grateful to National Center for APEC and Asia Inc Forum for their collaboration in ensuring corporate sponsors had an exceptional experience with media onsite, and to FleishmanHillard Korea for partnering with us to deliver a positive experience for international media onsite.

Hard to believe this was my 10th APEC CEO Summit! This premier annual business event have been a highlight of my career – taking me to Honolulu, Lima, Da Nang, Port Moresby, Santiago, Bangkok, and now Gyeongju.  Look forward to continuing the journey next year in Shenzen, China!

#APECCEOSummit #APEC2025

Matthew Doering Elizabeth Frenaye Jesse S. Monica Hardy Whaley Barbara Hazzard Alex Parle Loraine Ashcraft Castillo Andrew Dy Serene Chew Andy Clarke Lauren Lau Chee Sheng Leong Eunice Yoon Yolande Chee Jons Pette Minnie Wong Khoon Fong Ang Monica Sembler Sarah Thompson Kay Tse Joni Rasmusson

🎉 Congratulations to Indeed and Fortune on the inaugural Fortune Workplace Innovation Summit in Dana Point, CA this week!  

It was an energizing gathering of top #CHROs and #CPOs, filled with insightful, actionable content and meaningful networking—all focused on helping organizations thrive in today’s rapidly evolving, AI-driven workplace.

Great things happen when you bring great partners together. #Fortune #Indeed #Glassdoor

Highlights include:

➡️ Indeed CEO Chris Hyams: “The good news is that there’s not a single job anywhere that AI can perform all of the skills required for that job. It doesn’t mean it won’t replace workers, but AI can’t completely replace a job…. I may be in the minority, but I disagree with the concept of fewer people in the workforce.” Read more: https://lnkd.in/eusvEGXG

➡️ Glassdoor CEO Christian Sutherland-Wong: “If you look at what makes top quartile companies stand out, it's leadership skills around being transparent, being empathetic, the ways you engage your team. The companies that have been best at this over the last several decades are the companies who have been outperforming.”

#FortuneWorkplaceSummit #FutureofWork #AI

Another #APECCEOSummit in the books! 
🌍 9 world leaders
📈 CEOs from J.P. Morgan's Jamie Dimon to TikTok's Shou Chew
📺 10(!) international media partners

I'm grateful to clients Luciano Paredes, Luis Guillermo Pareja Ugarte, Luciana Flores Luna and Allen Lai, and my colleagues Matthew Doering, MaryJo Fitzgerald, Elizabeth Frenaye, Devan Gallagher and Jalondra J. who helped bring this event to life. 

While a recent back injury 🩼 kept me stateside this year, I'm on the mend and looking ahead to #APEC2025 in Korea!

Proud of our work at #FortuneGlobalForum and grateful to our clients and Fortune for the opportunity to drive the CEO agenda together.

Scott Dobroski Victoria Chen Norland Jennifer Oliveras Emily Heffter Amanda Livingood
Diane Brady Maria Ebrahimji Michael Orme Janis Scott Monica Sembler
